## Other information

### Affiliation

[Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith") (secretly)[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)

[[Source]](https://starwars.fandom.com/wiki/Template:Government)

:   "*Imperius Unitada ober Totallex*"
:   ―[Atrisian Basic](/wiki/Atrisian_Basic "Atrisian Basic") motto and name of a [propaganda piece](/wiki/Imperius_Unitada_ober_Totallex "Imperius Unitada ober Totallex"), literally translating to "Empire united over all"[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5)

The **Galactic Empire**, also known as the **First Galactic Empire** or simply the **Empire**, and later as the **Old Empire**, was the [dictatorship](/wiki/Dictatorship "Dictatorship") that [replaced](/wiki/Proclamation_of_the_New_Order "Proclamation of the New Order") the [Galactic Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic") at the [end](/wiki/Battle_of_Utapau "Battle of Utapau") of the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars"). Though the Empire rose to power by promising to bring order to [the galaxy](/wiki/The_galaxy "The galaxy"), it oversaw a [period](/wiki/Time "Time") of [military](/wiki/Imperial_Military "Imperial Military") rule and aggressive expansion. The subsequent [Imperial Era](/wiki/Imperial_Era "Imperial Era") would last only two [decades](/wiki/Standard_decade "Standard decade"), for it was eventually overthrown by the [Alliance to Restore the Republic](/wiki/Alliance_to_Restore_the_Republic "Alliance to Restore the Republic") in the [Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War"), but not before the sovereign [star systems](/wiki/Star_system "Star system") of the [galaxy](/wiki/Galaxy "Galaxy") had been largely conquered by the Empire's forces.

The Empire traced its origins to a [Sith conspiracy](/wiki/Grand_Plan "Grand Plan") to destroy the [Jedi Order](/wiki/Jedi_Order "Jedi Order") and [regain](/wiki/Jedi-Sith_War "Jedi-Sith War") control over the galaxy. The Empire was secretly controlled by the [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith"), for the [Galactic Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic Emperor") was, in fact, the [Sith Lord](/wiki/Sith_Lord "Sith Lord") [Darth Sidious](/wiki/Darth_Sidious "Darth Sidious"), whose reign was enforced by his [apprentice](/wiki/Sith_apprentice "Sith apprentice"), [Darth Vader](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker"), whom he eventually elevated to the position of [supreme commander of the Imperial fleet](/wiki/Supreme_commander_of_the_Imperial_fleet "Supreme commander of the Imperial fleet"). Rising to power on a groundswell of populist support and capitalizing on [anti-Jedi](/wiki/Anti-Jedi_sentiment "Anti-Jedi sentiment") and [anti-droid sentiment](/wiki/Anti-droid_sentiment "Anti-droid sentiment") and [human](/wiki/Human "Human")-[ethnocentrism](/wiki/Xenophobia "Xenophobia") manufactured by the destructive Clone Wars, [Darth](/wiki/Darth "Darth") Sidious appointed himself [Emperor](/wiki/Emperor "Emperor") at the end of the conflict by promising security and stability to the war-torn Republic. Gaining the overwhelming approval of the [Galactic Senate](/wiki/Galactic_Senate "Galactic Senate"), Darth Sidious staged a coup by the [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") and oversaw their subsequent [purge](/wiki/Great_Jedi_Purge "Great Jedi Purge") from the galaxy, assisted by his [right-hand](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Fist "Emperor's Fist"), Darth Vader.

The Empire stood virtually unchallenged during its rise to power, with the backing of the [Imperial Senate](/wiki/Imperial_Senate "Imperial Senate") and the spreading of its massive technological military force across the galaxy and began a major expansion and encroaching into the unexplored regions. At first, the Galactic Empire was a constitutional monarchy in basic theory, however it [gradually](/wiki/Public_Order_Resentencing_Directive "Public Order Resentencing Directive") [evolved](/wiki/Imperial_Emergency_Act "Imperial Emergency Act") into a [stratocracy](/wiki/Stratocracy "Stratocracy") as the power of the Imperial Senate waned. However, numerous insurgent cells sprang up against the Empire and gradually united to initiate a [growing rebellion](/wiki/Early_rebellion_against_the_Galactic_Empire "Early rebellion against the Galactic Empire"), winning its [first major victory](/wiki/Action_at_Mustafar "Action at Mustafar") over [Mustafar](/wiki/Mustafar "Mustafar") in [4 BBY](/wiki/4_BBY "4 BBY"). These rebel groups eventually [formed](/wiki/Declaration_of_Rebellion "Declaration of Rebellion") the Rebel Alliance in [2 BBY](/wiki/2_BBY "2 BBY"), and achieved its first major victory with the [theft](/wiki/Battle_of_Scarif "Battle of Scarif") of the [Death Star plans](/wiki/Death_Star_plans "Death Star plans") on [Scarif](/wiki/Scarif "Scarif"), which, in turn, led to the destruction of the [Death Star](/wiki/DS-1_Orbital_Battle_Station "DS-1 Orbital Battle Station") at the [Battle of Yavin](/wiki/Battle_of_Yavin "Battle of Yavin"). The following years saw initial Alliance successes until a [major Imperial victory](/wiki/Battle_of_Hoth "Battle of Hoth") on [Hoth](/wiki/Hoth "Hoth") in [3 ABY](/wiki/3_ABY "3 ABY"), but the Empire suffered a devastating defeat [one year later](/wiki/4_ABY "4 ABY") at the [Battle of Endor](/wiki/Battle_of_Endor "Battle of Endor"). During the battle, Darth Sidious was slain at the hands of his former disciple, the redeemed Anakin Skywalker, who himself died shortly thereafter, marking the end of Sith rule and the deterioration of the Empire and the [resumption](/wiki/Declaration_of_a_New_Republic "Declaration of a New Republic") of the Galactic Republic, the [New Republic](/wiki/New_Republic "New Republic").

With the deaths of the Emperor and his top lieutenant, factionalism overcame the Empire as it fractured into breakaway fiefdoms led by splinter [Moffs](/wiki/Moff "Moff"), [admirals](/wiki/Admiral "Admiral"), and [generals](/wiki/General "General"), many of whom ignored [Grand Vizier](/wiki/Grand_Vizier "Grand Vizier") [Mas Amedda](/wiki/Mas_Amedda "Mas Amedda")'s authority at the [capital](/wiki/Capital "Capital") and became [warlords](/wiki/Warlord "Warlord") as the Empire continued to fight the Republic. The [Imperial Navy](/wiki/Imperial_Navy "Imperial Navy") came to be publicly led by loyalist [Grand Admiral](/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral") [Rae Sloane](/wiki/Rae_Sloane "Rae Sloane"), though she was a figurehead for [Fleet Admiral](/wiki/Fleet_Admiral "Fleet Admiral") [Gallius Rax](/wiki/Gallius_Rax "Gallius Rax"). Ultimately, Rax seized control over the loyalist forces, removing Sloane from power and becoming Emperor-in-effect through his new position as [Counselor to the Empire](/wiki/Counselor_to_the_Empire "Counselor to the Empire"). Under Rax's command, the Empire made its final stand at the [Battle of Jakku](/wiki/Battle_of_Jakku "Battle of Jakku") in [5 ABY](/wiki/5_ABY "5 ABY"), ultimately losing and [capitulating](/wiki/Imperial_Instruments_of_Surrender "Imperial Instruments of Surrender") to the New Republic. With the cessation of the fighting, the [Galactic Concordance](/wiki/Galactic_Concordance "Galactic Concordance") was signed, vanquishing the Empire.

While the Empire was gone, its [replacement](/wiki/New_Republic_Era "New Republic Era") of the New Republic faced continued resistance from several Imperial holdouts [in the years](/wiki/9_ABY "9 ABY") after. Meanwhile the [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order"), a [military](/wiki/First_Order_military "First Order military") organization dedicated to rebuilding the Empire, [began](/wiki/Project_Resurrection "Project Resurrection") a clandestine armament program. They were unaware, however, that they had been manipulated by a new hidden [conspiracy](/wiki/Contingency "Contingency"), for [secret](/wiki/Sith_Eternal "Sith Eternal") [cultists](/wiki/Sith_cultist "Sith cultist") on the lost [world](/wiki/Planet "Planet") of [Exegol](/wiki/Exegol "Exegol") attended to the [spirit](/wiki/Transference "Transference") of Darth Sidious, and constructed a [fleet](/wiki/Final_Order "Final Order") built to herald a new [Sith Empire](/wiki/Sith_Empire "Sith Empire"). The [cult](/wiki/Sith_cult "Sith cult") efforts [ultimately failed](/wiki/Battle_of_Exegol "Battle of Exegol"), however, for they were [opposed](/wiki/First_Order-Resistance_War "First Order-Resistance War") by the [Resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance") and Jedi Order, leading to an [end of the First Order](/wiki/Uprising_against_the_First_Order "Uprising against the First Order").

## History[]

### Early foundations[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Invasion of Naboo](/wiki/Invasion_of_Naboo "Invasion of Naboo"), [Supreme Chancellor election, 32 BBY](/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor_election,_32_BBY "Supreme Chancellor election, 32 BBY") and [Separatist Crisis](/wiki/Separatist_Crisis "Separatist Crisis")

:   "*I have good news for you, my Lord. The war has begun.*"  
    "*Excellent. Everything is going as planned.*"
:   ―Darth Tyranus and Darth Sidious — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/99/TheWarHasBegun-AOTC.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250403184749)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:TheWarHasBegun-AOTC.flac "File:TheWarHasBegun-AOTC.flac"))[[29]](#cite_note-Episode_II-29)

The Imperial ideals of the Galactic Empire could be dated back to the [Sith Empire](/wiki/Sith_Empire "Sith Empire") of the [Old Republic's](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic") time period.[[30]](#cite_note-Squadrons-30) Following the [defeat of the Sith](/wiki/Defeat_of_the_Sith "Defeat of the Sith") during their [final war](/wiki/Jedi-Sith_War "Jedi-Sith War") with the [Jedi Order](/wiki/Jedi_Order "Jedi Order"),[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5) for at least a thousand [years](/wiki/Standard_year "Standard year"), the dominant governing body of [the galaxy](/wiki/The_galaxy "The galaxy") was the unicameral, parliamentary, and [democratic](/wiki/Democracy "Democracy") Galactic Republic, which was governed by the [Galactic Senate](/wiki/Galactic_Senate "Galactic Senate") and led by an elected [Supreme Chancellor](/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor "Supreme Chancellor").[[29]](#cite_note-Episode_II-29)[[31]](#cite_note-Episode_I-31)

 [![Sheev Palpatine was the public persona of Darth Sidious, who conspired to restore Sith rule across the galaxy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Rise-of-Palpatine.png/revision/latest?cb=20210906014529) [![Sheev Palpatine was the public persona of Darth Sidious, who conspired to restore Sith rule across the galaxy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Rise-of-Palpatine.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210906014529)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Rise-of-Palpatine.png/revision/latest?cb=20210906014529) 

Sheev Palpatine was the public persona of Darth Sidious, who conspired to restore Sith rule across the galaxy.

 

In the [last decades](/wiki/Republic_Era "Republic Era") of its existence, the Republic Senate became embroiled in bureaucracy, rendering it woefully ineffectual as a governing body. [Darth Sidious](/wiki/Darth_Sidious "Darth Sidious"), the [Dark Lord of the Sith](/wiki/Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith "Dark Lord of the Sith") known publicly as [Senator](/wiki/Senator "Senator") Sheev Palpatine of [Naboo](/wiki/Naboo "Naboo"), privately lamented the declining state of the Senate, noting that the Republic was "not what it once was."[[31]](#cite_note-Episode_I-31)[[32]](#cite_note-TLO-32)

[Thirteen years](/wiki/32_BBY "32 BBY") before the Republic's end as a democracy, Darth Sidious orchestrated the [Invasion of Naboo](/wiki/Invasion_of_Naboo "Invasion of Naboo") by the [Trade Federation](/wiki/Trade_Federation "Trade Federation") in order to create a leadership crisis in the Senate. Sidious used the crisis to manipulate the then [Queen](/wiki/Monarch_of_Naboo "Monarch of Naboo") of [the Naboo](/wiki/Naboo_(people) "Naboo (people)"), [Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Padmé Amidala"), into calling a [Vote of No Confidence](/wiki/Vote_of_No_Confidence "Vote of No Confidence") against sitting Supreme Chancellor [Finis Valorum](/wiki/Finis_Valorum "Finis Valorum"). The vote passed, and in the subsequent election, Sidious—in his public persona of Senator Palpatine of [Naboo](/wiki/Naboo "Naboo")—secured the position of Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic for himself through a strong sympathy vote.[[31]](#cite_note-Episode_I-31) Ultimately, he would be the last individual to hold this office.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)

In the [decade](/wiki/Standard_decade "Standard decade") that followed, Sidious secretly manipulated galactic events to the extent that war became inevitable. Besides persuading a dead [Jedi Master](/wiki/Jedi_Master "Jedi Master"), [Sifo-Dyas](/wiki/Sifo-Dyas "Sifo-Dyas"), to create a [secret clone army](/wiki/Grand_Army_of_the_Republic "Grand Army of the Republic"), he also tasked his [Sith apprentice](/wiki/Sith_apprentice "Sith apprentice"), [Darth Tyranus](/wiki/Dooku "Dooku"), with exacerbating [political](/wiki/Politics "Politics") tensions in the Republic and engineering a [Separatist Crisis](/wiki/Separatist_Crisis "Separatist Crisis"). These actions would culminate in the [outbreak](/wiki/First_Battle_of_Geonosis "First Battle of Geonosis") of the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars") held on [Geonosis](/wiki/Geonosis "Geonosis"), the last conflict of the Republic, while Sidious himself "reluctantly" accepted emergency powers from the Senate.[[29]](#cite_note-Episode_II-29)[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) The Clone Wars, Sidious planned, would further make people in the galaxy grow bitter with the Republic[[33]](#cite_note-QH-33) while he centralized his power to sweep away the Republic and Jedi.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)

### Birth of the New Order[]

#### Drawn out conflict[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars")

:   "*I was not surprised that the Clone Wars paved the way for the Empire. The galaxy was in pieces, and everyone wanted to be done with the war. I don't think they realized the price they paid. Maybe they never will.*"
:   ―[Jet Kordo](/wiki/Jet_Kordo "Jet Kordo"), in his journal[[34]](#cite_note-Outlaws-34)

 [![Through the Clone Wars, Sidious strengthened his authority as Supreme Chancellor Palpatine of the Galactic Republic.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Do_Not_Bind_His_Hands.png/revision/latest?cb=20201011191544) [![Through the Clone Wars, Sidious strengthened his authority as Supreme Chancellor Palpatine of the Galactic Republic.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Do_Not_Bind_His_Hands.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20201011191544)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Do_Not_Bind_His_Hands.png/revision/latest?cb=20201011191544) 

Through the Clone Wars, Sidious strengthened his authority as Supreme Chancellor Palpatine of the Galactic Republic.

 

Since the onset of the Clone Wars[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) in [22 BBY](/wiki/22_BBY "22 BBY"),[[35]](#cite_note-Galactic_Atlas-35) the Republic endeavored to strengthen its security and stability through the creation of new organizations such as the [Commission for the Protection of the Republic](/wiki/Commission_for_the_Protection_of_the_Republic "Commission for the Protection of the Republic") (COMPOR), which utilized [propaganda](/wiki/Propaganda "Propaganda") to increase public morale, promote patriotism, and foster anti-Separatist sentiment within the general population.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) As the Republic became increasingly centralized, however, Chancellor Palpatine's powers continued to grow through additional assets ceded to the [Office of the Chancellor](/wiki/Office_of_the_Chancellor "Office of the Chancellor"), including the [galactic banking system](/wiki/InterGalactic_Banking_Clan "InterGalactic Banking Clan") that was placed under his direct oversight.[[36]](#cite_note-Crisis_at_the_Heart-36) This gave Sidious the finance he needed to build his empire.[[37]](#cite_note-Trivia_Gallery_Image_5-37) All the while, the war drained and broke the galactic populace's spirit, leaving them longing for any kind of peace.[[34]](#cite_note-Outlaws-34)

The Chancellor remained a popular leader for the duration of the war, having managed to stay in office at the will of the Senate for longer than his term permitted. As he consolidated and centralized his own power, his influence expanded to an unprecedented level while the Republic shifted from a democratic government to an increasingly militarized and authoritarian regime on the grounds of security and stability. In addition to his authority as [Commander-in-Chief](/wiki/Commander-in-Chief "Commander-in-Chief") of the [Republic Military](/wiki/Republic_Military "Republic Military"), the Chancellor exerted more control over the Senate, the [courts](/wiki/Supreme_Court "Supreme Court"),[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) and even the media, with [HoloNet News](/wiki/HoloNet_News "HoloNet News") becoming a state-run program in order to ensure that information would not be compromised by the [Confederacy of Independent Systems](/wiki/Confederacy_of_Independent_Systems "Confederacy of Independent Systems").[[38]](#cite_note-HoloNetDB-38) Sidious's hold over the Republic further expanded with additional amendments to the [Galactic Constitution](/wiki/Galactic_Constitution "Galactic Constitution")[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) while public support for the Jedi weakened as the war carried on,[[39]](#cite_note-Sabotage-39) paving the way for his ultimate ascension as [Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic Emperor") of the galaxy.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)

#### Proclaiming the Empire[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Proclamation of the New Order](/wiki/Proclamation_of_the_New_Order "Proclamation of the New Order") and [Great Jedi Purge](/wiki/Great_Jedi_Purge "Great Jedi Purge")

:   "*In order to ensure the security and continuing stability, the Republic will be reorganized into the first* Galactic Empire*! For a safe and secure society.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c1/Palpatine-Proclamation.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250403185141)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:Palpatine-Proclamation.flac "File:Palpatine-Proclamation.flac"))[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)

 [![The Jedi, having discovered Palpatine's secret identity, confronted the chancellor in his office on Coruscant.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/ItsTreasonThen-ROTS.png/revision/latest?cb=20130219041516) [![The Jedi, having discovered Palpatine's secret identity, confronted the chancellor in his office on Coruscant.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/ItsTreasonThen-ROTS.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130219041516)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/ItsTreasonThen-ROTS.png/revision/latest?cb=20130219041516) 

The Jedi, having discovered Palpatine's secret identity, confronted the chancellor in his office on Coruscant.

 

As the war neared its end[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) in [19 BBY](/wiki/19_BBY "19 BBY"),[[35]](#cite_note-Galactic_Atlas-35) the Jedi Order had grown skeptical about the Chancellor after his accumulation of emergency power. They began to suspect that a plot to destroy the [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") was close to fruition. The [ruling council](/wiki/Jedi_High_Council "Jedi High Council") started discussing forcibly removing Palpatine from office and temporarily overseeing the Senate in order to maintain political stability during the transition period. However, the Jedi learned of Palpatine's true identity as Dark Lord of the Sith, Darth Sidious. Following an attempt to arrest him, a [brief but vicious fight](/wiki/Duel_in_Palpatine%27s_office "Duel in Palpatine's office") ensued in which Sidious killed several Jedi and was himself injured and visibly disfigured. The intercession of [Jedi Knight](/wiki/Jedi_Knight "Jedi Knight") [Anakin Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker"), who was a personal friend of Chancellor Palpatine and already disillusioned with both the Order and the war, ensured Sidious's victory. The prodigal Jedi was turned to the [dark side of the Force](/wiki/Dark_side_of_the_Force "Dark side of the Force"), while Sidious had a pretext upon which to turn the Republic against the Jedi.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)

 [![The purging of the Jedi Order commenced with Order 66, which the clone troopers were programmed to obey.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/RexOrder66-Shattered.png/revision/latest?cb=20200505140733) [![The purging of the Jedi Order commenced with Order 66, which the clone troopers were programmed to obey.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/RexOrder66-Shattered.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200505140733)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/RexOrder66-Shattered.png/revision/latest?cb=20200505140733) 

The purging of the Jedi Order commenced with Order 66, which the clone troopers were programmed to obey.

 

Darth Sidious immediately [purged](/wiki/Great_Jedi_Purge "Great Jedi Purge") the Jedi Order, issuing to the [clone](/wiki/Cloning "Cloning") army [Order 66](/wiki/Order_66 "Order 66"): to exterminate all Jedi. With this command programmed into the clones since their births on [Kamino](/wiki/Kamino "Kamino"),[[40]](#cite_note-Conspiracy-40) the [clone troopers](/wiki/Clone_trooper "Clone trooper") immediately turned on their Jedi commanders and exterminated the vast majority of the Jedi Order in an instant. Meanwhile, Anakin Skywalker—rechristened as Sidious's new [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith") apprentice [Darth](/wiki/Darth "Darth") Vader—[attacked](/wiki/Operation:_Knightfall "Operation: Knightfall") the [Jedi Temple](/wiki/Imperial_Palace "Imperial Palace") and wiped out what remained of the Order.[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41) Palpatine would go onto claim it was the Jedi who had been behind the war and that they were attempting to subvert the Republic from within,[[42]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_3-42) with the Empire's narrative holding the Jedi as being the puppet masters of the Separatist Alliance[[43]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_(2017)_1-43)—something supported by the public knowledge that Dooku had once been a Jedi[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5)—in a long-plotted coup.[[42]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_3-42) With his speech, he pinned recent galactic crises squarely on the Jedi Order.[[44]](#cite_note-Launchpad229-44) Subsequent Imperial narratives would separate the CIS and Jedi Order, however.[[45]](#cite_note-Leia-45)[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46)

Despite their Order being wiped out, certain Jedi survived the initial purge. Many of them went into hiding after [Grand Master](/wiki/Grand_Master "Grand Master") [Yoda](/wiki/Yoda "Yoda") and Master [Obi-Wan Kenobi](/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Obi-Wan Kenobi") fought their way into the Temple and transmitted a holographic message warning the other Jedi about the Republic trap waiting for them there, right before the two Masters failed to destroy the Sith and headed into exile themselves.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) Some of them, however, were initially hunted down and either killed, taken prisoner or turned to the dark side as part of an agency of [dark side adepts](/wiki/Dark_side_adept "Dark side adept") known as the [Inquisitorius](/wiki/Inquisitorius "Inquisitorius").[[47]](#cite_note-Fallen_Order-47) Over the Imperial Era, the Empire would also come to change the story of the Jedi Order's supposed betrayal to, little by little, erase the Jedi from history. Later Imperial histories would disregard the story of a Jedi coup, instead painting the picture of an Order that had greatly dwindled in number and was mostly forgotten by the Clone Wars.[[48]](#cite_note-Alphabet_Squadron-48)

 [![In the aftermath of the Clone Wars, the First Galactic Empire was born with Sidious' ascension as Emperor of the galaxy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6c/Declaration2.png/revision/latest?cb=20130211070942) [![In the aftermath of the Clone Wars, the First Galactic Empire was born with Sidious' ascension as Emperor of the galaxy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6c/Declaration2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130211070942)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6c/Declaration2.png/revision/latest?cb=20130211070942) 

In the aftermath of the Clone Wars, the First Galactic Empire was born with Sidious' ascension as Emperor of the galaxy.

 

Shortly afterwards, Sidious turned his eyes to the Confederacy of Independent Systems and dispatched Darth Vader to [wipe out](/wiki/Mission_to_Mustafar "Mission to Mustafar") [Nute Gunray](/wiki/Nute_Gunray "Nute Gunray") and the rest of the [Separatist government leaders](/wiki/Executive_Separatist_Council "Executive Separatist Council") on [Mustafar](/wiki/Mustafar "Mustafar"), following which Imperial financier [Arsin Crassus](/wiki/Arsin_Crassus "Arsin Crassus") plundered the Trade Federation's accounts to fund the new Imperial government.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16) Now able to demonstrate threats to the Republic from both within and without, a visibly injured and scarred Sidious addressed the Galactic Senate to announce the reforms which had been his plan since the beginning. To the thunderous applause of the Senators, Sidious—known publicly as Supreme Chancellor Palpatine—announced that in order to preserve security and continued stability, the Republic would be reorganized into[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) the First Galactic Empire[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49) and proclaimed himself as Galactic Emperor.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) Eager for an end to the war and its suffering, the galaxy accepted the Empire.[[34]](#cite_note-Outlaws-34)

### Imperialization[]

#### Re-ordering the Republic[]

:   "*The Emperor, the governors, the minds we've brought together have grand plans for the galaxy—not just for the next year, or the next five years, but for the next* century*. We are the architects of the universe our grandchildren will live in, and it will be one where there is no conflict, no dissent, and no visionaries who would undo the work of their betters. Today we will maintain order through military might, but in the future every child will learn a superior history, be raised in a superior family. And the concept of defiance will be as antiquated as the spear. You ask me if we would start a war to maintain our grip on power. This is my answer: We already did. While you were obsessed with the Separatist conflict, we were doing battle on another front, capturing the love of the people of this galaxy. The Emperor won. Now we are securing our victory and reaping the spoils, while you seem to believe the fighting never began, let alone ended.*"
:   ―Grand Vizier Mas Amedda, to Senator Mon Mothma[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46)

 [![The Jedi became vilified as the Old Republic faded into history, supplanted by the New Order of Emperor Palpatine.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/34/AmeddaJediEradicationCeremony-2017DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170622194336) [![The Jedi became vilified as the Old Republic faded into history, supplanted by the New Order of Emperor Palpatine.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/34/AmeddaJediEradicationCeremony-2017DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170622194336)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/34/AmeddaJediEradicationCeremony-2017DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170622194336) 

The Jedi became vilified as the Old Republic faded into history, supplanted by the New Order of Emperor Palpatine.

 

Existing government bodies were renamed to reflect the change in authority as civil and military superstructure of the Old Republic were overhauled immediately under the personal direction of the Emperor. With vast portions of the galaxy still unconquered, the Grand Army of the Republic became the [Imperial Army](/wiki/Imperial_Army "Imperial Army"),[[50]](#cite_note-Rebel_Journal-50)[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) while the [Republic Navy](/wiki/Republic_Navy "Republic Navy") became the [Imperial Navy](/wiki/Imperial_Navy "Imperial Navy") and the Galactic Senate was rechristened the [Imperial Senate](/wiki/Imperial_Senate "Imperial Senate").[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2) The renowned [Senate Plaza](/wiki/Imperial_Plaza "Imperial Plaza"), with its name reminding residents of the Old Republic, was promptly changed to the Imperial Plaza.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) Ultimately, the mechanisms created for the Republic during the war were twisted to fit Sidious' use, with even the systems built with help from the Jedi benefiting the new Emperor.[[51]](#cite_note-Ahsoka-51) All the while, the Emperor and his followers began formulating their [century plan](/wiki/Century_plan "Century plan") for the galaxy and how it would change under Imperial rule.[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46)

In addition, the former roundel of the Republic was replaced with the new [Imperial crest](/wiki/Imperial_crest "Imperial crest"), adorned on almost everything having to do with Sidious' Empire.[[52]](#cite_note-Rebels_Visual_Guide-52) With every day that passed, Sidious' hold over the galaxy grew tighter.[[51]](#cite_note-Ahsoka-51) For the next decade and a half, Imperial rule—bolstered by the military created to fight in the Clone Wars—dominated the galaxy and was largely unchallenged. The Empire soon began to upgrade its military hardware, replacing V-wing and [ARC-170](/wiki/Aggressive_ReConnaissance-170_starfighter "Aggressive ReConnaissance-170 starfighter") fighters with newer [TIE models](/wiki/TIE/ln_space_superiority_starfighter "TIE/ln space superiority starfighter") five years after the Clone Wars, but Republic-era military equipment continued to be used for a while on distant outposts and locations such as [Galidraan Station](/wiki/Galidraan_Station "Galidraan Station").[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) The Republic's [Phase II clone trooper armor](/wiki/Phase_II_clone_trooper_armor "Phase II clone trooper armor") would begin a phase out and be replaced by superior [stormtrooper armor](/wiki/Stormtrooper_armor "Stormtrooper armor"), whose development had been headed by the [Imperial Department of Military Research](/wiki/Imperial_Department_of_Military_Research "Imperial Department of Military Research").[[52]](#cite_note-Rebels_Visual_Guide-52) In the meantime, the Empire quietly supported the activity of the [4040s](/wiki/4040s "4040s") activist group, whose members functioned as something of a paramilitary in due time.[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46)

All the while, the average peoples of the Empire carried on, thinking that their lives would continue happily.[[53]](#cite_note-WinLose-53) On the whole, the population was relieved to see an end to the war and the fear it instilled in their lives.[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46) While certain anti-Imperial actions could be punished, with word spreading that some traitors were sent to the [spice mines of Kessel](/wiki/Spice_mines_of_Kessel "Spice mines of Kessel"),[[53]](#cite_note-WinLose-53) the administration—in that period of early establishment, where its foundations were shaky—only cracked down on major threats to its existence. That created a sense of false security in the population,[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46) whose civil liberties were curtailed over the prolonged existence of the Empire, instead of in one great stroke.[[53]](#cite_note-WinLose-53) Palpatine relied on [populist](/wiki/Populist "Populist") messaging that appealed to the average citizen,[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46) but the Empire was, in truth, a state designed for the wealthy,[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54) who would enjoy comfort and the state's kindness[[55]](#cite_note-SW_2020_46-55) at the expense of those average workers and populations.[[47]](#cite_note-Fallen_Order-47)

Mothma and Organa championed the [Imperial Rebirth Act](/wiki/Imperial_Rebirth_Act "Imperial Rebirth Act") to try and reclaim power for the Senate that had been claimed by Palpatine, only for Palpatine to claim that, as Emperor, he had the ability to veto portions of the bill. While Mothma disagreed with the claim, she was not yet ready to start a war against the Emperor, who had the love of the galaxy's population and the power to back it up, so found herself forced to accept the defeat. Nonetheless, faced with the revelation that senatorial action would not be enough to curtail Palpatine, Mothma and Organa began a covert partnership with the rebel leader [Saw Gerrera](/wiki/Saw_Gerrera "Saw Gerrera") of the [Partisans](/wiki/Partisans "Partisans"); in this alliance, Gerrera would stand as the military heart and provide the beginnings of a rebel army, Mothma would build coalitions to oppose Palpatine as their movement's political heart, and Organa would stand as its ideological heart, bringing together thinkers and reformers who could present a new way forward.[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46)

#### Continuing clean-up[]

:   "*They want the Empire to collapse the same way some hoped the Republic would, only this time our enemies aren't rebelling in protest of Senate representation, trade routes, or taxes. They're intent on sowing chaos, on bringing everything down. They have no agenda—political, religious, or any other—beyond a desire to end civilization as we know it.*"
:   ―[Orson Callan Krennic](/wiki/Orson_Callan_Krennic "Orson Callan Krennic")[[56]](#cite_note-Catalyst-56)

Happy for the peace and the end to the fighting the rise of the Empire brought[[57]](#cite_note-Cornered-57) after the Clone Wars had killed billions,[[58]](#cite_note-Helmet_Collection_10-58) the new government was welcomed by people[[57]](#cite_note-Cornered-57) all throughout a galaxy[[58]](#cite_note-Helmet_Collection_10-58) that was tired of the bloodshed; on the planet [Pantora](/wiki/Pantora "Pantora"), citizens cheered as clone stormtroopers marched past them near a [Imperial Informational Station](/wiki/Imperial_Informational_Station "Imperial Informational Station"), where a message played announcing personal [chain codes](/wiki/Chain_code "Chain code") and new [currency](/wiki/Currency "Currency").[[57]](#cite_note-Cornered-57)

 [![The battle droids that fought for the Confederacy of Independent Systems were decommissioned and destroyed.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/42/CorelliaDecommissioningFacilityInt-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest?cb=20220108055318) [![The battle droids that fought for the Confederacy of Independent Systems were decommissioned and destroyed.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/42/CorelliaDecommissioningFacilityInt-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220108055318)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/42/CorelliaDecommissioningFacilityInt-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest?cb=20220108055318) 

The battle droids that fought for the Confederacy of Independent Systems were decommissioned and destroyed.

 

After the [Separatist Droid Army](/wiki/Separatist_Droid_Army "Separatist Droid Army") was promptly shut down, its [navy](/wiki/Confederacy_of_Independent_Systems_Navy "Confederacy of Independent Systems Navy") was dismantled at locations across the galaxy such as the [Bilbringi shipyards](/wiki/Bilbringi_shipyards "Bilbringi shipyards"). However, various droid models and Separatist technology escaped Imperial appropriation and worked their way onto the black market, with many modules taken from Separatist frigates and destroyers, including pieces from [Admiral](/wiki/Admiral "Admiral") [Trench](/wiki/Trench "Trench")'s warship, the *[Invincible](/wiki/Invincible "Invincible")*. Despite Separatist-era technology continuing to be used and appearing in locations such as the [Corporate Sector](/wiki/Corporate_Sector "Corporate Sector"), the Empire continued to root out remaining [holdouts](/wiki/Separatist_holdouts "Separatist holdouts") of the Confederacy four years after the Clone Wars, while criminal organizations composed of repurposed [battle droids](/wiki/Battle_droid "Battle droid") such as the [Droid Gotra](/wiki/Droid_Gotra "Droid Gotra") operated in Coruscant's underground.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

While the Empire at times came into conflict with parts of the criminal underworld,[[59]](#cite_note-Aphra_(2016)_13-59) the Empire allied itself with major galactic criminal factions, including [Crimson Dawn](/wiki/Crimson_Dawn "Crimson Dawn")[[60]](#cite_note-Solo-60) and the [Hutt Clan](/wiki/Hutt_Clan "Hutt Clan"). The [Hutts](/wiki/Hutt "Hutt") enjoyed a special relationship with the Empire that remained in place for decades. Other criminal factions, like [Papa Toren's group](/wiki/Toren_crime_family "Toren crime family"),[[61]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_1-61) the [Pyke Syndicate](/wiki/Pyke_Syndicate "Pyke Syndicate"), the Droid Gotra, the [Black Sun](/wiki/Black_Sun "Black Sun"), the [Zerek Besh](/wiki/Zerek_Besh "Zerek Besh"), all desired to take the Hutt Clan's place as the Empire's formal partner in underworld affairs.[[62]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-62)

#### Hunt for the Jedi[]

:   "*The Inquisitorius. A project of mine, long planned. Slaves to the light side once, now awake. Hunters, one and all.*"  
    "*What do they hunt?*"  
    "*Why, Jedi, of course.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious and Darth Vader[[63]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_(2017)_6-63)

 [![The remaining Jedi were hunted by the Sith Lord Darth Vader and his Inquisitors.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/InquisitoriusMarch-2017DarthVader16.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20181217225734) [![The remaining Jedi were hunted by the Sith Lord Darth Vader and his Inquisitors.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/InquisitoriusMarch-2017DarthVader16.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20181217225734)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/InquisitoriusMarch-2017DarthVader16.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20181217225734) 

The remaining Jedi were hunted by the Sith Lord Darth Vader and his Inquisitors.

 

Any Jedi survivors of Sidious' purge were systematically hunted down and killed either by Darth Vader[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2) or any of the Emperor's Inquisitors in the years that followed the rise of the New Order. When [Zubain Ankonori](/wiki/Zubain_Ankonori "Zubain Ankonori") and his nest of fellow Jedi were all found within the [Jedi shrine](/wiki/Jedi_shrine "Jedi shrine") on [Anoat](/wiki/Anoat "Anoat"), they were forced to separate and flee, only to be tracked and killed by an Inquisitor one by one.[[64]](#cite_note-Uprising-64)

In order to draw out any of these Jedi and the children capable of touching [the Force](/wiki/The_Force "The Force"), the Empire charged the Inquisitorius with not only tracking the Order 66 survivors down, but also preventing the Force-sensitive youth of the galaxy from becoming Jedi.[[65]](#cite_note-Rebel_Resolve-65)[[66]](#cite_note-Always_Two_There_Are-66) The Empire also offered rewards for those who turned over surviving Jedi to Imperial authorities, dead or alive.[[67]](#cite_note-Friends-67)

#### Minor resistance[]

:   "*Why should we trust you?*"  
    "*Because I'm on your side. What the Empire is doing is wrong. You have to get out of here.*"
:   ―[Gobi Glie](/wiki/Gobi_Glie "Gobi Glie") and [Howzer](/wiki/Howzer "Howzer")[[68]](#cite_note-Rescue_on_Ryloth-68)

 [![Imperial rule fostered resentment on occupied worlds, including the Twi'lek homeworld of Ryloth.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d3/RampartSpeech-RoR.png/revision/latest?cb=20220114045340) [![Imperial rule fostered resentment on occupied worlds, including the Twi'lek homeworld of Ryloth.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d3/RampartSpeech-RoR.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20220114045340)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d3/RampartSpeech-RoR.png/revision/latest?cb=20220114045340) 

Imperial rule fostered resentment on occupied worlds, including the Twi'lek homeworld of Ryloth.

 

As pirates, smugglers, and ex-Separatists were routinely imprisoned and destroyed, the Empire faced little serious resistance to its rule. A rare exception revolved around the Outer Rim world of [Ryloth](/wiki/Ryloth "Ryloth"), where Moff [Delian Mors](/wiki/Delian_Mors "Delian Mors") and [Colonel](/wiki/Colonel "Colonel") [Belkor Dray](/wiki/Belkor_Dray "Belkor Dray") were fighting an insurgency known as the [Free Ryloth Movement](/wiki/Free_Ryloth_Movement "Free Ryloth Movement"), led by former [Twi'lek Resistance](/wiki/Twi%27lek_Resistance "Twi'lek Resistance") leader [Cham Syndulla](/wiki/Cham_Syndulla "Cham Syndulla"), who established hidden bases across Ryloth and executed raids against the Empire, including those on its lucrative [spice](/wiki/Spice "Spice") and slave trade in the sector. Composed of freedom fighters who fought with the Galactic Republic and Jedi Master [Mace Windu](/wiki/Mace_Windu "Mace Windu") during the Clone Wars to free their homeworld from Separatist occupation by [Emir](/wiki/Emir "Emir") [Wat Tambor](/wiki/Wat_Tambor "Wat Tambor"), the newly formed Free Ryloth movement would continue its struggle for independence against the Galactic Empire for decades.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)[[69]](#cite_note-Lords_of_the_Sith-69)

Seeking to make examples of worlds who continued to harbor secessionist tendencies, [Moff](/wiki/Moff "Moff") [Wilhuff Tarkin](/wiki/Wilhuff_Tarkin "Wilhuff Tarkin") was assigned to make an example of [Antar 4](/wiki/Antar_4 "Antar 4"), a populous moon that had been a part of the Separatist Alliance and involved in a scheme involving [Republic Intelligence](/wiki/Republic_Intelligence "Republic Intelligence") to train locals into well-armed resistance groups. While COMPNOR initially stifled information regarding the killings, word soon leaked about the operation through inquisitive reporters such as [Anora Fair](/wiki/Anora_Fair "Anora Fair") and [Hask Taff](/wiki/Hask_Taff "Hask Taff"), while the event was soon penned as the [Antar Atrocity](/wiki/Antar_Atrocity "Antar Atrocity"), capturing the attention of many Coruscanti and other citizens from the Core Worlds.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)[[69]](#cite_note-Lords_of_the_Sith-69)

### Age of the Empire[]

#### Continued expansion[]

:   "*There used to be hundreds of settlements up here. Forty thousand Aldhanis all across the highlands. They were here for centuries, but it only took the Empire a decade to clear them out.*"  
    "*Killed them?*"  
    "*No. Drove them south. There's an Enterprize Zone in the Lowlands. Factories, new towns, Imperial housing. Aldhani has the unfortunate quality of being close to nothing and not far away from everything. It's the perfect hub for distribution. If one were trying to take over the galaxy.*"
:   ―Vel Sartha and Cassian Andor[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70)

 [![The Imperial occupation of Aldhani began in 18 BBY and resulted in the planet becoming a waypoint for Imperial materiel.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/AldhaniGarrison.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221015112508) [![The Imperial occupation of Aldhani began in 18 BBY and resulted in the planet becoming a waypoint for Imperial materiel.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/AldhaniGarrison.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20221015112508)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/AldhaniGarrison.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221015112508) 

The Imperial occupation of Aldhani began in 18 BBY and resulted in the planet becoming a waypoint for Imperial materiel.

 

At some point during its reign, the Empire undertook an expansion effort known simply as the [Imperial expansion](/wiki/Imperial_expansion "Imperial expansion"). It was during this time that they constructed a [military installation](/wiki/Nevarro_Imperial_base "Nevarro Imperial base") on the volcanic world of [Nevarro](/wiki/Nevarro "Nevarro").[[71]](#cite_note-Chapter_12-71) In 18 BBY,[[72]](#cite_note-Aldhani_Occupation_Date-72) the Empire arrived on the planet [Aldhani](/wiki/Aldhani "Aldhani") due to its tactically useful place in space, liberating the [Alkenzi Air Base](/wiki/Alkenzi_Air_Base "Alkenzi Air Base") and creating a [dam](/wiki/Aldhani_dam "Aldhani dam") over the sacred [Nasma Klain](/wiki/Nasma_Klain "Nasma Klain") river.[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70) Beginning an occupation, the Empire displaced the local population[[73]](#cite_note-DB_Aldhani-73) of [Dhanis](/wiki/Dhani "Dhani") over the course of the next ten years. Forcing the Dhani to the southern [Lowlands](/wiki/Lowlands "Lowlands"), the Empire established an [Enterprise Zone](/wiki/Enterprise_Zone "Enterprise Zone") of new Imperial housing and offered work in [factories](/wiki/Factory "Factory").[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70)

Staffed by the [Aldhani Garrison](/wiki/Aldhani_Garrison "Aldhani Garrison"), the dam served as the planet's waypoint for weaponry and other supplies, including the quarterly payroll for the overall sector. The Dhani also revered the celestial event known as the "[Eye of Aldhani](/wiki/Eye_of_Aldhani "Eye of Aldhani")." When the Eye "opened" every three years, the Dhani made their way to[[74]](#cite_note-The_Eye-74) the [Nasma Brani](/wiki/Nasma_Brani "Nasma Brani") temple[[75]](#cite_note-DB_Dhani-75) in the sacred [Akti Amaugh](/wiki/Akti_Amaugh "Akti Amaugh") valley, which the dam overlooked, through a ten day journey. As such, the Empire made a show of supporting their custom but worked to root it out to keep control over the valley.[[74]](#cite_note-The_Eye-74) In [15 BBY](/wiki/15_BBY "15 BBY"),[[72]](#cite_note-Aldhani_Occupation_Date-72) the Empire established and began promoting an Imperial-supported viewing event in the Enterprise Zone, intending to draw Dhani away from their sacred area. For those who still made the ten-day journey, the Empire,[[74]](#cite_note-The_Eye-74) by [5 BBY](/wiki/5_BBY "5 BBY"),[[72]](#cite_note-Aldhani_Occupation_Date-72) had also started offering transport to the valley from the Lowlands, being more than aware that the Dhani would refuse. With that, the Empire also established [Comfort Units](/wiki/Comfort_Unit "Comfort Unit") along the route, convincing many to abandon the long journey.[[74]](#cite_note-The_Eye-74)

 [![Imperial forces arrive on the planet Ferrix as a show of force.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Andor-Clones-point-blasters.png/revision/latest?cb=20221125015101) [![Imperial forces arrive on the planet Ferrix as a show of force.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Andor-Clones-point-blasters.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20221125015101)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Andor-Clones-point-blasters.png/revision/latest?cb=20221125015101) 

Imperial forces arrive on the planet Ferrix as a show of force.

 

In 19 BBY,[[76]](#cite_note-SW_DORVG-76) Imperial forces arrived on[[77]](#cite_note-Announcement-77) the planet[[78]](#cite_note-Nobody's_Listening!-78) Ferrix[[77]](#cite_note-Announcement-77) in the [Free Trade sector](/wiki/Free_Trade_sector "Free Trade sector")[[79]](#cite_note-Kassa-79) to bring it under the Empire's control. On [Rix Road](/wiki/Rix_Road "Rix Road"),[[77]](#cite_note-Announcement-77) a [regiment](/wiki/Unidentified_clone_trooper_regiment "Unidentified clone trooper regiment")[[80]](#cite_note-Announcement_AD-80) of clone troopers under an [Imperial officer](/wiki/Unidentified_Imperial_officer_(Ferrix) "Unidentified Imperial officer (Ferrix)") marched pass the gathered masses of civilians as a show of Imperial authority, although local citizen [Clem Andor](/wiki/Clem_Andor "Clem Andor") assured his adoptive son [Cassian Jeron Andor](/wiki/Cassian_Jeron_Andor "Cassian Jeron Andor") that the Empire would pull out soon enough. To Clem, resisting the Empire was not their fight. However, a small group of protesters emerged from the crowd and began to throw rocks at the soldiers in the name of the Republic and Ferrix[[77]](#cite_note-Announcement-77) in what became known as the [Rix Road protest](/wiki/Rix_Road_Protest "Rix Road Protest").[[81]](#cite_note-Reckoning_Slide_5-81) Believing they would only make things worse for themselves, Clem quickly stepped in to stop the protest, only for the officer to call his troopers to a halt at that moment. Pointing their blasters at the protesters and Clem, who was assumed to be part of the demonstration, the protest was shut down.[[77]](#cite_note-Announcement-77) Clem was publicly hung on Rix Road[[82]](#cite_note-Reckoning-82) for his supposed treason.[[77]](#cite_note-Announcement-77)

Afterward, Cassian attacked four clone troopers stationed near the gallows in anger.[[77]](#cite_note-Announcement-77) At some point, Andor spent time with anti-Imperial anarchist groups.[[4]](#cite_note-R1VD-4) Ultimately, Cassian would be arrested on charges of attacking an Imperial soldier, insurrection, and destroying Imperial property.[[83]](#cite_note-That_Would_Be_Me-83) After spending time in prison, the sixteen year old Andor was sent to[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70) the planet [Mimban](/wiki/Mimban "Mimban"), which had been an ally to the Republic during the Clone Wars but possessed vital resources,[[84]](#cite_note-Solo_Official_Guide-84) as a cook for the Imperial Army. After six months on Mimban, Andor escaped by deserting the military. He later claimed he had seen active combat. Upon escaping, Andor realized the Empire had set him and his other conscripts against people who should have been their allies. Although Andor's resolve to fight the Empire was damaged,[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70) the people of Mimban, the [Mimbanese](/wiki/Mimbanese "Mimbanese"), resisted the Empire's encroachment on their world as the Imperial Era carried on.[[60]](#cite_note-Solo-60) Andor ultimately returned home to Ferrix, which largely remained out of direct Imperial control and instead was governed by the [Preox-Morlana](/wiki/Consolidated_Holdings_of_Preox-Morlana_Corporation "Consolidated Holdings of Preox-Morlana Corporation") corporate polity on behalf of the central Imperial regime. Despite his hate for the Empire, Andor's spirit was crushed,[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70) and he attempted to eke out a life for himself, his mother[[79]](#cite_note-Kassa-79) [Maarva](/wiki/Maarva_Carassi_Andor "Maarva Carassi Andor"), and their droid [B2EMO](/wiki/B2EMO "B2EMO").[[83]](#cite_note-That_Would_Be_Me-83)

#### Designing the ultimate weapon[]

:   "*You look at the history of any sentient species and what do you find but tableaux of violence and slaughter. It's finger painted on the ceilings of caves and engraved into the walls of temples. Dig a hole deep enough on any world and you'll find the skulls and bones of adults and children fractured by crude weapons. All of us were fighting long before we were farming and raising livestock…Violence is hardwired into most of us and there's no eliminating the impulse—not with an army of stormtroopers or a fleet of Star Destroyers. That's why we've embarked on a path to a different solution. We have a chance to forge a peace that will endure longer than the Republic was in existence.*"
:   ―Orson Callan Krennic[[56]](#cite_note-Catalyst-56)

 [![Krennic (pictured) was put in charge of the Ultimate Weapon Project](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/YoungOrson.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180818233148) [![Krennic (pictured) was put in charge of the Ultimate Weapon Project](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/YoungOrson.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/150?cb=20180818233148)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/YoungOrson.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180818233148) 

Krennic (pictured) was put in charge of the Ultimate Weapon Project

 

Having inherited the [Republic Special Weapons Group](/wiki/Republic_Special_Weapons_Group "Republic Special Weapons Group"), a top secret group headed by [Professor](/wiki/Professor "Professor") [Sahali](/wiki/Sahali "Sahali") tasked with [top secret project](/wiki/Project_Stardust "Project Stardust") and ordered by Palpatine to construct the [deadly battle station](/wiki/DS-1_Orbital_Battle_Station "DS-1 Orbital Battle Station") from it's predecessor state, the Galactic Empire reformed the Weapons Group into the [Imperial Military Department of Advanced Weapons Research](/wiki/Imperial_Military_Department_of_Advanced_Weapons_Research "Imperial Military Department of Advanced Weapons Research") in which the Ultimate Weapon project was assigned and split into several smaller projects, with [Project Celestial Power](/wiki/Project_Celestial_Power "Project Celestial Power"), a subproject tasked with the development of a [superweapon](/wiki/Superweapon "Superweapon") for the battle station, being publicly presented as an initiative to fulfill Emperor Palpatine's [dream](/wiki/Dream "Dream") of sustainable energy independence[[56]](#cite_note-Catalyst-56) to transform the Imperial economy and solidify Imperial authority.[[85]](#cite_note-OYL-85) [Lieutenant Commander](/wiki/Lieutenant_Commander "Lieutenant Commander") [Orson Callan Krennic](/wiki/Orson_Callan_Krennic "Orson Callan Krennic"), an [Imperial officer](/wiki/Imperial_officer "Imperial officer") who had been involved with the failed attempt at the Battle Station's construction, and had held an administrative post at the [Institute of Applied Science](/wiki/Institute_of_Applied_Science "Institute of Applied Science") on Coruscant screening scientists for expertise on energy manipulation, materials science, and theoretical physics, was placed in charge of the program.[[56]](#cite_note-Catalyst-56)

 [![Galen Erso was tricked into unknowing help develop the Death Star's superlaser](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/Catalyst-BNPoster2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170413071826) [![Galen Erso was tricked into unknowing help develop the Death Star's superlaser](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/Catalyst-BNPoster2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170413071826)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/Catalyst-BNPoster2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170413071826) 

Galen Erso was tricked into unknowing help develop the Death Star's superlaser

 

In charge of the program, Krennic had the [B'ankora](/wiki/B%27ankora "B'ankora") relocated from the [B'ankor Refuge](/wiki/B%27ankor_Refuge "B'ankor Refuge") on Coruscant to allow the construction of a new [research complex](/wiki/Project_Celestial_Power_complex "Project Celestial Power complex") at the site, and seeing potential for the battle station's weapon in the [crystallographer](/wiki/Crystallography "Crystallography") [Galen Walton Erso](/wiki/Galen_Walton_Erso "Galen Walton Erso") [Kyber crystal](/wiki/Kyber_crystal "Kyber crystal") research, offered the crystallographer a spot in the project, convincing him that the project was tasked with [bringing](/wiki/Imperial_Energy_Division "Imperial Energy Division") sustainable energy to worlds ravaged by the clone wars, which Galen accepted. As Galen made progress on his research on Kyber crystals, Krennic began attempting to weaponize Galen's research at secret facilities on worlds such as [Hypori](/wiki/Hypori "Hypori") and [Malpaz](/wiki/Malpaz "Malpaz"), all while Galen and his [family](/wiki/Erso_family "Erso family") grew suspicious of Galen's work.

 [![The Emperor performed and inspection of Krennic's work on the Death Star](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b6/Moff_Tarkin.png/revision/latest?cb=20130208042141) [![The Emperor performed and inspection of Krennic's work on the Death Star](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b6/Moff_Tarkin.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130208042141)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b6/Moff_Tarkin.png/revision/latest?cb=20130208042141) 

The Emperor performed and inspection of Krennic's work on the Death Star

 

Despite Project Celestial Power being hit with a major accident when a [facility](/wiki/Project_Celestial_Power_facility "Project Celestial Power facility") on Malpaz [exploded](/wiki/Malpaz_incident "Malpaz incident") during a weaponization attempt and destroying the planet's [capital city](/wiki/Malpaz_capital_city "Malpaz capital city"), Krennic was able to complete the outer rings of the Battle Station in time for the Emperor's visit, and eventually succeeded in weaponizing Galen's research with the successful test of prototype duel-laser weapon into a set of [Black holes](/wiki/Black_hole "Black hole") known as the [Hero Twins](/wiki/Hero_Twins "Hero Twins").[[56]](#cite_note-Catalyst-56) Yet despite the successful test, the project was once again set back when the team tasked with designing the full superlaser questioned their work and realized who's research was being used, forcing Krennic to "relocate" them. Not long after, Galen discovered the Imperial coverup and massacre, which all but confirmed something was wrong. With this information, Galen decided to run away with his family to [Lah'mu](/wiki/Lah%27mu "Lah'mu"), making Project Celestial Power stall until Krennic could locate the crystallographer.[[56]](#cite_note-Catalyst-56) Grand Moff Tarkin used the opportunity to give himself an overseeing position of the Ultimate Weapon Project, often stealing credit for Krennic's work and causing a bitter rivalry between him and Krennic.[[56]](#cite_note-Catalyst-56)

#### Spread of the Empire[]

:   "*For the first time in one thousand generations our sector governors will not be working solely to enrich Coruscant and the Core Worlds, but to advance the quality of life in the star systems that make up each sector-keeping the spaceways safe, maintaining open and accessible communications, assuring that tax revenues are properly levied and allocated to improving the infrastructure. The Senate will likewise be made up of beings devoted not to their own enrichment, but to the enrichment of the worlds they represent.*"
:   ―An excerpt from the Tarkin Doctrine[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

 [!["" was played during the yearly  celebrations across Imperial space.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5c/Empire_Day_parade.png/revision/latest?cb=20141118072545) [!["" was played during the yearly  celebrations across Imperial space.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5c/Empire_Day_parade.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20141118072545)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5c/Empire_Day_parade.png/revision/latest?cb=20141118072545) 

"[Glory of the Empire](/wiki/Glory_of_the_Empire "Glory of the Empire")" was played during the yearly [Empire Day](/wiki/Empire_Day "Empire Day") celebrations across Imperial space.

 

As the Galactic Empire grew, Sidious moved closer to his ultimate plan of ruling the entire galaxy and unlocking the secrets of the [Sith Masters](/wiki/Sith_Master "Sith Master") who had come before him. With the near extermination of the Jedi Order and the Empire swelling in size and strength, the Emperor ultimately planned to possess the powers of the dark side to reshape reality itself into something of his own creation, and an omnipotent Empire would allow all the galaxy's inhabitants to be held in his dark embrace. As Emperor, however, he largely disappeared from public life,[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) leaving his public addresses to become more and more rare.[[56]](#cite_note-Catalyst-56)

While, in public, the Imperial system of sector governance was designed to improve and uplift life across the whole of the galaxy,[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) the truth of the Empire and its New Order was that it enforced a form of supposed "natural hierarchy," which uplifted life in the Core Worlds at the expense of those who lived further out across the stars. Planets at the edge of the galaxy suffered under Imperial rule while their resources and wealth were extracted and shipped towards the Core, particularly Coruscant, which prospered under Imperial rule. Imperial leadership[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54) and their wealthy contemporaries[[86]](#cite_note-WAFE-86) enjoyed luxurious lifestyles.[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54)

As most planets were ecologically devastated over the Imperial Era, rampant industrialization and mass-production eroded local culture and ecological health. People saw their children drafted into Imperial service, while corrupt [governors](/wiki/Governor "Governor")[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87)[[88]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-88) and [magistrates](/wiki/Magistrate "Magistrate") often exploited local populations on worlds such as [Jelucan](/wiki/Jelucan "Jelucan"),[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) [Devaron](/wiki/Devaron "Devaron")[[88]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-88) and [Tangenine](/wiki/Tangenine "Tangenine").[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49) In [18 BBY](/wiki/18_BBY "18 BBY"),[[11]](#cite_note-Rise_Fall-11) the Empire [conquered](/wiki/Conquest_of_Yar_Togna "Conquest of Yar Togna")[[84]](#cite_note-Solo_Official_Guide-84) and occupied[[89]](#cite_note-Edrio-89) the planet [Yar Togna](/wiki/Yar_Togna "Yar Togna"),[[84]](#cite_note-Solo_Official_Guide-84) leading to much of its population fleeing[[4]](#cite_note-R1VD-4) as refugees[[89]](#cite_note-Edrio-89) in a mass exodus.[[84]](#cite_note-Solo_Official_Guide-84) At some point, the [Mid Rim uprisings](/wiki/Mid_Rim_uprisings "Mid Rim uprisings") were launched by [monarchies](/wiki/Monarchy "Monarchy") that refused to obey Palpatine's will. The revolts ended up as a series of chaotic conflicts that ended in Imperial victory: through the actions of [Imperial Starfighter Pilots](/wiki/Imperial_Starfighter_Pilot "Imperial Starfighter Pilot"), the monarchies were forced to submit to the Emperor.[[30]](#cite_note-Squadrons-30)

 [![Imperial agents and soldiers were tasked with enforcing the Emperor's reign throughout the galaxy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Andressa_Divo_SaV.png/revision/latest?cb=20190106011703) [![Imperial agents and soldiers were tasked with enforcing the Emperor's reign throughout the galaxy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Andressa_Divo_SaV.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190106011703)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Andressa_Divo_SaV.png/revision/latest?cb=20190106011703) 

Imperial agents and soldiers were tasked with enforcing the Emperor's reign throughout the galaxy.

 

Only a year after its founding, the Empire had already begun to enforce itself in the Outer Rim. Worlds that did not fall to the Empire's quick expansion, which installed an oppressive Imperial presence instead of simple bases, became homes to crime lords. In its effort to establish itself in the Outer Rim, in addition to using fear, the Empire withheld food to make populations endure hunger.[[51]](#cite_note-Ahsoka-51) While the Empire turned a blind eye to various abuses, it still maintained a policy of zero corruption and maintained its high standards of conduct, resulting in numerous [Imperial Security Bureau](/wiki/Imperial_Security_Bureau "Imperial Security Bureau") (ISB) officials actively hunting down corrupt and negligent officials, even resulting in investigations by Lord Vader himself. Despite this, many citizens were content with the geopolitical situation in the galaxy, believing that strict measures were necessary to maintain order and stability after the destructive Clone Wars. Many also believed that the Empire, while not the best, was better than anarchy and chaos.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87)[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49)[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

 [![Ahsoka Tano inspired the people of Raada to fight for freedom from the Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/AhsokaCoverArt-byWojtekFus.png/revision/latest?cb=20170904063028) [![Ahsoka Tano inspired the people of Raada to fight for freedom from the Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/AhsokaCoverArt-byWojtekFus.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170904063028)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/AhsokaCoverArt-byWojtekFus.png/revision/latest?cb=20170904063028) 

Ahsoka Tano inspired the people of Raada to fight for freedom from the Empire.

 

Despite its seemingly endless expansion, such as on [Raada](/wiki/Raada "Raada"), where Imperial [forces](/wiki/Imperial_Military "Imperial Military") arrived to harvest [food](/wiki/Foodstuff "Foodstuff"), which destroyed the quality of the moon's soil and led to a growing oppression. This angered the people of Raada to the point where they staged an [uprising](/wiki/Raada_Uprising "Raada Uprising") after [weeks](/wiki/Standard_week "Standard week") of planning, with the help of ex-[Padawan](/wiki/Padawan "Padawan") [Ahsoka Tano](/wiki/Ahsoka_Tano "Ahsoka Tano") and the forces of Imperial Senator [Bail Organa](/wiki/Bail_Prestor_Organa "Bail Prestor Organa") in secret.[[51]](#cite_note-Ahsoka-51) A major turning point against the Empire's advance into the Outer Rim occurred in [11 BBY](/wiki/11_BBY "11 BBY"), with Imperial forces commanded by Captain [Rae Sloane](/wiki/Rae_Sloane "Rae Sloane") engaging in a small skirmish in the vital Inner Rim system of [Gorse](/wiki/Gorse_system "Gorse system").[[90]](#cite_note-A_New_Dawn-90)

This event saw the meeting of later rebel [Hera Syndulla](/wiki/Hera_Syndulla "Hera Syndulla") and Jedi survivor [Kanan Jarrus](/wiki/Kanan_Jarrus "Kanan Jarrus"), who were confronting efficiency expert [Count](/wiki/Count "Count") [Denetrius Vidian](/wiki/Denetrius_Vidian "Denetrius Vidian") and his aggressive methods of extracting [thorilide](/wiki/Thorilide "Thorilide")—a vital component in the construction of turbolaser batteries and thus essential for the expansion of the Imperial fleet. The [Gorse Conflict](/wiki/Gorse_Conflict "Gorse Conflict") ultimately ended with the transferring of local thorilide mining operations to Imperial-aligned [Baron](/wiki/Baron "Baron") [Lero Danthe](/wiki/Lero_Danthe "Lero Danthe"), while Syndulla and Jarrus departed on the heavily modified [VCX-100 light freighter](/wiki/VCX-100_light_freighter "VCX-100 light freighter") *[Ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost")*, and would become essential to the eventual formation of the [Rebel Alliance](/wiki/Alliance_to_Restore_the_Republic "Alliance to Restore the Republic").[[90]](#cite_note-A_New_Dawn-90)

Meanwhile, more and more worlds within the Empire began to realize its true intentions: After various [massacres](/wiki/Massacre_on_Kashyyyk "Massacre on Kashyyyk") on [Kashyyyk](/wiki/Kashyyyk "Kashyyyk") and increasingly brutal tactics, such as the Empire committing genocide on the [Lasat](/wiki/Lasat "Lasat") homeworld of [Lasan](/wiki/Lasan "Lasan"), a growing number of citizens of the galaxy began to rebel against Imperial dominion. At least nine years after the proclamation of the [New Order](/wiki/New_Order "New Order"), the [Corellian Resistance](/wiki/Corellian_Resistance "Corellian Resistance") [fought](/wiki/Corellian_insurgency "Corellian insurgency") the Empire from its headquarters on the planet [Corellia](/wiki/Corellia "Corellia").[[91]](#cite_note-The_End_of_History-91) The Empire would also end the independence of many galactic, sector and planetary governments in its early conquests.[[64]](#cite_note-Uprising-64)[[92]](#cite_note-Heroes_of_Mandalore-92)[[93]](#cite_note-ISC-93)[[94]](#cite_note-Rebels_Recon_Imperial_Super_Commandos-94)

#### Theft of the *Carrion Spike*[]

:   "*You hear so many rumors. People are here one day, gone the next. And no one has laid eyes on the Emperor in months. Amedda, Dangor, and the rest of the Ruling Council have taken to dispatching processions of Imperial skylimos to maintain an illusion that the Emperor still moves about in public. You know they commissioned an enormous statue of the Emperor for the Senate—I mean, Imperial Plaza? So far, the thing looks more terrifying than majestic.*"  
    "*Isn't that the idea, Nils?*"
:   ―Admiral Nils Tenant and Moff Wilhuff Tarkin discuss the Imperialization of Coruscant[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

 [![The Carrion Spike was the personal stealth corvette of Grand Moff Wilhuff Tarkin.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e1/CarrionSpike-PoeDameron2.png/revision/latest?cb=20190117023616) [![The Carrion Spike was the personal stealth corvette of Grand Moff Wilhuff Tarkin.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e1/CarrionSpike-PoeDameron2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190117023616)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e1/CarrionSpike-PoeDameron2.png/revision/latest?cb=20190117023616) 

The *Carrion Spike* was the personal stealth corvette of Grand Moff Wilhuff Tarkin.

 

In [14 BBY](/wiki/14_BBY "14 BBY"),[[95]](#cite_note-14_BBY-95) after Palpatine had spent months on end out of the public eye, members of the Ruling Council, including Mas Amedda and Ars Dangor, arranged for skylimos to move about the Coruscant cityscape, creating the illusion of Palpatine moving amongst the populous. Furthermore, the ongoing [Imperialization](/wiki/Imperialization "Imperialization") of the galaxy and even Coruscant at that time resulted in, as [Admiral](/wiki/Admiral "Admiral") [Nils Tenant](/wiki/Nils_Tenant "Nils Tenant") observing, personnel being "here on day, gone the next." Around the time, an enormous statue of the Emperor—which was regarded by Tenant as more terrifying than beautiful—was erected in Imperial Plaza, with Tarkin arguing to Tenant that it was supposed to be scary, not majestic.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

Meanwhile, various survivors of the Antar Atrocity and other malcontents joined together under the leadership of the former Captain Berch Teller, who organized them into a [rebel cell](/wiki/Berch_Teller%27s_rebel_cell "Berch Teller's rebel cell") intent on stalling the development of the Emperor's newest weapon under construction at Geonosis. After stealing the *[Carrion Spike](/wiki/Carrion_Spike "Carrion Spike")*, an advanced starship based on a [prototype stealth corvette](/wiki/IPV-2C_Stealth_Corvette "IPV-2C Stealth Corvette") used during the [Battle of Christophsis](/wiki/Battle_of_Christophsis "Battle of Christophsis") during the Clone Wars, the rebels wreaked havoc across numerous star systems including [Lucazec](/wiki/Lucazec "Lucazec"), [Galidraan](/wiki/Galidraan_system "Galidraan system") III and [Nouane](/wiki/Nouane_system "Nouane system"), all while transmitting holovids of their attacks on Imperial [HoloNet](/wiki/HoloNet "HoloNet") frequencies, increasing anti-Imperial propaganda across thousands of [Mid](/wiki/Mid_Rim_Territories "Mid Rim Territories") and Outer Rim star systems before the Empire was able to shut down the communications grid.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

After lengthy fleet redeployments and the discovery of a mole within the Imperial ranks, Tarkin, aboard the *Imperial*-class Star Destroyer *[Executrix](/wiki/Executrix "Executrix")*, disabled the rebel warship and captured the dissidents after a brief battle and timely arrival of Star Destroyers *[Compliant](/wiki/Compliant "Compliant")* and *[Enforcer](/wiki/Enforcer "Enforcer")*. To reward Tarkin's skill, the Emperor promoted him to the newly created rank of [Grand Moff](/wiki/Grand_Moff "Grand Moff") and gave him command of the *Executrix* as well as oversight of the Outer Rim Territories, all while the recent attacks on Imperial facilities were made to look like an elaborate plot to root out rebel cells. The Empire had effectively dealt with a potentially disastrous situation, rooted out a traitor and kept details regarding the development of its superweapon at Geonosis a mere rumor.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)[[96]](#cite_note-Vader_1-96)

The Emperor's long-term plan was to allow what he called the "skeleton of the Republic" to remain in place until the Death Star was completed; this included maintaining the Senate to make the systems believe that they still had a part to play in the government. However, upon the superweapon's completion, the Emperor planned to dissolve the Senate and grant its legislative and administrative powers to the military-industrial complex. The Death Star would also provide order to the galaxy, as part of Grand Moff Wilhuff Tarkin's [doctrine of terror](/wiki/Tarkin_Doctrine "Tarkin Doctrine"), by making its inhabitants too afraid to defy an Imperial command and stand against the Empire.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

#### Outer Rim expansion[]

:   "*Good news has come to the citizens of Lothal. The Outer Rim planet has been granted the coveted opportunity to participate in the new Imperial Registration Program.*"
:   ―[Alton Kastle](/wiki/Alton_Kastle "Alton Kastle"), on the HoloNet News[[97]](#cite_note-Imperial_Registration_Program-97)

 [![Sullust was an example of the Empire's industrial development.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Sullust_Imperial_Factory.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160318165413) [![Sullust was an example of the Empire's industrial development.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Sullust_Imperial_Factory.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160318165413)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Sullust_Imperial_Factory.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160318165413) 

Sullust was an example of the Empire's industrial development.

 

Around fourteen years into Sidious' rule as Emperor, the Empire had continued its expansion into the Outer Rim. Worlds like Jelucan saw occupation and development, leading to rampant pollution and industrialization to support the Imperial war machine.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) One such world that was developed was [Lothal](/wiki/Lothal "Lothal"), which joined the [Imperial Registration Program](/wiki/Imperial_Registration_Program "Imperial Registration Program") seeking protection and economic opportunities whereby local citizens would find work in the local [Sienar Fleet Systems](/wiki/Sienar_Fleet_Systems "Sienar Fleet Systems") facilities.[[97]](#cite_note-Imperial_Registration_Program-97) Ostensibly this was to grow the local economy, but was in fact secretly part of a much larger five-year plan involving numerous Outer Rim worlds that was overseen by the [Imperial Outer Rim High Command](/wiki/Imperial_Outer_Rim_High_Command "Imperial Outer Rim High Command"), a subdivision of [Imperial High Command](/wiki/Imperial_High_Command "Imperial High Command") which was in charge of the [Outer Rim Territories](/wiki/Outer_Rim_Territories "Outer Rim Territories").[[18]](#cite_note-Empire_Day_ep-18)

But the Empire did not fully control the Outer Rim and often utilized its worlds instead as testing grounds for new biological weapons and as a source of cheap labor.[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16) Lothal's industrial importance soon came to the fore for the Empire as the Emperor planned to further expand Imperial dominion over the Outer Rim Territories and beyond. In order to maximize the worth of newly occupied systems, worlds such as Lothal soon bore witness to Imperial authorities relocating [farmers](/wiki/Farmer "Farmer") away from their farmlands to mine for Imperial purposes, leading to the development of re-settlement camps such as [Tangletown](/wiki/Tangletown "Tangletown")[[50]](#cite_note-Rebel_Journal-50) and [Lothal re-settlement camp 43](/wiki/Lothal_re-settlement_camp_43 "Lothal re-settlement camp 43"), known by the residents as "Tarkintown" after the Governor of the Outer Rim.[[98]](#cite_note-Spark-98) The Empire also limited the HoloNet across the Outer Rim, leading many dissatisfied systems to view the embargo as a part of the conquest of the Outer Systems.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

### Galactic Civil War[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War")

#### Lothal rebellion[]

:   "*We are getting reports of unrest all over Lothal. There are whispers from Mustafar. Some people see the Empire as weak. Vulnerable.*""*Not to worry, Agent Kallus. The Emperor has sent an alternative solution.*"
:   ―Alexsandr Kallus and Wilhuff Tarkin[[99]](#cite_note-Fire_Across_the_Galaxy-99)

This aggressive dislocation of persons and high tax rate eventually led to the development of a small and localized, albeit serious upheaval[[100]](#cite_note-Siege_of_Lothal-100) in [5 BBY](/wiki/5_BBY "5 BBY")[[101]](#cite_note-SoL_date-101) against Imperial authority on Lothal. Although the other separate insurgencies across the Imperial territories was of little consequence, the Emperor did foresee a new threat rising against the Empire—the children of the Force.
