But the Empire overall did not fear that the various rebel cells could unite and form a more potent menace against the Empire and its interests in the Outer Rim. Imperial Military command maintained a list of known Rebel sympathizers on several Outer Rim worlds, including Lothal, but most of them were not arrested due to their having powerful allies in the Senate, a known hotbed of corruption and decadence.[[100]](#cite_note-Siege_of_Lothal-100)

 [![Mustafar was a volcanic world and Sith sanctuary, where fugitive Jedi were taken to for interrogation, torment, and death.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Welcome_to_Mustafar_Immortal_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200406133411) [![Mustafar was a volcanic world and Sith sanctuary, where fugitive Jedi were taken to for interrogation, torment, and death.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Welcome_to_Mustafar_Immortal_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/280?cb=20200406133411)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Welcome_to_Mustafar_Immortal_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200406133411) 

Mustafar was a volcanic world and Sith sanctuary, where fugitive Jedi were taken to for interrogation, torment, and death.

 

Among these cells on Lothal were the [Spectres](/wiki/Spectres "Spectres"), who manned the *Ghost*.[[98]](#cite_note-Spark-98) When rumor of the discovery of Jarrus' Jedi identity and his duty on leading the Spectres began to emerge, the Empire sent the [Grand Inquisitor](/wiki/Grand_Inquisitor "Grand Inquisitor") to track him down.[[102]](#cite_note-Rise_of_the_Old_Masters-102)[[103]](#cite_note-Call_to_Action-103) The Jedi survivor was to be taken to Darth Vader's [fortress](/wiki/Fortress_Vader "Fortress Vader") on Mustafar,[[104]](#cite_note-Geonosis_Rebels_Recon-104) yet in [4 BBY](/wiki/4_BBY "4 BBY"),[[35]](#cite_note-Galactic_Atlas-35) in a daring [battle](/wiki/Action_at_Mustafar "Action at Mustafar") over Mustafar that marked the first major rebel victory in the Galactic Civil War, the *Ghost* crew rescued Jarrus and joined with a growing rebellion.[[99]](#cite_note-Fire_Across_the_Galaxy-99)[[105]](#cite_note-Mustafar_DB-105)

The rebels, commanded by Ahsoka Tano, were part of a larger rebel movement across the entire galaxy which included several cells, led by Tano and Imperial Senator Bail Organa, and purposely kept in darkness about the existence of one another to prevent information leaks and Imperial crackdowns. Following rumors of an Imperial defeat over Mustafar, spontaneous riots and unrest on several Imperial worlds occurred. The size of the rebellion had also caused concern in the higher ranks of the Empire. With the Grand Inquisitor's death, the Emperor sent his loyal enforcer, Darth Vader, to quash the threat to the Empire's reign.[[99]](#cite_note-Fire_Across_the_Galaxy-99)

 [![The Empire stripped Lothal of its natural resources, causing extreme pollution and scattered fires across the planet.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/71/Polluted_Lothal.png/revision/latest?cb=20180124071108) [![The Empire stripped Lothal of its natural resources, causing extreme pollution and scattered fires across the planet.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/71/Polluted_Lothal.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180124071108)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/71/Polluted_Lothal.png/revision/latest?cb=20180124071108) 

The Empire stripped Lothal of its natural resources, causing extreme pollution and scattered fires across the planet.

 

Following the events on Mustafar, Lord Vader imposed a complete [lockdown and blockade](/wiki/Siege_of_Lothal "Siege of Lothal") of the planet as a disillusioned [Minister](/wiki/Minister "Minister") Tua contacted the Spectres to defect to the rebellion, with ISB [agent](/wiki/Agent "Agent") [Alexsandr Kallus](/wiki/Alexsandr_Kallus "Alexsandr Kallus") using this to lure the rebels back to Lothal and to [capture](/wiki/Mission_to_Lothal_(4_BBY) "Mission to Lothal (4 BBY)") them, but Tua was killed during the escape attempt. This prompted Kallus to frame the rebels for her murder and send Imperial forces to search for them. The rebels evaded arrest by hiding in the [Imperial Complex](/wiki/Imperial_Complex_(Lothal) "Imperial Complex (Lothal)") only to be met by Darth Vader and a duel; however, the rebels escaped in a stolen [shuttle](/wiki/Sentinel-class_landing_craft "Sentinel-class landing craft"). Vader ordered Kallus to raze Lothal re-settlement camp 43, known as Tarkintown, to punish the locals for accepting help from the rebels.[[100]](#cite_note-Siege_of_Lothal-100)

After breaking the Imperial blockade, Vader [attacked](/wiki/Attack_on_Phoenix_Squadron_(4_BBY) "Attack on Phoenix Squadron (4 BBY)") the [Phoenix Cell](/wiki/Phoenix_Cell "Phoenix Cell") fleet that had been sent from the Organa-Tano alliance of rebel cells, who had come to the aid of the Spectres and inflicted high casualties on it, forcing both rebel cells to retreat into [hyperspace](/wiki/Hyperspace "Hyperspace"). With this, the Empire's operations had been a success and while remaining a threat to the Empire even after pushing the rebels off-world, order had nevertheless been restored on the vital world of Lothal and caused a major setback to the rebellion.[[100]](#cite_note-Siege_of_Lothal-100)

#### Further rebel activity[]

:   "*Send a probe to investigate. All leads must be pursued.*"
:   ―Alexsandr Kallus[[106]](#cite_note-TLC-106)

In the aftermath of the victory on Lothal, Admiral Konstantine and the Imperial Navy continued to securing the Outer Rim and also hunting for these rebels. He was accompanied by Agent Kallus, who also had experience dealing with these rebels during the revolt on Lothal who had traveled to the desert planet of [Seelos](/wiki/Seelos "Seelos") to make contact with several retired clone troopers: Rex, Wolffe, and Gregor and hoped to win them over to their cause but Wolffe who distrusted the rebels sent a coded transmission that was picked up by the *Relentless*.[[106]](#cite_note-TLC-106)

 [![A trio of retired clone troopers joined the early Rebellion against the Galactic Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/61/Relics_of_the_Old_Republic_thumb.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20151022023831) [![A trio of retired clone troopers joined the early Rebellion against the Galactic Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/61/Relics_of_the_Old_Republic_thumb.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20151022023831)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/61/Relics_of_the_Old_Republic_thumb.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20151022023831) 

A trio of retired clone troopers joined the early Rebellion against the Galactic Empire.

 

Agent Kallus led a ground assault with three [AT-AT walkers](/wiki/All_Terrain_Armored_Transport "All Terrain Armored Transport"). Konstantine remained aboard the *Relentless* to render air support to Kallus' forces. However, the clones and rebels joined forces and put up a fierce fight and immobilized Kallus AT-AT walkers. The admiral, however, had been unable to render air support because Lord Vader had ordered him to rendezvous with his [shuttle](/wiki/Shuttle "Shuttle") in space,[[106]](#cite_note-TLC-106) but instead of meeting Vader, Konstantine received another Inquisitor known as the [Fifth Brother](/wiki/Fifth_Brother "Fifth Brother"). When Konstantine raised his concerns that the diversion might have compromised Agent Kallus' mission, the Inquisitor merely replied that his struggles were of no concern to him and pledged to stop the rebels himself.[[107]](#cite_note-ROTOR-107)

The rebels later helped deliver relief supplies to the famine-stricken planet [Ibaar](/wiki/Ibaar "Ibaar"), which was being [blockaded](/wiki/Blockade_of_Ibaar "Blockade of Ibaar") by an Imperial fleet. The Empire had doubled the Ibaarians' work quotas and reduced their rations, creating a famine. The first attempt failed and ended with the destruction of the [CR90 corvette](/wiki/CR90_corvette "CR90 corvette") transporting the supplies. Still, the rebel network persisted, and the rebels broke through the blockade with the help of a [Blade Wing prototype starfighter](/wiki/Prototype_B6 "Prototype B6"), which destroyed one of the [*Arquitens*-class command cruisers](/wiki/Arquitens-class_command_cruiser "Arquitens-class command cruiser"). This enabled the rebels to deliver supplies to the Ibaarian resistance, which subsequently distributed the supplies.[[108]](#cite_note-Wings_of_the_Master-108) While searching for a missing patrol in the [Del Zennis system](/wiki/Del_Zennis_system "Del Zennis system"), Commander Sato, Ezra, and several other rebels were captured by an [Imperial Interdictor](/wiki/Interdictor_(Interdictor-class) "Interdictor (Interdictor-class)"), a prototype warship equipped with [gravity well projectors](/wiki/Gravity_well_projector "Gravity well projector") capable of dragging ships out of hyperspace. In response, Kanan, along with Rex and Chopper, staged a rescue mission which ended with the destruction of the Interdictor, dealing a serious blow to Imperial forces.[[109]](#cite_note-Stealth_Strike-109)

 [![Princess Leia Organa of Alderaan feigned loyalty to the Empire while secretly supporting the Rebellion.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Yogar_Lyste_and_Princess_Leia.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161208092528) [![Princess Leia Organa of Alderaan feigned loyalty to the Empire while secretly supporting the Rebellion.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Yogar_Lyste_and_Princess_Leia.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161208092528)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Yogar_Lyste_and_Princess_Leia.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161208092528) 

Princess Leia Organa of Alderaan feigned loyalty to the Empire while secretly supporting the Rebellion.

 

Lacking a permanent base, one rebel group—the Phoenix Squadron—hid in several [spaceports](/wiki/Spaceport "Spaceport") scattered across the planet [Garel](/wiki/Garel "Garel"), but the Empire learned of the rebel presence there and sent a fleet to crush them with most retreating.[[110]](#cite_note-Legacy-110) Following the losses on Garel, Imperial Senator Organa sent his adopted daughter [Princess](/wiki/Princess "Princess") [Leia Organa](/wiki/Leia_Skywalker_Organa_Solo "Leia Skywalker Organa Solo") of [Alderaan](/wiki/Alderaan "Alderaan") to deliver three [*Sphyrna*-class Hammerhead corvettes](/wiki/Sphyrna-class_Hammerhead_corvette "Sphyrna-class Hammerhead corvette") to the Rebellion. Since the Alderaanians could not be seen directly supporting the Phoenix rebels, Bail arranged for Leia to deliver the vessels to Lothal, where in secret the rebels would "steal" the ships. However, the local Imperial commander [Yogar Lyste](/wiki/Yogar_Lyste "Yogar Lyste") had fitted the Hammerhead corvettes with [gravity locks](/wiki/Gravity_lock "Gravity lock"), but this failed when the rebels stole the vessel during a [skirmish](/wiki/Mission_on_Lothal "Mission on Lothal") with Imperial forces.[[111]](#cite_note-A_Princess_on_Lothal-111)

 [![The Rebels captured Fenn Rau, a Mandalorian Protector who served the Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3f/Rau_captured.png/revision/latest?cb=20160128083746) [![The Rebels captured Fenn Rau, a Mandalorian Protector who served the Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3f/Rau_captured.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160128083746)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3f/Rau_captured.png/revision/latest?cb=20160128083746) 

The Rebels captured Fenn Rau, a Mandalorian Protector who served the Empire.

 

With the Empire hunting down the rebels throughout the Outer Rim Territories, the rebels decided to create a new route through the [Lothal sector](/wiki/Lothal_sector "Lothal sector"). Sabine identified the [Concord Dawn system](/wiki/Concord_Dawn_system "Concord Dawn system") as a viable route that the rebels could use. The system was home to the [Mandalorian Protectors](/wiki/Journeyman_Protector "Journeyman Protector"), a Mandalorian faction that was led by [Fenn Rau](/wiki/Fenn_Rau "Fenn Rau"), a veteran of the Clone Wars. Commander Sato sent Phoenix Leader Hera and Sabine on a mission to negotiate safe passage through the Concord Dawn system with Rau. However, Rau had already aligned the Protectors with the Empire and [attacked](/wiki/Dogfight_over_Concord_Dawn "Dogfight over Concord Dawn") Hera's mission, seriously wounding Hera and killing at least one [Phoenix Squadron](/wiki/Phoenix_Squadron "Phoenix Squadron") pilot. In retaliation, Sabine and Kanan infiltrated the [Protectors' camp](/wiki/Protectors_Camp "Protectors Camp") on the [third moon](/wiki/Third_moon_of_Concord_Dawn "Third moon of Concord Dawn") of [Concord Dawn](/wiki/Concord_Dawn "Concord Dawn") and destroyed their [Fang-class](/wiki/Fang-class_Protectorate_fighter "Fang-class Protectorate fighter") fighters. The rebels also captured Rau, who agreed to give the rebels safe passage through the Concord Dawn system in return for keeping his capture a secret from the Empire.[[112]](#cite_note-The_Protector_of_Concord_Dawn-112)

#### Showdown on Malachor[]

:   "*The power within will soon serve the Emperor.*"
:   ―Darth Vader[[113]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-113)

 [![Imperial Inquisitors fighting the Jedi and Maul.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/The_light_and_the_dark.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160401173945) [![Imperial Inquisitors fighting the Jedi and Maul.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/The_light_and_the_dark.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160401173945)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/The_light_and_the_dark.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160401173945) 

Imperial Inquisitors fighting the Jedi and Maul.

 

Eventually, an Inquisitor called the [Eighth Brother](/wiki/Eighth_Brother "Eighth Brother") was sent to [seek](/wiki/Mission_to_Malachor "Mission to Malachor") a [shadow](/wiki/Maul "Maul") on [Malachor](/wiki/Malachor "Malachor"), within the depths of the [Sith Temple](/wiki/Malachor_Sith_Temple "Malachor Sith Temple") on the planet's surface. At the same time Kanan, Ezra and Ahsoka from the rebellion arrived and immediately recognized him as the former [Sith Lord](/wiki/Sith_Lord "Sith Lord") Maul, to who also the Inquisitors confirmed was alive and after the death of the three Inquisitors, Maul turned on his Jedi allies and blinded Kanan. The rebels' problems were further complicated by the arrival of Darth Vader, who had come to take the secrets of the temple for himself. The Jedi removed the holocron from the temple's obelisk, which triggered an implosion that damaged much of the temple. While the two Jedi escaped on the *[Phantom](/wiki/Phantom "Phantom")* with Chopper, Ahsoka stayed behind to hold back Vader. The Imperial mission to Malachor was a partial failure, as both the Jedi and Maul escaped, but Jarrus was blinded in a duel against Maul while Ezra began exploring the dark side, and the rebellion Jedi leadership was broken.[[113]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-113)

But the rebel cells continued working on growing and expanding as the Spectres conducted a [raid](/wiki/Rescue_of_Hondo_Ohnaka "Rescue of Hondo Ohnaka") on [Naraka](/wiki/Naraka "Naraka") [prison](/wiki/Naraka_prison "Naraka prison") and [set out](/wiki/Mission_to_Reklam_Station "Mission to Reklam Station") to [Reklam Station](/wiki/Reklam_Station "Reklam Station"), where the Empire was dismantling thousands of Republic-era [Y-wing starfighters](/wiki/BTL-A4_Y-wing_assault_starfighter/bomber "BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bomber"). Imperial security forces failed to prevent both the destruction of the station and the theft of five Y-wings, which were transferred to [General](/wiki/General "General") [Jan Dodonna](/wiki/Jan_Dodonna "Jan Dodonna")'s [unit](/wiki/Massassi_Group "Massassi Group"). Meanwhile, all the increased rebel activity led Governor [Arihnda Pryce](/wiki/Arihnda_Pryce "Arihnda Pryce") of the Lothal sector to request the aid of the [Seventh Fleet](/wiki/Seventh_Fleet_(Galactic_Empire) "Seventh Fleet (Galactic Empire)") to deal with the Phoenix Group, which was granted by Grand Moff Wilhuff Tarkin and led by [Grand Admiral](/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral") Thrawn, who was promoted for [wiping out](/wiki/Batonn_insurgency "Batonn insurgency") the rebel presence in the [Batonn sector](/wiki/Batonn_sector "Batonn sector"). While Agent Kallus was concerned about the high civilian casualties, Pryce justified Thrawn's actions on the grounds that there were no more rebels there and was given control over the efforts to destroy the growing rebellion before it could become a true threat to the Galactic Empire's reign over the Outer Rim by setting out a strategy.[[114]](#cite_note-Steps_Into_Shadow-114)

#### Wider engagements with the rebels[]

:   "*I will start my operations here, and pull the rebels apart piece by piece. They will be the architects of their own destruction.*"
:   ―Mitth'raw'nuruodo[[114]](#cite_note-Steps_Into_Shadow-114)

 [![Thrawn was a leading officer during the growing rebellion.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/ThrawnBriefing-IronSquadron.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161121151450) [![Thrawn was a leading officer during the growing rebellion.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/ThrawnBriefing-IronSquadron.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161121151450)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/ThrawnBriefing-IronSquadron.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161121151450) 

Thrawn was a leading officer during the growing rebellion.

 

En route to provide supplies to [Teralov](/wiki/Teralov "Teralov"), a [squadron](/wiki/Squadron "Squadron") of [A-wings](/wiki/RZ-1_A-wing_interceptor "RZ-1 A-wing interceptor") and a [transport](/wiki/GR-75_medium_transport "GR-75 medium transport") were [attacked](/wiki/Massacre_near_Teralov "Massacre near Teralov") by an Imperial [*Arquitens*-class command cruiser](/wiki/Arquitens-class_command_cruiser "Arquitens-class command cruiser") that dispatched three [TIE interceptors](/wiki/TIE/IN_interceptor "TIE/IN interceptor") led by [Captain](/wiki/Captain "Captain") [Vult Skerris](/wiki/Vult_Skerris "Vult Skerris"), which quickly wiped out the rebel convoy. Reeling from this loss, the Phoenix rebels dispatched the former [Imperial cadet](/wiki/Imperial_cadet "Imperial cadet") [Sabine Wren](/wiki/Sabine_Wren "Sabine Wren") to [infiltrate](/wiki/Escape_from_Skystrike_Academy "Escape from Skystrike Academy") the [Skystrike Academy](/wiki/Skystrike_Academy "Skystrike Academy") to extract the disillusioned cadets [Wedge Antilles](/wiki/Wedge_Antilles "Wedge Antilles"), [Hobbie](/wiki/Derek_Klivian "Derek Klivian"), and [Rake Gahree](/wiki/Rake_Gahree "Rake Gahree"), in which the rebel and defectors would be able to escape from the Empire's grip.[[115]](#cite_note-The_Antilles_Extraction-115) Later, the rebels, along with the Free Ryloth movement led by Cham Syndulla, went on a [mission](/wiki/Second_mission_to_Ryloth "Second mission to Ryloth") to Ryloth, where they learned that Thrawn—who had studied the tactics used by the rebellion and now had direct command of Imperial forces—had made military advances led by Captain [Slavin](/wiki/Slavin "Slavin") in the [Tann Province](/wiki/Tann_Province "Tann Province").[[116]](#cite_note-HH-116)

The Spectres undertook a [supply run](/wiki/Mission_to_Agamar_(2_BBY) "Mission to Agamar (2 BBY)") to the [Agamar](/wiki/Agamar "Agamar") to obtain [proton bombs](/wiki/Proton_bomb "Proton bomb") from a Separatist transport ship. However, they were captured by a [Separatist holdout](/wiki/Agamar_garrison "Agamar garrison") led by the [super tactical droid](/wiki/ST-series_military_strategic_analysis_and_tactics_droid "ST-series military strategic analysis and tactics droid") General [Kalani](/wiki/Kalani "Kalani"). The droid general wished to end the Clone Wars on his own terms, and challenged the rebels to a battle that would decide the victors, but Imperial forces suddenly arrived and attacked the Separatist ship. The rebels and Separatists came to the conclusion that the Empire was the real victor of the Clone Wars, and decided to unite in order to escape the Empire. While the Imperial Viceroy, [Gar Saxon](/wiki/Gar_Saxon "Gar Saxon"), discovered that the rebels were using the Concord Dawn system to avoid Imperial sector patrols. Saxon destroyed the Protectors' encampment on the third moon of Concord Dawn in an attempt to lure Fenn Rau back.[[93]](#cite_note-ISC-93)

The Empire had planned to impose martial law on the planet [Mykapo](/wiki/Mykapo "Mykapo") which rebels made efforts to evacuate rebel sympathizers. Upon arriving, the flotilla encountered a [light freighter](/wiki/YT-2400_light_freighter "YT-2400 light freighter"), which was engaged in a [dogfight](/wiki/Skirmish_over_Mykapo "Skirmish over Mykapo") with an Imperial advance patrol calling themselves the [Iron Squadron](/wiki/Iron_Squadron "Iron Squadron"). Thrawn, who was aware of this Rebel presence in the system, dispatched a light cruiser to assess the situation, placed under the command of Admiral [Kassius Konstantine](/wiki/Kassius_Konstantine "Kassius Konstantine") in order to test the officer's questionable capabilities. The admiral crippled the Iron Squadron's freighter, prompting the crew with the exception of Mattin to escape aboard the *[Phantom II](/wiki/Phantom_II "Phantom II")* with the Spectres. The rebels returned with reinforcements from Phoenix Squadron to rescue Mattin. During the skirmish, Konstantine's cruiser was badly damaged, and most of his forces were destroyed. The rebels fled into lightspeed just as the *[Chimaera](/wiki/Chimaera "Chimaera")* arrived in the system.[[117]](#cite_note-Iron_Squadron-117)

Soon after, the rebels returned to Lothal and began an [infiltration](/wiki/Infiltration_of_the_Imperial_Armory_Complex "Infiltration of the Imperial Armory Complex") of the [Imperial Armory Complex](/wiki/Imperial_Armory_Complex "Imperial Armory Complex") to obtain the blueprints for a [prototype TIE fighter](/wiki/TIE/d_%22Defender%22_Multi-Role_Starfighter "TIE/d \"Defender\" Multi-Role Starfighter"). However, their mission coincided with a visit by Grand Admiral Thrawn on behalf of Imperial High Command, who was investigating the high rate of sabotage within the factory. The rebels, however, escaped the factory with sensitive Imperial information with the help of the now disillusioned Agent Kallus, who had become an informant for the rebellion. As a result of this rebel attack, Thrawn realized that the Empire had a traitor among their ranks.[[118]](#cite_note-An_Inside_Man-118) Following this, there was an increase of the [Imperial Navy](/wiki/Imperial_Navy "Imperial Navy") presence such as capital ships in and around Lothal as part of Imperial orbital defenses.[[119]](#cite_note-Visions_and_Voices-119) Beyond the Lothal system, rebellious activities increased, such as on Geonosis, where Captain [Brunson](/wiki/Brunson "Brunson") responded to a triggered proximity sensor and discovered the Spectres [vessel](/wiki/Starship "Starship") *Ghost* on the [planet](/wiki/Planet "Planet") who had saved both [Saw Gerrera](/wiki/Saw_Gerrera "Saw Gerrera") after his [Partisans](/wiki/Partisans "Partisans") scout team was killed. Hoping to earn herself and her crew promotions, she attempted to destroy the rebels using [TIE bombers](/wiki/TIE/sa_tactical_bomber "TIE/sa tactical bomber") and [rocket troopers](/wiki/Jumptrooper "Jumptrooper"), and finally by trapping the rebels in an underground [cavern](/wiki/Cave "Cave") in attempt to bury them alive. When she used her [cruiser](/wiki/Cruiser "Cruiser") to block their escape, this backfired, as the *Ghost* fired two [proton torpedoes](/wiki/Proton_torpedo "Proton torpedo"), resulting in the destruction of her ship with the rebels who recovered images of the poison canisters that were used for the [sterilization of Geonosis](/wiki/Sterilization_of_Geonosis "Sterilization of Geonosis") in order to show the Imperial Senate and rally more systems to their cause.[[120]](#cite_note-Ghosts_of_Geonosis-120)

Thrawn later dispatched several [E-XD-series infiltrator droids](/wiki/E-XD-series_infiltrator_droid "E-XD-series infiltrator droid") to search the Outer Rim for rebel bases. However, Kallus used the rebel identity Fulcrum to warn the base's [Chief of Security](/wiki/Chief_of_Security "Chief of Security") Garazeb Orrelios about the threat. As a result, he and his fellow rebels [Chopper](/wiki/C1-10P "C1-10P") and [AP-5](/wiki/AP-5 "AP-5") stopped the infiltrator droid [EXD-9](/wiki/EXD-9 "EXD-9") from [infiltrating](/wiki/EXD-9%27s_infiltration_of_Chopper_Base "EXD-9's infiltration of Chopper Base") the [rebel base](/wiki/Chopper_Base "Chopper Base") on [Atollon](/wiki/Atollon "Atollon"). They turned E-XD9 into an improvised bomb that destroyed a Star Destroyer. Despite their efforts, Thrawn narrowed the search for the rebel base to 94 systems.[[121]](#cite_note-Warhead-121) The Empire lost a local ally in the form of Viceroy Gar Saxon, the [Emperor's Hand](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Hand "Emperor's Hand") and puppet ruler of [Mandalore](/wiki/Mandalore "Mandalore"). Gar Saxon was defeated during a [duel](/wiki/Skirmish_on_Krownest "Skirmish on Krownest") with the rebel Sabine Wren on the planet of [Krownest](/wiki/Krownest "Krownest"). Saxon's death triggered a power vacuum among the Mandalorians. Sabine then joined forces with her mother, [Ursa Wren](/wiki/Ursa_Wren "Ursa Wren"), and the former Protectors' leader Fenn Rau to reunify the Mandalorians.[[122]](#cite_note-Legacy_of_Mandalore-122)

Continuing his investigation into the rebel mole, Grand Admiral Thrawn began screening the Imperial sector command staff within the Lothal sector with the help of Imperial Security Bureau Colonel [Wullf Yularen](/wiki/Wullf_Yularen "Wullf Yularen"), a veteran of the Clone Wars. Thrawn summoned several Imperial officials including Agent Kallus, [Lieutenant](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant") Yogar Lyste, Captain Brunson, and [Commander](/wiki/Commander "Commander") [Brom Titus](/wiki/Brom_Titus "Brom Titus") for questioning aboard his flagship, *Chimaera*. After learning that Thrawn was intercepting Kallus' transmissions, the Spectres and Rex mounted a [mission](/wiki/Rescue_of_Alexsandr_Kallus "Rescue of Alexsandr Kallus") to rescue Kallus. During the course of the mission, Kallus joined forces with the rebels to delete the planet Atollon, which hosted Chopper Base, from Thrawn's database. However, Kallus elected not to escape with the rebels and instead framed his colleague Lyste as Fulcrum. Thrawn learned of Kallus' deception but kept this information secret since he hoped to manipulate Kallus into uncovering the Phoenix rebel base.[[123]](#cite_note-TIE-123)

#### A united foe[]

 [![The Imperial Navy led efforts to counter the Rebel Alliance.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/Battle_of_Atollon.png/revision/latest?cb=20220309042201) [![The Imperial Navy led efforts to counter the Rebel Alliance.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/Battle_of_Atollon.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220309042201)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/Battle_of_Atollon.png/revision/latest?cb=20220309042201) 

The Imperial Navy led efforts to counter the Rebel Alliance.

 

With full-scale rebellion on the horizon, Imperial Senator [Mon Mothma](/wiki/Mon_Mothma "Mon Mothma") would openly betray the Empire by seeking to unite the various rebellions cells into one organization. She began by firstly publicly condemning the reign of Emperor Palpatine after the [Ghorman Massacre](/wiki/Ghorman_Massacre "Ghorman Massacre") which led to Commander Vult Skerris leading the [effort](/wiki/Operation_Handoff "Operation Handoff") for her capture in the [Archeon Nebula](/wiki/Archeon_Nebula "Archeon Nebula"). However, the mission ended in failure, and she was able to escape. This led to her broadcasting a speech to rebels across the galaxy over [Dantooine](/wiki/Dantooine "Dantooine"), which led to the formation of various rebel cells into the alliance to restore the Galactic Republic and, along with her resignation from the Imperial Senate, the beginning of a true united rebellion.[[124]](#cite_note-Secret_Cargo-124)

Soon after its founding, the Rebel Alliance pressed on with the planned operation on Lothal by [stealing](/wiki/Mission_to_recover_Imperial_codes "Mission to recover Imperial codes") clearance codes from the Imperial Security Bureau station on [Killun 71](/wiki/Killun_71 "Killun 71") to allow their forces to mount a successful attack on the Empire.[[125]](#cite_note-DAD-125) However, the planned rebel attack on Lothal did not go forward thanks to Thrawn, who had discovered the location of Chopper Base, the headquarters of the Phoenix Group. Thrawn's fleet [blockaded](/wiki/Battle_of_Atollon "Battle of Atollon") Atollon and inflicted heavy casualties on rebel forces. Thrawn launched a ground assault after an orbital bombardment. Meanwhile, Ezra, who had escaped the fighting, enlisted the help of [Clan Wren](/wiki/Clan_Wren "Clan Wren").[[126]](#cite_note-Zero_Hour-126)

In response, Governor Pryce dispatched Jumptroopers, but these reinforcements failed to stop the Mandalorians from destroying the last Interdictor cruiser. Despite Thrawn storming Chopper Base, the rebels and Imperials were attacked by an angry [Bendu](/wiki/Bendu "Bendu"), an enigmatic being that was living on Atollon, who used his Force powers to devastate the rebel base before being subdued by Thrawn. The surviving rebel and Mandalorian forces fled the battle as the Empire wiped out the Phoenix Squadron; however, the Empire was still unaware of the true scale of the Rebel Alliance.[[126]](#cite_note-Zero_Hour-126) Nonetheless, the routing at Atollon was seen as proof by the rebels that they were not yet ready for open war with the Empire.[[127]](#cite_note-ITNOTR-127)

Meanwhile, [civil war](/wiki/Mandalorian_Civil_War_(Imperial_Era) "Mandalorian Civil War (Imperial Era)") raged on Imperial-occupied Mandalore, with the Rebel Alliance setting out to rescue Sabine's father and Imperial prisoner [Alrich Wren](/wiki/Alrich_Wren "Alrich Wren") from Governor [Tiber Saxon](/wiki/Tiber_Saxon "Tiber Saxon"). Clan Wren rescued Alrich with the help of the rebels. In response, Saxon unleashed the Arc Pulse Generator known as the Duchess against the Clan Wren forces, killing many. Sabine led the Mandalorians and rebels on a mission to infiltrate Saxon's Star Destroyer, which was above Sundari and were ambushed by Imperial forces, which resulted in the Mandalorians and rebels' success in destroying the weapon and Saxon's flagship.[[92]](#cite_note-Heroes_of_Mandalore-92)

While not pursuing an agenda of open war, the rebels continued their campaign and mounted successful raids on both [Jalindi](/wiki/Mission_to_Jalindi "Mission to Jalindi") and the [Faos Station](/wiki/Mission_to_Faos_Station "Mission to Faos Station"). The Empire failed to stop both the Partisan and Spectre efforts, resulting in the loss of Commander Brom Titus and Captain Slavin.[[127]](#cite_note-ITNOTR-127) On Lothal, the Imperial Security Bureau conducted a successful raid against a suspected rebel cell allied with the Spectres.[[128]](#cite_note-The_Occupation-128) However, the efforts of the Lothal rebels and their allies brought about the [Liberation of Lothal](/wiki/Liberation_of_Lothal "Liberation of Lothal"), with Thrawn going missing when Bridger forced himself and the Grand Admiral into hyperspace aboard the *Chimaera*.[[129]](#cite_note-Family&Farewell-129) At some point, a [prisoner uprising](/wiki/Uprising_on_Cherridan "Uprising on Cherridan") was launched within the [Cherridan Imperial labor camp](/wiki/Cherridan_Imperial_labor_camp "Cherridan Imperial labor camp"), but it was put down in a brutal fashion. A failure for the Empire, however, came when an [assault](/wiki/Assault_on_Winter%27s_Edge "Assault on Winter's Edge") on the [Winter's Edge stormtrooper garrison](/wiki/Winter%27s_Edge_stormtrooper_garrison "Winter's Edge stormtrooper garrison") ended in success for the enemy.[[130]](#cite_note-GotW-130)

#### Destruction of Jedha City[]

:   "*There is no Death Star. We're informing the Senate that Jedha was destroyed in a mining disaster.*"
:   ―Darth Vader[[131]](#cite_note-Rogue_One_Adaptation_4-131)

 [![The Death Star firing on Jedha City.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/MeltingJedhaCity-RO.png/revision/latest?cb=20210221224849) [![The Death Star firing on Jedha City.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/MeltingJedhaCity-RO.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210221224849)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/MeltingJedhaCity-RO.png/revision/latest?cb=20210221224849) 

The Death Star firing on Jedha City.

 

A [local insurgency](/wiki/Jedha_insurgency "Jedha insurgency") was carried out by Gerrera's Partisans on the [desert](/wiki/Desert "Desert") [moon](/wiki/Moon "Moon") of [Jedha](/wiki/Jedha "Jedha"),[[132]](#cite_note-RO-132) an Imperial [protectorate](/wiki/Protectorate_(government_system) "Protectorate (government system)"),[[133]](#cite_note-Jedha_DB-133) in the ancient streets of [Jedha City](/wiki/Jedha_City "Jedha City") as part of their [larger campaign](/wiki/Campaigns_of_Saw_Gerrera%27s_Partisans "Campaigns of Saw Gerrera's Partisans") against the Galactic Empire. Unknown to many of them, Director Orson Krennic and Grand Moff Tarkin had decided to test the capability of the Empire's new [superweapon](/wiki/Superweapon "Superweapon")-equipped [battle station](/wiki/Battle_station "Battle station"), the [Death Star](/wiki/DS-1_Orbital_Battle_Station "DS-1 Orbital Battle Station"), by [firing](/wiki/Destruction_of_Jedha_City "Destruction of Jedha City") its [superlaser](/wiki/Superlaser "Superlaser") at the city using a single-[reactor](/wiki/Reactor "Reactor") ignition.[[132]](#cite_note-RO-132) At least 3% of Jedha's Imperial forces were presumed destroyed in the blast as well, having been unable to evacuate. The Imperial casualties included such forces as [JN-093's squad](/wiki/JN-093%27s_squad "JN-093's squad"), who had been assigned to check possible rebel hiding spots outside the city, leaving them unable to get to the extraction point in time.[[134]](#cite_note-Rogue_One_novel-134) The Empire subsequently fabricated a cover story for the Imperial Senate that Jedha was destroyed in a mere mining disaster.[[132]](#cite_note-RO-132)

#### Battle of Scarif[]

 [![Romodi and Tarkin discussing the Battle of Scarif.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a6/Tarkin_Scarif.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170106061908) [![Romodi and Tarkin discussing the Battle of Scarif.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a6/Tarkin_Scarif.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20170106061908)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a6/Tarkin_Scarif.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170106061908) 

Romodi and Tarkin discussing the Battle of Scarif.

 

A group of rebels under the callsign [Rogue One](/wiki/Rogue_One "Rogue One") had [captured](/wiki/Battle_of_Scarif "Battle of Scarif") the blueprints for the Death Star, which had just been completed after nearly two decades of work on [Scarif](/wiki/Scarif "Scarif"). They infiltrated the planetary shield in a stolen [*Zeta*-class Heavy Cargo Shuttle](/wiki/Zeta-class_Heavy_Cargo_Shuttle "Zeta-class Heavy Cargo Shuttle") and waged a guerrilla assault on the base's outskirts, drawing away Imperial forces, while the rebels could access the [Citadel Tower](/wiki/Citadel_Tower "Citadel Tower").[[132]](#cite_note-RO-132)

However, they received support from the [Alliance Fleet](/wiki/Rebel_Alliance_Navy "Rebel Alliance Navy") under Admiral [Raddus](/wiki/Raddus "Raddus"), whose forces engaged the Imperial Star Destroyers above Scarif and aimed to destroy the [Shield Gate](/wiki/Shield_Gate "Shield Gate"). Rogue One transmitted the stolen plans to the fleet above, but by the order of Grand Moff Wilhuff Tarkin, they along with [Director](/wiki/Director "Director") [Orson Krennic](/wiki/Orson_Callan_Krennic "Orson Callan Krennic") were eradicated by a low-powered blast from the arrived Death Star that destroyed the Citadel and surrounding area. By then, the Sith Lord Darth Vader's forces had destroyed the rebel ships that did not manage to retreat, but he failed to get the plans back as they were transported to Imperial Senator and Princess Leia Organa on the *[Tantive IV](/wiki/Tantive_IV "Tantive IV")*.[[132]](#cite_note-RO-132)

#### Reveal of the Death Star[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Secret mission to Tatooine](/wiki/Secret_mission_to_Tatooine "Secret mission to Tatooine"), [Dissolution of the Imperial Senate](/wiki/Dissolution_of_the_Imperial_Senate "Dissolution of the Imperial Senate"), [Destruction of Alderaan](/wiki/Destruction_of_Alderaan "Destruction of Alderaan") and [Alderaan vigil rioting](/wiki/Alderaan_vigil_rioting "Alderaan vigil rioting")

:   "*Alderaan was supposedly selected as the Death Star's first full-scale target to compel Princess Leia into revealing the location of the main rebel base. But this is only a partial explanation. The Death Star ceased to be a secret weapon as soon as it entered Alderaanian orbit. It was never going to leave the planet intact. It is therefore highly likely that Tarkin and the Emperor had pre-selected Alderaan because of, rather than in spite of, its inhabitants' pacifism and the way their morality had caused the Empire numerous political problems in the Imperial Senate. They intended to send a message about where all forms of resistance to Imperial rule—even non-violent resistance—would now lead, something Palpatine made even more clear when he simultaneously disbanded the Senate.*"
:   ―Beaumont Kin reflects on the destruction of Alderaan[[11]](#cite_note-Rise_Fall-11)

 [![The Death Star closes in on Alderaan.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/39/Aldnds3.png/revision/latest?cb=20130220053951) [![The Death Star closes in on Alderaan.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/39/Aldnds3.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130220053951)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/39/Aldnds3.png/revision/latest?cb=20130220053951) 

The Death Star closes in on Alderaan.

 

Imperial forces commanded by Darth Vader captured one of the leaders of the Alliance and the one who possessed the plans, Princess of Alderaan Leia Organa—who, unknown to Vader, was his own daughter.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135) While nearly all of the old institutions of the Republic had been swept away in the intervening decades, this provided Sidious the opportunity to finally wipe away the last vestiges of the old [democracy](/wiki/Democracy "Democracy"), and [dissolve the Imperial Senate](/wiki/Dissolution_of_the_Imperial_Senate "Dissolution of the Imperial Senate") permanently. This brought governance of the various systems of the Empire directly under the purview of the Regional Governors and the Imperial Military.[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)

Organa's presence, and her refusal to give up the location of the Alliance's base, precipitated Grand Moff Tarkin's decision to test-fire the newly completed Death Star's primary weapon on her homeworld, Alderaan,[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2) although historian [Beaumont Kin](/wiki/Beaumont_Kin "Beaumont Kin") later theorized Tarkin and Palpatine had pre-selected the world as a perfect target for the Death Star.[[11]](#cite_note-Rise_Fall-11) In an instant, the Imperial Military's superweapon utterly destroyed the populous, influential world. In so doing, Tarkin hoped not only to force Organa to submit but also to strike fear into any others who sought to rebel against Imperial rule.[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2) Soon after the destruction of Alderaan, dubbed "[the Disaster](/wiki/Destruction_of_Alderaan "Destruction of Alderaan")" by Alderaanian refugees, vigils for the dead were held on [Coruscant](/wiki/Coruscant "Coruscant")'s [Level 3204](/wiki/Level_3204 "Level 3204"), with many on the level having formerly lived on Alderaan. However, as soon as the circumstances behind the event became clear, the once-peaceful vigils turned into [violent riots](/wiki/Alderaan_vigil_rioting "Alderaan vigil rioting"), with many calling for justice and revolution against the Empire. [Imperial stormtroopers](/wiki/Stormtrooper "Stormtrooper") and [Coruscant underworld police](/wiki/Coruscant_underworld_police "Coruscant underworld police") were soon called in to restore the peace, and began arresting and eventually relocating those who questioned Imperial rule.[[136]](#cite_note-One_Thousand_Levels_Down-136)

#### Rescue of Princess Organa[]

:   "*Yes?*"  
    "*We've captured a freighter entering remains of the Alderaan system. Its markings matches those ships that blasted its way out of Mos Eisley.*"  
    "*They must be trying to return the stolen plans to the Princess. She may yet be of some use to us.*"
:   ―Wilhuff Tarkin, Imperial Docking Bay Control, and Darth Vader[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)

 [![The destruction of the Death Star rendered nearly two decades of work and resources wasted, leaving the Empire on the brink of disaster.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/89/Exds.png/revision/latest?cb=20250203221100) [![The destruction of the Death Star rendered nearly two decades of work and resources wasted, leaving the Empire on the brink of disaster.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/89/Exds.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/230?cb=20250203221100)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/89/Exds.png/revision/latest?cb=20250203221100) 

The destruction of the Death Star rendered nearly two decades of work and resources wasted, leaving the Empire on the brink of disaster.

 

Eventually, Organa was [rescued from the Death Star](/wiki/Rescue_of_Princess_Leia "Rescue of Princess Leia") by the unlikely alliance of smuggler [Han Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo"), her unknowing twin brother [Luke Skywalker](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker") and Obi-Wan Kenobi, who sacrificed himself in his duel with Darth Vader. The group escaped the Imperial fortress and fled to the Alliance base on [Yavin 4](/wiki/Yavin_4 "Yavin 4"), pursued by the Death Star. At Yavin 4, the Empire and the Rebels engaged in a [major battle](/wiki/Battle_of_Yavin "Battle of Yavin"), with the fate of the rebellion hanging in the balance. Despite destroying a great many of the Alliance's starfighters, the battle ultimately ended up a major defeat for the Imperial forces, when Skywalker fired the shot which destroyed the Death Star. This marked the Rebellion's first major victory against the Empire.[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)

Now viewing the growing Alliance as a credible threat, Sidious issued a communiqué the morning after the Death Star's destruction ordering all ongoing ISB operations be superseded for the immediate detention of known and suspected rebel sympathizers. Admiral [Kendal Ozzel](/wiki/Kendal_Ozzel "Kendal Ozzel") ordered the fleet into battle readiness.[[137]](#cite_note-Smuggler's_Run-137) To keep the Rebellion off balance, the Empire engaged in rushed and scrambled offenses across the galaxy and raided spice worlds such as [Kerev Doi](/wiki/Kerev_Doi "Kerev Doi") in an attempt to cut off possible sources of income for the Alliance.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) With major military redeployments occurring around the clock, the Imperial Military began to mobilize for a full-scale galactic war, while the Rebellion began to push into the populous Imperial Mid Rim in a failed operation that only months later would become known as the [Mid Rim Retreat](/wiki/Mid_Rim_Retreat "Mid Rim Retreat"), its ultimate demise owing in large part to the Empire's numerical superiority.[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49)

#### Aftermath of Yavin[]

:   "*We kept the skeleton of the Republic for nearly twenty years while the Death Star was constructed. Twenty years, my apprentice. All that planning is now a layer of dust orbiting around Yavin… Now, we no longer have the Senate to hold order. We do not have the Death Star to force it. Our greatest weapon is gone. Our production is in ashes. We are besieged. In all these years, we have never skirted closer to disaster.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[96]](#cite_note-Vader_1-96)

Following losses at [Phindar](/wiki/Phindar "Phindar") and [Portocari](/wiki/Battle_of_Portocari "Battle of Portocari") two weeks following the Battle of Yavin, members of the [Nashtah Squadron](/wiki/Nashtah_Squadron "Nashtah Squadron") learned at the [Zero Angle](/wiki/Zero_Angle "Zero Angle") bar on the [Bright Jewel Oversector Flight Base](/wiki/Bright_Jewel_Oversector_Flight_Base "Bright Jewel Oversector Flight Base") on [Axxila III](/wiki/Axxila_III "Axxila III") that the military would undergo a mass reorganization, rescinding the classification between Imperial Navy and Imperial Army pilots.[[138]](#cite_note-Last_Call-138) Unbeknownst to the Empire following the destruction of the first Death Star, the Rebel Alliance had [evacuated their base](/wiki/Evacuation_of_Yavin_4 "Evacuation of Yavin 4") on Yavin 4 and was orbiting the remote world of [Orto Plutonia](/wiki/Orto_Plutonia "Orto Plutonia") in the [Pantora system](/wiki/Pantora_system "Pantora system"), located in the [Sujimis sector](/wiki/Sujimis_sector "Sujimis sector"), with the nearest Imperial presence being Moff [Abran Balfour](/wiki/Abran_Balfour "Abran Balfour"), who patrolled the world of [Llanic](/wiki/Llanic "Llanic") situated at the intersection of the Llanic Spice Route and [Triellus Trade Route](/wiki/Triellus_Trade_Route "Triellus Trade Route").

A brief [skirmish](/wiki/Skirmish_over_Llanic "Skirmish over Llanic") erupted when Luke Skywalker, in the luxury yacht the *[Desert Jewel](/wiki/Desert_Jewel "Desert Jewel")*, attacked two TIE fighters assaulting a [Kupohan](/wiki/Kupohan "Kupohan") ship. Unknown to Skywalker at the time, the ship was in reality carrying a Kupohan spy with vital intelligence regarding [Drusil Bephorin](/wiki/Drusil_Bephorin "Drusil Bephorin"), a [Givin](/wiki/Givin "Givin") woman with a reputation for being able to slice into security systems at an astonishing rate and interpret encoded messages at breathtaking speed. Desperately searching for the Alliance Fleet, the Empire sought to convince Drusil to use her cryptographic skills to aid them and kept her in a sort of luxurious imprisonment on [Denon](/wiki/Denon "Denon") in an effort to sway her favor. Secretly, Drusil offered to join the Alliance as long as the rebels could extract her family to the ocean world of [Omereth](/wiki/Omereth "Omereth"), a task given to [Major](/wiki/Major "Major") [Bren Derlin](/wiki/Bren_Derlin "Bren Derlin"). After a side mission to the Deep Core, Luke Skywalker, [R2-D2](/wiki/R2-D2 "R2-D2") and [Nakari Kelen](/wiki/Nakari_Kelen "Nakari Kelen") extracted Drusil after an elaborate chase across the galaxy, hampering the Empire's plans for a retaliatory strike against the Rebellion.[[139]](#cite_note-Heir-139)

 [![Vader concludes negotiations with Jabba.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ea/VaderConcludesNegotiationsWithJabba-2015StarWars4.png/revision/latest?cb=20150422215420) [![Vader concludes negotiations with Jabba.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ea/VaderConcludesNegotiationsWithJabba-2015StarWars4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20150422215420)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ea/VaderConcludesNegotiationsWithJabba-2015StarWars4.png/revision/latest?cb=20150422215420) 

Vader concludes negotiations with Jabba.

 

In addition to rebel agents wreaking havoc internally, the Empire suffered desultory raids by rebel forces emboldened by their successful strike against the Death Star, with the rebels that destroyed it—[Red Squadron](/wiki/Red_Squadron_(Rebel_Alliance) "Red Squadron (Rebel Alliance)")—continuing to harass the Empire, especially during a [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Giju "Mission to Giju") above [Giju](/wiki/Giju "Giju") where a transport carrying underground rebel leaders was evacuated from the planet. The Empire also continued to suffer setbacks from the Rebellion's golden boy, Luke Skywalker, including the trespass by the Jedi Purge survivor into the [Temple of Eedit](/wiki/Temple_of_Eedit "Temple of Eedit")—an abandoned Jedi temple under guard of the Empire—on Devaron.[[88]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-88)

Despite the temporary turmoil instilled by the Rebels' bold strikes, the Alliance attempted even bigger operations to capitalize on its former success. Most notable was an attempt to assault, infiltrate and destroy [Weapons Factory Alpha](/wiki/Weapons_Factory_Alpha "Weapons Factory Alpha") located in the [Corellian Industrial Cluster](/wiki/Corellian_Industrial_Cluster "Corellian Industrial Cluster") on [Cymoon 1](/wiki/Cymoon_1 "Cymoon 1"), reputedly home to the largest weapons factory in the galaxy. In the meantime, the Empire opened negotiations with the [Hutt Clan](/wiki/Hutt_Clan "Hutt Clan"), led by Jabba the Hutt, to secure raw materials for Imperial Military production and secure their support for their expansion in the Outer Rim. The Rebels ultimately destroyed the factory, crippling Imperial production and causing another major setback.[[140]](#cite_note-SW1-140)[[141]](#cite_note-SW2-141)[[142]](#cite_note-SW3-142)

#### Vader's punishment[]

:   "*Tarkin had vision. You have graphs.*"  
    "*I have graphs* and *the command.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Cassio Tagge[[143]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_(2015)_2-143)

For Vader's failure to stop the destruction of both the Death Star and the Cymoon 1 factory, Darth Sidious relieved him of much of his authority and assigned him to serve in the military instead of commanding it. As much of the Empire's military command had been lost with the Death Star, the Emperor appointed General [Cassio Tagge](/wiki/Cassio_Tagge "Cassio Tagge"), the [Chief of the Imperial Army](/wiki/Chief_of_the_Imperial_Army "Chief of the Imperial Army"), to the rank of [Grand General](/wiki/Grand_General "Grand General") and assigned him command of Imperial Military matters due to his foresight to fear the Alliance Fleet and doubt the invincibility of the Death Star. The Emperor pressed the military to focus on conquering the Outer Rim and destroying the Rebellion—with the Death Star gone and the Senate disbanded, the Empire lacked efficient means to keep dissenting systems in line.[[96]](#cite_note-Vader_1-96)

Additionally, Imperial statisticians noted predictable increases in piracy following the Death Star's destruction. As a result, the military was to preserve order by any means necessary until the [second Death Star](/wiki/DS-2_Death_Star_II_Mobile_Battle_Station "DS-2 Death Star II Mobile Battle Station") was completed.[[96]](#cite_note-Vader_1-96) Under Tagge's command, the conquest of the Outer Rim progressed, with Tagge launching a significant crackdown on criminal elements that had gone unchecked in the past. The only criminal powers allowed to survive were the Hutts, per Vader's agreement with Jabba. The destruction of competitors also allowed the Hutts to capitalize on "new markets" supplied by the Empire.[[144]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_7-144) After Doctor [Cylo](/wiki/Cylo "Cylo")'s attempted [hijacking](/wiki/Cylo_Hijacking "Cylo Hijacking") of the in-construction [*Executor*-class Star Dreadnought](/wiki/Executor-class_Star_Dreadnought "Executor-class Star Dreadnought") *[Executor](/wiki/Executor "Executor")* was put down by Vader, Palpatine demoted Tagge and rewarded Vader with command, which Vader quickly took advantage of by killing Tagge.[[145]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_(2015)_25-145)

#### Search for Luke Skywalker[]

 [![The rebels had began to make a push to defeat the Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/31/SiegeOnTureenVII-2015StarWars25.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170714193500) [![The rebels had began to make a push to defeat the Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/31/SiegeOnTureenVII-2015StarWars25.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170714193500)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/31/SiegeOnTureenVII-2015StarWars25.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170714193500) 

The rebels had began to make a push to defeat the Empire.

 

While the Rebellion made a drive to defeat the Empire, Vader meanwhile searched for Luke Skywalker.[[146]](#cite_note-Vader_Down_1-146) The Empire attempted to pin down rebel activity, but were unable to stop them from [seizing control](/wiki/Hijacking_of_the_Harbinger "Hijacking of the Harbinger") of the [*Harbinger*](/wiki/Harbinger_(Imperial_I-class) "Harbinger (Imperial I-class)") from the grip of the Imperial Navy.[[147]](#cite_note-SW22-147) However, the Empire started a counterattack and prevented rebel guerrilla and military desultory raids that had occurred in the aftermath of Yavin.[[148]](#cite_note-SW24-148)[[149]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_Annual_2-149)[[150]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_37-150) Further Imperial success came on the mineral planet [Crait](/wiki/Crait "Crait"), where the Empire [confronted](/wiki/Mission_to_Crait "Mission to Crait") the Alliance after an [attack on the Alliance Fleet](/wiki/Attack_on_the_Rebel_fleet "Attack on the Rebel fleet") as they searched out a possible new rebel base.[[151]](#cite_note-Storms_of_Crait-151)

The Rebellion embarked on a massive military campaign to liberate hundreds of worlds under Imperial control by pushing into the heavily populated Mid Rim. With thousands of starships, hundreds of battle groups and dozens of worlds involved in the operation, it was initially met with stunning success as Imperial forces, unprepared for such a large-scale operation and shattered from the recent shake-ups in the Imperial hierarchy, fell back from world to world, allowing the Rebellion to press further into Imperial space. Taking the factory-deserts of [Phorsa Gedd](/wiki/Phorsa_Gedd "Phorsa Gedd") and the [Ducal Palace](/wiki/Ducal_Palace "Ducal Palace") of [Bamayar](/wiki/Bamayar "Bamayar"), the Rebellion's advance gradually slowed as Imperial resistance stiffened. Eighteen months into the operation, fearing to overextend the fleet and occupied with the consolidation of worlds now under Rebel control, [High Command](/wiki/Alliance_High_Command "Alliance High Command") ordered the defense of occupied territories, and shortly thereafter the slow withdrawal of Alliance military resources back towards the Outer Rim.[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49)

#### Project Swarm[]

##### Chasing leads[]

:   "*Listen, they got through debriefing that* spy*. I—I thought you'd like to* know*. He says someone sabotaged the Empire's* computers*. Made a real mess of their search for* us*. They're keeping it quiet, but— he says he heard it from a comms jockey on the* Executor*. They put out an arrest warrant for the* culprit*. Human woman. Archaeotech expertise. Traveling with two dangerous droids. It's set them back a couple* weeks*, he says. Long enough to get the* shield up*, huh? Maybe even get those* evac plans *up to speed. I always* knew *she was good‐on the inside.*"  
    "[To Vulaada Klam and Korin Aphra] *Should we tell him she also saved the Emperor's life?*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker and Magna Tolvan[[152]](#cite_note-Epilogue-152)

While the loss of both Tarkin and the Death Star itself were significant, Imperial resolve toward putting down the rebellion only increased. For the next three and a half years, Imperial forces under the direct command of Darth Vader relentlessly pursued the Alliance. While the hunt was personal for Vader, having learned that the young rebel Skywalker was actually his son, the Imperial Military nevertheless scoured the galaxy with [Imperial probe droids](/wiki/Viper_probe_droid "Viper probe droid")[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41) under the name [Project Swarm](/wiki/Project_Swarm "Project Swarm"). The operation also made use of a team of archaeological consultants due to the Rebel Alliance's prior uses of ancient structures as bases, with Vader's old contact Doctor Chelli Aphra assigned as part of the group;[[153]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_37-153) while her role in preventing the [plot to assassinate Emperor Palpatine](/wiki/Plot_to_assassinate_Emperor_Palpatine "Plot to assassinate Emperor Palpatine") afforded her a degree of protection from Vader,[[154]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-154) she believed the Sith Lord was keeping her close and waiting[[153]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_37-153) for any good excuse[[154]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-154) to silence his old loose end.[[153]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_37-153) Imperial forces also picked up Aphra and Vader's old [assassin droids](/wiki/Assassin_droid "Assassin droid") during a sweep of the [Ring of Kafrene](/wiki/Ring_of_Kafrene "Ring of Kafrene"), installing restraining bolts on both and assigning them as interrogation specialists on the *Executor*.[[154]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-154)

 [![Doctor Chelli Lona Aphra (left) questioned the usefulness of the archaeological side of Project Swarm, whereas Professor Rupo Ud (center) argued in its favor, secretly seeing it as a way to further general archaeological knowledge.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c3/UdPlotting-2016DoctorAphra37.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200328065129) [![Doctor Chelli Lona Aphra (left) questioned the usefulness of the archaeological side of Project Swarm, whereas Professor Rupo Ud (center) argued in its favor, secretly seeing it as a way to further general archaeological knowledge.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c3/UdPlotting-2016DoctorAphra37.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20200328065129)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c3/UdPlotting-2016DoctorAphra37.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200328065129) 

Doctor Chelli Lona Aphra (left) questioned the usefulness of the archaeological side of Project Swarm, whereas Professor Rupo Ud (center) argued in its favor, secretly seeing it as a way to further general archaeological knowledge.

 

Under the command of [Major](/wiki/Major "Major") [Yaltza](/wiki/Yaltza "Yaltza"), who was ultimately executed by Vader for a lack of results, and then General [Maximilian Veers](/wiki/Maximilian_Veers "Maximilian Veers"),[[153]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_37-153) Project Swarm saw thousands of probe droids search the galaxy[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41) while the archaeologists did their work; whereas Aphra questioned the usefulness of their department, Professor [Rupo Ud](/wiki/Rupo_Ud "Rupo Ud") pushed the theory the rebels would be using another historical site. In secret, Ud did not care about the Empire or rebels at all and simply saw Project Swarm as a way to allocate major resources towards an archaeological survey. After her pleas to Vader fell on deaf ears, Aphra decided to devote herself to finding the rebel base, thereby securing Palpatine's favor and keeping herself out of Vader's grasp forever. After a probe droid was shot down over [Ash Moon 1](/wiki/Ash_Moon_1 "Ash Moon 1"), Veers led a team to the surface to discover only a group of [Central Isopter](/wiki/Central_Isopter "Central Isopter") pilgrims, who he ordered be used as target practice, while Ud led the study of the Isopter temple. Intending to take control of the archaeological team, Aphra tricked Ud into falling into a trap and left her ward [Vulaada Klam](/wiki/Vulaada_Klam "Vulaada Klam") behind,[[153]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_37-153) intending to keep the young girl out of her dangerous life.[[154]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-154)

The only update of interest to Veers came when a masked individual—who carried rebel rations and claimed to know Jedi [mind tricks](/wiki/Mind_trick "Mind trick")—was taken captive and brought to the *Executor*, where he was unmasked and revealed to be the now-Supervisor Aphra's father, [Korin](/wiki/Korin_Aphra "Korin Aphra").[[153]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_37-153) At the urging of his daughter and due to his bias against the Rebel Alliance due to its habit of ruining ancient sites, Korin revealed he had encountered a rebel cell on [Asteroid Helix 13-v](/wiki/Asteroid_Helix_13-v "Asteroid Helix 13-v"), where the two Aphras set to work—with Korin coming to see some benefits to the Empire's existence if it was directed towards archaeology—and Vader investigated a presence in the Force, leading him to an altar people had prayed to over the years. The altar made Vader experience visions of his past, but he destroyed it and soon departed, ignoring Korin's pleas to spare the historical site after he ordered bombers annihilate the temple. Although Vader's order to withdraw pulled the Empire off the asteroid before a full sweep could be conducted, with Vader claiming he did so because the rebels had already left, the Aphras had found evidence the rebels had departed for a cold location.[[154]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-154)

En route to the *Executor*, the *Lambda*-class T-4a shuttle carrying both Aphras and BT-1 was attacked by[[154]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-154) the rebel starship *[Unnamed](/wiki/Unnamed "Unnamed")* under Aphra's former lover [Magna Tolvan](/wiki/Magna_Tolvan "Magna Tolvan"), herself a former Imperial[[155]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_39-155) who predicted how the stormtroopers aboard would react and incapacitated all Imperials aboard.[[154]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-154) As the Imperials and Korin were taken captive, Aphra avoided the rebels and extracted the location of their new base—[Echo Base](/wiki/Echo_Base "Echo Base") on the planet [Hoth](/wiki/Hoth "Hoth")—from Tolvan's [electro-tattoos](/wiki/Electro-tattoo "Electro-tattoo") after sleeping with her. She also contacted BT-1 and, after giving the droid permission to kill anyone but her father, ensured her unconscious father was safely deposited back on their Lambda, which she launched with coordinates for Ash Moon I so he could meet up with Klam. Tolvan and the *Unnamed* followed close behind,[[155]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_39-155) ensuring that Aphra's loved ones could meet each other and become a group of their own.[[156]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_40-156) Uniting with Tolvan, Korin—who abandoned his[[152]](#cite_note-Epilogue-152) anti-rebel ideals[[154]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-154)—and Klam joined the rebellion and lived in Echo Base.[[152]](#cite_note-Epilogue-152)

 [![Death Squadron over the planet Tython during the hunt for Echo Base](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6b/Tython-2016DoctorAphra40.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191211173540) [![Death Squadron over the planet Tython during the hunt for Echo Base](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6b/Tython-2016DoctorAphra40.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20191211173540)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6b/Tython-2016DoctorAphra40.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191211173540) 

Death Squadron over the planet Tython during the hunt for Echo Base

 

Rather than fulfill her previous idea of giving Echo Base's location to the Empire,[[153]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_37-153) Aphra led Vader and a group of Imperial forces under Colonel [Bryce](/wiki/Bryce_(colonel) "Bryce (colonel)") to the planet [Tython](/wiki/Tython "Tython"), where she freed 0-0-0 and BT-1 from their restraining bolts. With both droids cutting through many of Bryce's troops, Aphra led Vader to the [Martyrium of Frozen Tears](/wiki/Martyrium_of_Frozen_Tears "Martyrium of Frozen Tears"), where he was overpowered by his past regrets and severely damaged by a barrage from BT-1. Still keeping her distance and knowing she would be unable to kill the Dark Lord, Aphra instead hacked into Vader's suit from a distance and contacted the *Executor*, where she reached[[156]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_40-156) a [comms jockey](/wiki/Unidentified_comms_jockey "Unidentified comms jockey")[[152]](#cite_note-Epilogue-152) she tricked into altering and outright deleting much of the data collected by Project Swarm: while she knew Vader would soon find the rebel base, she fled Tython with the hope she had delayed his efforts for long enough that the rebels could set up defenses and[[156]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_40-156) escape plans, thereby keeping her loved ones safe. The Empire put out a warrant for Aphra,[[152]](#cite_note-Epilogue-152) who escaped Tython by stealing a [TIE/rp Reaper attack landers](/wiki/TIE/rp_Reaper_attack_lander "TIE/rp Reaper attack lander")[[156]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_40-156) and dropped 0-0-0 and BT-1 off on the planet [Birukay](/wiki/Birukay "Birukay"), where they could stay off the Empire's radar, although both grew bored from a lack of people to kill.[[157]](#cite_note-Aphra_(2020)_25-157)

Aphra's actions heavily set back the Empire's hunt for the rebellion by,[[152]](#cite_note-Epilogue-152) according to Aphra's[[156]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_40-156) and the Empire's own estimates, several weeks[[152]](#cite_note-Epilogue-152) as it would need to untangle the mess of false positives, deleted information, and altered records she left behind.[[156]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_40-156) The Empire tried to bury news of Aphra's interference, but the comms jockey would end up telling an Imperial officer named [Thassilio Smeuse](/wiki/Thassilio_Smeuse "Thassilio Smeuse"), who was, in secret, a deep-cover agent for the Rebel Alliance. One day, Smeuse and the stormtroopers under his command captured a U-wing and a group of seemingly low-ranking rebels, who were actually baiting the Imperials into an ambush; after Smeuse completed the code-phrase one rebel remarked, Tolvan and [Strike Team Misericorde](/wiki/Strike_Team_Misericorde "Strike Team Misericorde") ambushed the Imperials and extracted Smeuse. Escaping from three TIE fighters aboard the U-wing, Tolvan and company returned to Echo Base, where Smeuse was debriefed and revealed what Aphra had done.[[152]](#cite_note-Epilogue-152)

##### Battle of Hoth[]

:   "*Yes, Lord Vader. I've reached the main power generator. The shield will be down in moments. You may start your landing.*"
:   ―Maximilian Veers, to Darth Vader[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41)

 [![The Empire launches an attack on the Rebellion on Hoth.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/21/Acme-AssaultonHoth.png/revision/latest?cb=20240414230922) [![The Empire launches an attack on the Rebellion on Hoth.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/21/Acme-AssaultonHoth.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20240414230922)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/21/Acme-AssaultonHoth.png/revision/latest?cb=20240414230922) 

The Empire launches an attack on the Rebellion on Hoth.

 

Eventually, the Empire's search came to fruition when [one](/wiki/XJ9-CS14 "XJ9-CS14") of its probe droids located the Alliance's new base on the ice planet Hoth. The [massive Imperial fleet](/wiki/Death_Squadron "Death Squadron"), led by the [command ship](/wiki/Executor-class_Star_Dreadnought "Executor-class Star Dreadnought") *[Executor](/wiki/Executor "Executor")*, arrived in the system and deployed ground forces at the [Moorsh Moraine](/wiki/Moorsh_Moraine "Moorsh Moraine"), a glacial feature on the planet in preparation for a major assault on the Alliance forces at [Echo Base](/wiki/Echo_Base "Echo Base"). Overwhelmed, the rebels were forced to flee, and the Empire claimed a decisive victory.[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41)

The Imperial pursuit of the rebels, however, did not stop at Hoth. The Imperial fleet continued to chase down the fleeing rebels, pursuing Leia Organa and Han Solo into the [Hoth asteroid belt](/wiki/Hoth_asteroid_field "Hoth asteroid field"). Though Solo's ship, the *[Millennium Falcon](/wiki/Millennium_Falcon "Millennium Falcon")*, eluded Imperial pursuit, Vader engaged the services of bounty hunters to track down the fleeing Alliance leadership.[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41)

#### Trap on Cloud City[]

:   "*If you only knew the power of the dark side. Obi-Wan never told you what happened to your father.*"  
    "*He told me enough! He told me* you *killed him!*"  
    "*No.* I *am your father.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41)

One of these bounty hunters, [Boba Fett](/wiki/Boba_Fett "Boba Fett"), tracked Organa and Solo to [Cloud City](/wiki/Cloud_City "Cloud City") on [Bespin](/wiki/Bespin "Bespin"), enabling Imperial forces to capture them and lay a trap for Luke Skywalker. The trap was eventually sprung, and Skywalker learned of his true relation to Vader, but the Imperial forces escorting Organa and her allies found themselves betrayed and overwhelmed by Cloud City's local authorities. The rebel leaders [escaped](/wiki/Escape_from_Cloud_City "Escape from Cloud City") Imperial custody again, but not without cost. Skywalker was maimed in a duel with Vader, while Solo was frozen in [carbonite](/wiki/Carbonite "Carbonite") and handed over to the bounty hunter. Battered and bruised, the Alliance was once again in flight from pursuing Imperial forces.[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41) The Empire took full control of Cloud City[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158) and Bespin as a whole,[[159]](#cite_note-Bounty_Hunters_3-159) securing a major source of [tibanna](/wiki/Tibanna "Tibanna") gas in the process[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158) and further shaking the galaxy's balance of power in its favor.[[159]](#cite_note-Bounty_Hunters_3-159)

Around the same time as the takeover of Cloud City, the Empire focused on the ice moon [Madurs](/wiki/Madurs "Madurs") to secure access to its [carnium](/wiki/Carnium "Carnium") supply. Initially assuming and told the Empire was interested in the moon's art, much to his confusion, [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister "Prime Minister") [Dreand Yens](/wiki/Dreand_Yens "Dreand Yens") was told by Imperial ambassador and [Senior Commander](/wiki/Senior_Commander "Senior Commander") [Alecia Beck](/wiki/Alecia_Beck "Alecia Beck") to prepare for an art expo as a distraction: as the Empire laid the groundwork for its mining operation, Yens and his people were building up a small city of ice guesthouses at Beck's urging. All the while, an Imperial space station in orbit scouted out where on Madurs would be the best spot to mine, Finally, the Empire made its intentions clear in the next phase of negotiations and offered far less than what the carnium was worth. After Yens's rejection, the space station landed on the moon—destroying what became known as the "old city" in the process—to begin extracting the resource by force. An underground resistance network struck against the operation but failed to stop the mining, which began to pollute and threaten the very structure of the moon the further it went on. Despite his hate of the Empire's operations, Yens remained as Prime Minister but was effectively a puppet of Beck. With the way it protruded up from the frozen ground, the station became known as the black tower.[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158)

Following the disastrous Battle of Hoth, the Alliance Fleet was scattered across the galaxy, and the absence of clear orders and the condition of Alliance High Command put the movement into its most critical stage in the war effort. With Imperial forces required to maintain the Mid Rim border and combat active war zones, vast numbers of Imperial forces from the [Core Worlds](/wiki/Core_Worlds "Core Worlds") were deployed to finally quash the Rebellion in the Outer Rim. This redeployment, however, left the Core's defenses enervated if only by a slight margin. Knowing the Empire's reliance on the Imperial shipyards at [Kuat](/wiki/Kuat "Kuat") and their vital importance in planetary containment and fast infantry deployment, the Rebel Sixty-First Mobile Infantry launched [Operation Ringbreaker](/wiki/Operation_Ringbreaker "Operation Ringbreaker"), an initiative designed to destroy the Empire's orbital facilities at Kuat. Ultimately, the plan faltered and ended on [Sullust](/wiki/Sullust "Sullust") owing to logistical concerns.[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49)

#### Preparation for the end[]

:   "*Through sheer stupid luck, the rebels managed to destroy the first Death Star. By rebuilding the Death Star, and using it* as many times as necessary *to restore order, we prove that their luck only goes so far. We prove that we are the only galactic authority and always will be.*"
:   ―[Nash Windrider](/wiki/Nash_Windrider "Nash Windrider")[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87)

In the wake of the Rebellion's catastrophic loss at Hoth, the Rebel Fleet split into small fragments across the galaxy in an attempt to avoid another propaganda victory for the Empire, further extending the Imperial fleet in an effort to engage them. Despite its previous advantages following the Battle of Yavin, the Rebellion was sitting on a knife's edge after learning of Darth Sidious constructing another battle station. Following the loss of the first Death Star, the Emperor made clear his determination to create another planet-shattering space station, this time more powerful than the first.[[160]](#cite_note-Moving_Target-160) The [Schism Imperial](/wiki/Schism_Imperial "Schism Imperial") erupted in the wake of the [scourge of the droids](/wiki/Scourge_crisis "Scourge crisis").[[161]](#cite_note-Vader_42_Solicit-161)

Utilizing S-thread boosters to carve a [secret hyperspace lane](/wiki/Sanctuary_Pipeline "Sanctuary Pipeline") through the Outer Rim, the Emperor planned to destroy the rebels in a doomed engagement over the forest moon of [Endor](/wiki/Endor "Endor"), construction site of the Death Star II, which, unbeknownst to the rebels, had a fully operational [superlaser](/wiki/Superlaser "Superlaser"). Following the presumed destruction of a sizable portion of the Alliance's military capabilities, the Emperor planned to deploy some of the largest invasion fleets seen in centuries to blockade the known rebel strongholds of [Mon Cala](/wiki/Mon_Cala "Mon Cala") and [Chandrila](/wiki/Chandrila "Chandrila") until the Death Star could destroy them, eliminating any hope of a successful galactic resistance and thus permanently ending the Alliance to Restore the Republic through terror and intimidation.[[160]](#cite_note-Moving_Target-160)

#### Leaking secrets[]

With the Alliance Fleet assembling over Sullust, the Emperor decided to proactively approach the Rebel problem. Rather than guard the station's secrets, as with the first Death Star, Sidious leaked just enough information to bait the Alliance into striking at the station before it was completed—including the fact that he would be overseeing the final stages of the station's construction personally.[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135) After the [Bothan Spynet](/wiki/Bothan_Spynet "Bothan Spynet") transmitted intelligence regarding the Empire's new and improved Death Star to Alliance High Command, an emergency summit was held on the remote trade world of [Zastiga](/wiki/Zastiga "Zastiga"), far from the Galactic Core.[[160]](#cite_note-Moving_Target-160)

There, Rebellion leaders and generals were informed of the construction of the second Death Star located over Endor which, they knew, had to be destroyed before it became operational. Needing to buy time for the scattered fleet to assemble over Sullust, Princess Leia Organa devised a strategy—[Operation Yellow Moon](/wiki/Operation_Yellow_Moon "Operation Yellow Moon")—to divert Imperial attention to her instead of the upcoming mission to Endor. Ultimately, with the success of Yellow Moon, the Rebel Alliance gained valuable time for its now-consolidated fleet to finally be able to strike at an incomplete Death Star.[[160]](#cite_note-Moving_Target-160)

Unknown to the Rebels, large portions of the Imperial Starfleet had already massed in the [Hudalla system](/wiki/Hudalla_system "Hudalla system"), while Imperial engineers had ensured that the new Death Star's main weapon was fully operational. Eventually, Imperial Military command had discreetly moved the gathered warships to a staging point on the far side of Endor's moon, where the Death Star was orbiting. Simultaneously, a legion of Imperial troops was deployed on the surface to stop any attempt at sabotaging the station's ground-based [SLD-26 planetary shield generator](/wiki/SLD-26_planetary_shield_generator "SLD-26 planetary shield generator"), which neutralized any attempt at directly assaulting the station.[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135)

#### Battle of Endor[]

 [![The Alliance strike team is captured by the Emperor's troops.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/EndorStrikeTeamCapture.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20091202144322) [![The Alliance strike team is captured by the Emperor's troops.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/EndorStrikeTeamCapture.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/230?cb=20091202144322)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/EndorStrikeTeamCapture.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20091202144322) 

The Alliance strike team is captured by the Emperor's troops.

 

Imperial intelligence reports indicated that Sidious' trap was indeed well underway when it was discovered that the Rebel fleet was massing at Sullust, as a staging ground for their strike at Endor.
