Per the Emperor's design and command, Imperial Military authorities were ordered to ignore the buildup so that the Rebels would commit their entire force to a doomed attack. When the Alliance fleet arrived en masse, the Emperor's trap was sprung. The Rebel ground forces had taken the bait and been captured, allowing the Death Star's shield to remain active, while the Imperial fleet moved into position to trap the Rebels. With the Alliance Fleet trapped between the bulk of the Imperial fleet and a shielded, fully operational Death Star, victory for the Empire seemed assured.[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135)

On the surface of Endor, the tables were turned on the Imperial forces when they were unexpectedly attacked by the planet's indigenous [Ewok](/wiki/Ewok "Ewok") population, who had allied themselves with the Rebels, giving the Alliance ground forces a free hand to destroy the Death Star's shield generator. With the shield down, Alliance starfighters were able to launch an assault on the Imperial station's reactor core.[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135)

 [![The Rebel fleet and the Imperial fleet engage each other.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/BattleofEndor.png/revision/latest?cb=20201009183855) [![The Rebel fleet and the Imperial fleet engage each other.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/BattleofEndor.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/270?cb=20201009183855)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/BattleofEndor.png/revision/latest?cb=20201009183855) 

The Rebel fleet and the Imperial fleet engage each other.

 

Meanwhile, aboard the station, a blow of an entirely different kind was struck against the Empire. The Emperor tried to replace Vader with a captive Luke Skywalker, the latter now being a Jedi, but Luke convinced Darth Vader to turn on his master. Vader—once again Anakin Skywalker—seized the Imperial head of state and hurled him down a shaft to his assumed death. Soon after, the Rebel starfighters destroyed the Death Star's reactor core. The station was destroyed—like its predecessor, lost with all hands. Due to the injuries he sustained in the process of overthrowing the Emperor, the redeemed Anakin died shortly after, but not before making peace with Luke.[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135) With the apparent loss of both the Emperor and his right-hand man, Vader, the destruction of the Death Star, and significant losses inflicted on the Imperial fleet, the Imperial remnants withdrew to the [Annaj system](/wiki/Annaj_system "Annaj system").[[162]](#cite_note-LOP-162) The Empire had suffered a decisive defeat.[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135)

### Fragmentation of the Order[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Imperial Remnants](/wiki/Imperial_Remnants "Imperial Remnants")

#### Shattered Empire[]

:   "*In one battle, we lost our Emperor and gained a hundred warring factions.*"
:   ―Rella Sol[[30]](#cite_note-Squadrons-30)

 [![The Rebel assault against the Imperial outpost on Endor, the day after the Death Star II's destruction.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/69/ImperialOutpostAssaultBegins-ShatteredEmpire1.png/revision/latest?cb=20160206042846) [![The Rebel assault against the Imperial outpost on Endor, the day after the Death Star II's destruction.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/69/ImperialOutpostAssaultBegins-ShatteredEmpire1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160206042846)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/69/ImperialOutpostAssaultBegins-ShatteredEmpire1.png/revision/latest?cb=20160206042846) 

The Rebel assault against the Imperial outpost on Endor, the day after the Death Star II's destruction.

 

With the destruction of the Death Star and death of the Order's totalitarian ruler, many worlds across the galaxy began to celebrate the Empire's defeat over Endor with the incorrect notion that the war was over[[163]](#cite_note-Shattered_Empire_1-163) and [rise up](/wiki/Uprisings_against_the_Galactic_Empire "Uprisings against the Galactic Empire") against the regime.[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135) Despite being at the heart of the Empire, the Imperial Center would also see tumultuous festivities by its populace, eventually leading to a [riot](/wiki/Riot_in_Monument_Plaza "Riot in Monument Plaza") breaking out in [Monument Plaza](/wiki/Monument_Plaza "Monument Plaza"), which further coalesced into a full-scale [civil war](/wiki/Coruscant_civil_war "Coruscant civil war").[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) A [rally](/wiki/Rally_on_Naboo "Rally on Naboo") was held on Naboo[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135) while [parades](/wiki/Parades_on_Tatooine "Parades on Tatooine")[[164]](#cite_note-RotJ_Junior-164) and other celebrations were held on Tatooine, which saw its Imperial occupiers withdraw.[[165]](#cite_note-Chapter_9-165) The recent death of Jabba the Hutt,[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16) combined with the Imperial withdraw, did create a power vacuum on Tatooine that groups like the [Mining Collective](/wiki/Mining_Collective "Mining Collective") could take advantage of, however.[[165]](#cite_note-Chapter_9-165)

Meanwhile, the Empire rushed to reassert its power. One particular tactic the Empire would focus on was trying to keep control over resources. To that end, the Empire continued its secret mining project on Madurs. The Rebel Alliance also suspected Imperial holdouts would dig into the Outer Rim, thereby drawing out the war. Beyond fearing covert attacks on Alliance-allied star systems, with the number of pro-Alliance worlds growing in the wake of Palpatine's death, and the battles that were to be waged in the Outer Rim, the Alliance feared the Empire would act in the shadows to destabilize the bedrock upon which the New Republic would be formed: assassinations, starvation, and control over resources like fuel, such as Tibanna gas, and food were all tactics the Alliance suspected would be used by the Empire in the coming weeks.[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158)

 [![The Galactic Empire that once stood united under Palpatine fractured and divided without a clear leader as various candidates squabbled and fought for the throne.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/94/DestroyedImperialCog.png/revision/latest?cb=20240405221026) [![The Galactic Empire that once stood united under Palpatine fractured and divided without a clear leader as various candidates squabbled and fought for the throne.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/94/DestroyedImperialCog.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20240405221026)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/94/DestroyedImperialCog.png/revision/latest?cb=20240405221026) 

The Galactic Empire that once stood united under Palpatine fractured and divided without a clear leader as various candidates squabbled and fought for the throne.

 

Owing to the lack of a clear system of succession following the Emperor's death, chaos gripped the galaxy as former Imperial expansionism stalled. Members of the [Imperial Council](/wiki/Imperial_Ruling_Council "Imperial Ruling Council") and various other military warlords attempted to grab what territories they could, while tailored propaganda messages often contradicted one another. Some refused to legitimize the New Republic, and thus banned referring to it by name. Others portrayed it as a monstrous terrorist organization, swallowing up Imperial worlds for plunder and conquest, while still others refused to even acknowledge the Emperor's death for months.[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5)[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) The Empire was ripped apart from within as several of its commanders fought one another for power, leadership, and control, rendering the regime a collection of squabbling factions: with the Empire weak, it was no match against the united forces of the New Republic. The chaos that ensued in the Empire made people wonder if the decisions made by the Emperor over the years were the best for the Galactic Empire. Imperial pilot [Rella Sol](/wiki/Rella_Sol "Rella Sol"), for example, the child of former Imperial Senators, believed that if the [Imperial Senate](/wiki/Imperial_Senate "Imperial Senate") had not been dissolved, order would have been maintained after Endor.[[30]](#cite_note-Squadrons-30)

An Imperial loyalist,[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158) Governor Adelhard, who was in charge of the Anoat sector, attempted to downplay the Empire's defeat over Endor and cover up the Emperor's death[[166]](#cite_note-IGN_Characters-166) in the days after the Battle of Endor.[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158) Shutting down all travel and communications into and out of the Anoat sector, Adelhard established the [Iron Blockade](/wiki/Iron_Blockade "Iron Blockade") and formed his own [remnant faction](/wiki/Ubrik_Adelhard%27s_Imperial_remnant "Ubrik Adelhard's Imperial remnant"). Citizens who dared to fight back and speak of so-called rumors of the Empire's defeat were hunted and eliminated by Commander [Bragh](/wiki/Bragh "Bragh") and his [Purge Troopers](/wiki/Purge_Trooper "Purge Trooper").[[166]](#cite_note-IGN_Characters-166) By keeping control over the Anoat sector, the Empire also kept control over a massive supplier of the galaxy's Tibanna gas, thereby keeping a great deal of control over fuel.[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158) While some such as Grand Moff [Lozen Tolruck](/wiki/Lozen_Tolruck "Lozen Tolruck") of [Imperial territory G5-623](/wiki/Imperial_territory_G5-623 "Imperial territory G5-623") on Kashyyyk suggested that the Emperor had escaped the Death Star II through miraculous means, others claimed the even wilder notion that the Emperor was still leading the Empire from beyond the grave.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) While Solo thought such a lie was easy to disprove, such a tactic was possible because Palpatine had always ruled from the shadows, away from the public eye.[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158)

During Solo and Organa's honeymoon, they discovered the Empire's carnium mining operation on Madurs and fought against it with the help of the local resistance. The battle ended with the destruction of the "black tower" and the capture of Beck, who fled with other high-ranking officers on Madurs as the resistance launched its final attack. The out-of-character move from Beck led Organa to suspect the New Republic had a new enemy at play, either a figure using the rumors of Palpatine's survival to their advantage or an heir to the Empire with Palpatine's level of power. Fortunately for Madurs, the New Republic embarked on an effort to restore the world after the damage caused by the Empire's mining.[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158)

#### Operation: Cinder[]

:   "*Operation: Cinder is to begin at once. Resistance. Rebellion. Defiance. These are concepts that cannot be allowed to persist. You are but one of many tools by which these ideas shall be burned away.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious' posthumous orders[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167)

 [![The Alliance assaults Imperial positions on Sterdic IV.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/BattleOfCawaCity-ShatteredEmpire2.png/revision/latest?cb=20160206045809) [![The Alliance assaults Imperial positions on Sterdic IV.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/BattleOfCawaCity-ShatteredEmpire2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160206045809)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/BattleOfCawaCity-ShatteredEmpire2.png/revision/latest?cb=20160206045809) 

The Alliance assaults Imperial positions on Sterdic IV.

 

With the Empire fragmented, the Rebel Alliance embarked on numerous campaigns such as the [Beltire Liberation](/wiki/Beltire_Liberation "Beltire Liberation") and the [Battle of Cawa City](/wiki/Battle_of_Cawa_City "Battle of Cawa City")[[168]](#cite_note-SE2-168) to capitalize on its stunning success over Endor, resulting in numerous Imperial defeats. Twenty days after Endor, the posthumous contingency plan of the late Emperor known as [Operation: Cinder](/wiki/Operation:_Cinder "Operation: Cinder") was delivered to numerous Imperial captains by [messenger droids](/wiki/Sentinel_(Contingency) "Sentinel (Contingency)")[[169]](#cite_note-SE3-169) as the first act in Palpatine's [Contingency](/wiki/Contingency "Contingency").[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) The operation consisted of coordinated attacks on strategic worlds affiliated with the Rebellion, which the Emperor considered a final act of revenge against his enemies,[[171]](#cite_note-SotS-171) and worlds that had been loyal to him,[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167) as revenge for the Empire's failure to protect him.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) In addition to his homeworld of Naboo, [Burnin Konn](/wiki/Burnin_Konn "Burnin Konn"), [Candovant](/wiki/Candovant "Candovant"), [Abednedo](/wiki/Abednedo_(planet) "Abednedo (planet)"), and [Commenor](/wiki/Commenor "Commenor") were all targeted for destruction through the use of [climate disruption arrays](/wiki/Climate_disruption_array "Climate disruption array"). Utilizing [N-1 starfighters](/wiki/N-1_starfighter "N-1 starfighter") dating thirty-six years earlier to the Battle of Naboo, the Alliance destroyed the satellites with the aid of an [MC80 Star Cruiser](/wiki/MC80_Star_Cruiser "MC80 Star Cruiser") and the Alliance Fleet.[[169]](#cite_note-SE3-169) Despite the Order's defeat over Naboo, the Empire still attempted the operation on numerous worlds in the three months following the Battle of Endor.[[172]](#cite_note-SE4-172)

After the Battle of Endor, illicit holovids of the Emperor's defeat over Endor and rebel propaganda detailing the liberation of worlds such as Naboo disseminated throughout the galaxy, with many risking arrest and execution for spreading what the Empire deemed lies. However, the increasing view that the Empire was weakened, reinforced by the insistence of authorities claiming otherwise, prompted thousands of planets to join the Alliance, while Imperial Military defections steadily increased. In order to counter the reports of the Emperor's demise, a proxy actor was installed in his place, but some citizens noticed slight differences in the facsimile. Eventually, the truth of the Emperor's demise became known to the general citizenry. Declarations of a new Emperor were announced almost every day, but none were able to consolidate any substantial power. Former aide to Darth Sidious since the Clone Wars, Grand Vizier Mas Amedda attempted to keep the Empire together while splinter fleets and other Imperial officials fought each other to support the various claimants to the throne.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87)

#### Birth of the New Republic[]

:   "*This is Grand Admiral Rae Sloane, commander of the Imperial Navy and de facto leader of the Galactic Empire. The Empire remains vigilant in combating the anarchist criminal government calling itself the New Republic. The dream of a safe, sane, and unified galaxy did not die with the glorious Emperor Palpatine. The Galactic Empire continues to march forward, tirelessly diligent in its quest to return order and stability where none before existed. Meanwhile, the New Republic continues its own mission to destroy what we have built together. Crime has returned to the galaxy tenfold as the underworld dynasties have regained dominance over worlds once kept free of their toxic influences by the Empire. Supply lines have been cut, and many worlds are now starving without adequate food. The corrosive influence of the New Republic has caused a seemingly insurmountable loss of jobs, income, and even lives. But fear not. The Empire remains, as sure as a mountain, as certain as the stars across all the systems. We will defeat the insurgency. We will make this false government pay for its crimes against you. Even now we are building new ships, new bases, and founding new technologies to keep you safe. The Empire is coming. We will deliver you from harm. And we will strike back against our enemies. Remain calm. remain loyal. With true hearts, victory for us—and for the whole galaxy—will soon be at hand.*"
:   ―Rae Sloane[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

 [![The continuing fall of the Empire allowed the Rebel Alliance to reorganize into a true government, the New Republic.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f6/A_New_Dawn-SWP.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170110083833) [![The continuing fall of the Empire allowed the Rebel Alliance to reorganize into a true government, the New Republic.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f6/A_New_Dawn-SWP.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170110083833)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f6/A_New_Dawn-SWP.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170110083833) 

The continuing fall of the Empire allowed the Rebel Alliance to reorganize into a true government, the New Republic.

 

Eventually, the Galactic Empire had to contend with the [New Republic](/wiki/New_Republic "New Republic"), a rival galactic government formed in the wake of the Rebel Alliance's victory at Endor. Suffering a string of defeats against the Republic including the loss of [Sevarcos](/wiki/Sevarcos "Sevarcos") and [Malastare](/wiki/Malastare "Malastare"), along with a failed attempt to restart the former Separatist droid foundries on Geonosis, the Empire gradually began to crumble. Self-appointed Grand Moff [Valco Pandion](/wiki/Valco_Pandion "Valco Pandion") and other military leaders began to jockey for power, while corrupt sector governors accepted payments for the Republic's allocation of Imperial ships or sued for peace at the earliest convenience.[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16) The captains of two of the Empire's thirteen *Executor*-class Star Dreadnoughts even surrendered to the New Republic.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

With most of the Empire's veteran troops killed on the second Death Star or Vader's command ship *Executor*, military paucity and tactical clumsiness soon hampered the Empire's efforts at a concerted strike against the Republic. The Imperial Military suffered numerous losses of warships and troops, and expended more ordnance than it could produce fighting Republic forces. This ultimately led to a supply deficit forcing *Imperial*-class Star Destroyers to make do with an inadequate supply of TIE/LN starfighters and resulted in both the Imperial Navy and Imperial Army utilizing undertrained personnel pulled early from the numerous Imperial academies. Consequently, many planets were either captured by or seceded to the New Republic. The Empire retreated to fallback positions on worlds such as [Naalol](/wiki/Naalol "Naalol"), forestalling its slow push toward the Core Worlds. Despite these efforts, the Republic had already established its capital on Chandrila, a planet located within the Core.[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16)

#### Conference on Akiva[]

:   "*…This meeting is to decide the fate of the Empire with the input of several advisers, not just one. If I wanted to take the* Ravager *and seize control, I could make that attempt and I might even manage it. But I'd rather not make the same mistakes as in the past.*"
:   ―Rae Sloane, to [Valco Pandion](/wiki/Valco_Pandion "Valco Pandion")[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16)

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Akiva Summit](/wiki/Akiva_Summit "Akiva Summit")

Despite the lack of a clear chain of command, old loyalists and a common fear of the rising Rebellion kept a vague semblance of unity between the surviving Imperial forces. Existing on a knife's edge, many officers wondered when someone of prominence would break away from commonality and begin to overtly act against the greater body, ushering in chaos and anarchy. To avoid this, the surviving Imperial leaders and their military forces converged on the Outer Rim planet of [Akiva](/wiki/Akiva "Akiva") in an attempt to evade New Republic detection and stabilize the remaining factions of the Empire in the months following Endor, with various portions of the Outer Rim still occupied by Imperial forces. During the Akiva summit, various Imperial delegates discussed the future of the Empire in the aptly named [Imperial Future Council](/wiki/Imperial_Future_Council "Imperial Future Council").[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16)

Amid the conference, the various Imperial leaders were divided over how the Empire should deal with their newfound situation, and whether or not it would be wise to continue the war or enter into a state of cold war. Additionally, the continued funding of the Imperial Military was hotly disputed, with some arguing that plundering the InterGalactic Banking Clan and other monetary bodies would plunge the galaxy into an economic depression. The notion of abandoning the Empire's dark-side devotion was even discussed, while [Imperial Advisor](/wiki/Emperor%27s_adviser "Emperor's adviser") [Yupe Tashu](/wiki/Yupe_Tashu "Yupe Tashu")—a longtime admirer of Darth Sidious and dark-side cultist—suggested sending the Imperial remnants to the outskirts of the galaxy to search for the source of the dark side. With the more pressing objective to organize and thus strike out against the New Republic before it could grow any stronger, the delegates soon began discussing who should lead the Empire as the new Galactic Emperor.[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16)

#### Rebellion on Akiva[]

:   "*This is how it must be. The Empire became this…ugly, inelegant machine. Crude and inefficient. We needed to be broken into pieces. We needed to get rid of those who want to see that old machine churning ineluctably forward. It's time for something better. Something new. An Empire worthy of the galaxy it will rule.*"
:   ―Gallius Rax[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16)

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Rebellion on Akiva](/wiki/Rebellion_on_Akiva "Rebellion on Akiva")

Before any real progress could be made, Akiva was ultimately [liberated](/wiki/Rebellion_on_Akiva "Rebellion on Akiva") after a New Republic fleet arrived, forcing the Imperials to scatter once more and resulting in Akiva being the first Outer Rim planet to formally join the New Republic. In reality, Imperial [Fleet Admiral](/wiki/Fleet_Admiral "Fleet Admiral") [Gallius Rax](/wiki/Gallius_Rax "Gallius Rax"), a warlord who controlled one of the larger fragments of the fallen Empire.[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16)

The man who became Gallius Rax was an orphan boy called "Galli" who had stowed aboard Palpatine's luxury yacht *[Imperialis](/wiki/Imperialis "Imperialis")* roughly three decades before the end of the Galactic Civil War.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) Seeing potential in the boy, Palpatine tasked him with guarding an excavation site in the [Valley of the Eremite](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Eremite "Valley of the Eremite") which became the [Jakku Observatory](/wiki/Jakku_Observatory "Jakku Observatory"). After ten years of service, Palpatine inducted Rax into the Empire,[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) using his power and influence to aid Rax's career advancement in the Imperial Navy.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) By [5 ABY](/wiki/5_ABY "5 ABY"),[[8]](#cite_note-Life_Debt_date-8) Rax had attained the rank of Fleet Admiral.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

With the loss of Akiva and the Galactic Empire's territorial possessions rapidly shrinking, Rax became an official advisor to Grand Admiral [Rae Sloane](/wiki/Rae_Sloane "Rae Sloane"). While Sloane was the public leader of the Empire in the [Vulpinus Nebula](/wiki/Vulpinus_Nebula "Vulpinus Nebula"), its true ruler was Rax who controlled the fleet through Sloane. Additionally, Rax secretly commanded the Imperial remnants in the [Almagest](/wiki/Almagest "Almagest"), the [Recluse's Nebula](/wiki/Recluse%27s_Nebula "Recluse's Nebula"), the [Queluhan Nebula](/wiki/Queluhan_Nebula "Queluhan Nebula"), the [Ro-Loo Triangle](/wiki/Ro-Loo_Triangle "Ro-Loo Triangle"), and the [Inamorata](/wiki/Inamorata "Inamorata").[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) As part of the Contingency, Rax eliminated his Imperial rivals by leaking intelligence to the New Republic while posing as "the Operator." With Sloane's help, Rax had engineered the downfall of the [Imperial Future Council](/wiki/Imperial_Future_Council "Imperial Future Council")'s [emergency summit on Akiva](/wiki/Akiva_Summit "Akiva Summit").[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16)

Roughly two months after Akiva fell to the New Republic, numerous systems left the Empire or waged their own resistance movements, declared their independence, and established their own fiefdoms or joined the New Republic.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) In that time, Sullust had also been [liberated](/wiki/Liberation_of_Sullust "Liberation of Sullust") from Imperial control. In that same time period,[[6]](#cite_note-Timelines-6) Imperial forces launched three [invasions](/wiki/Invasions_of_Naboo "Invasions of Naboo") of the planet Naboo, which holdout forces hoped to claim due to its significance as Palpatine's homeworld. However, all three attacks were repelled by the New Republic, which even received help from Imperial defectors.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) Meanwhile, criminal syndicates flourished in the current atmosphere of conflict, especially the reptilian [pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") [Eleodie Maracavanya](/wiki/Eleodie_Maracavanya "Eleodie Maracavanya"), who had captured the Super Star Destroyer [*Annihilator*](/wiki/Liberty%27s_Misrule "Liberty's Misrule") and used it to forge zher own criminal empire. Several Moffs and governors rebelled against the Empire as more people grew uncertain about what the Empire stood for. Agencies, personnel, and whole planetary systems started to drift apart, each adopting different tactics and methods for combating the New Republic, and each other.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

#### Desperate times[]

:   "*You*…*you're serious. You want me to surrender*…*the entire Galactic Empire?*"  
    "*That's right.*"  
    "*I don't*…"  
    "*You don't have the power, do you?*"  
    "*I*…"  
    "*So, get it back. And then bring a treaty to our door.*"
:   ―Mas Amedda and Leia Organa[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

Grand Vizier Mas Amedda was acting as Emperor after Palpatine's death but in reality was nothing more than a proxy Emperor who held little real influence beyond the throneworld of Coruscant with his reign being met with whole sectors of Coruscant started to revolt and was entrenched in government districts. Rax refused to allow Sloane to send reinforcements to Amedda as the throneworld had no place in his vision of a renewed Empire. Later he met with Chancellor Mon Mothma and Senator Leia Organa, who refused his surrender during a meeting on [Velusia](/wiki/Velusia "Velusia") and demanded he instead find a way to gain full control of the Galactic Empire and ordering him to work towards signing a treaty of surrender to clear his name.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

Upon his return to Coruscant, Amedda considered [suicide](/wiki/Death "Death") by jumping off of one of the Imperial Palace's balconies. However, he changed his mind after meeting Sloane. After Sloane inquired about the identity of Fleet Admiral Gallius Rax, Amedda decided to strike an alliance with her. In return for assisting her investigation into Rax's background, Amedda agreed to align with Sloane. Sloane believed in the New Order that developed after the Clone Wars as opposed to Rax, who wished for a renewed Empire ruled by the dark side as it was under Darth Sidious. Following their agreement, Amedda revealed the droids that contained the information she sought were aboard the wreckage of the *Imperialis* on the junk moon [Quantxi](/wiki/Quantxi "Quantxi").[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

As the war grew more desperate, TIE fighter pilots even began suicide attacks on entrenched Republic positions, and various commanders executed wholesale massacres of native populations. The HoloNet, now free of Imperial censorship, brought such atrocities to the public spotlight. Other Imperial officials went AWOL and holed up in distant, hyper-secure outposts to avoid the [New Republic Tribunal](/wiki/New_Republic_Tribunal "New Republic Tribunal") and its sentencing of Imperial war criminals. Additionally, the Emperor's Super Star Destroyer, the [*Eclipse*](/wiki/Eclipse_(Executor-class) "Eclipse (Executor-class)"), had disappeared from the galaxy.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

### Empire's End[]

#### Rax's game[]

:   "*…I'm forming a Shadow Council to govern the Empire from behind the scenes. Only the finest of our kind: the first and highest order of Imperial minds…*"
:   ―Gallius Rax[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

Despite the post-Endor Rebel Alliance's fears that the Empire would dig into the Outer Rim,[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158) the Empire was largely defeated in the region by the time Rax called for a meeting of select Imperials in the [Vulpinus Nebula](/wiki/Vulpinus_Nebula "Vulpinus Nebula"). The [Exterior](/wiki/Exterior "Exterior") under Grand Moff [Randd](/wiki/Randd "Randd") remained the only Outer Rim sector that could truly be described as under the Empire's control. However, while the Empire appeared to be receding as the New Republic grew in size, Rax consolidated more and more systems to his cause[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)—a faction of Imperials identified as the loyalists[[173]](#cite_note-Victory's_Price-173)—after staging the Imperial Future Council to eliminate his rivals. A protégé of the late Emperor, Rax saw the Empire of old as weak, corrupt, and overripe. To him, by allowing the New Republic to gain ground, he not only eliminated potential competition but consolidated the leftover pieces of the Order.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

With the shipyards of Kuat, [Xa Fel](/wiki/Xa_Fel "Xa Fel"), [Anadeen](/wiki/Anadeen "Anadeen"), and [Turco Prime](/wiki/Turco_Prime "Turco Prime") already lost or contested, Rax planned to use the Empire's last foothold in the Outer Rim as a "strangling cord" to tie around the New Republic. While the old Empire relied on third-party corporations to produce its military hardware, Rax had nationalized all aspects of the production chain to be solely Imperial. To conclude his plan, Rax founded the [Shadow Council](/wiki/Shadow_Council "Shadow Council") in the Vulpinus Nebula after rescuing the final member of the council, [Brendol Hux](/wiki/Brendol_Hux "Brendol Hux"), from [Arkanis](/wiki/Arkanis "Arkanis"). This "Shadow Council" was to serve as a secret advisory board composed of the "best and brightest," with the ultimate motive of secretly guiding the Empire into a new golden age.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

#### Crisis on Chandrila[]

:   "*Rax is the way forward. The Empire must be willing to change. We must be willing to do anything to show the galaxy what it is to defy us.*"
:   ―Adea Rite[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

Roughly three months after the Battle of Akiva, Rax sent Rae Sloane on a mission to the New Republic's capital with the overtures of signing a peace treaty who reassured her that her mission to Chandrila would cement her role as Emperor. The signing coincided with the New Republic's celebration of [Liberation Day](/wiki/Liberation_Day_(New_Republic) "Liberation Day (New Republic)"), a holiday celebrating the release of captives from the Imperial prison [Ashmead's Lock](/wiki/Ashmead%27s_Lock "Ashmead's Lock") on Kashyyyk, with many of the captives having been held in suspended animation since the days of the early Rebellion. In reality, the survivors were a part of an elaborate [assassination scheme](/wiki/Attack_on_Chandrila "Attack on Chandrila") by Rax, executed by his lackey, [Windom Traducier](/wiki/Windom_Traducier "Windom Traducier")—an undercover Imperial operative posing as a Senate Guard—by utilizing [inhibitor chips](/wiki/Behavioral_modification_biochip "Behavioral modification biochip") that had been installed within the survivors' brains. As the New Republic officials shepherded the liberated prisoners and their families onto a stage, Rax ordered Grand Moff [Randd](/wiki/Randd "Randd") to prepare the Imperial fleets to travel to a series of coordinates, which turned out to be the planet [Jakku](/wiki/Jakku "Jakku"). Rax also convened a meeting of the Shadow Council.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

The survivors attacked and fired on the crowd after the chips' activation by Traducier, with the survivors targeting Chancellor Mon Mothma and various members of the Republic military during a dedication speech to their rescue. Watching the carnage from the balcony, Sloane realized that this terror attack was the "attack" Rax had foreshadowed to her. Already disagreeing on Rax's methods for administering the Empire, Rae announced her intention to confront Rax aboard the *[Ravager](/wiki/Ravager "Ravager")* to her aide, [Adea Rite](/wiki/Adea_Rite "Adea Rite"), a secret supporter of Rax. As a result, Rite attempted to assassinate Sloane, but she escaped off-world. Traducier freed Tashu from the Republic and told him that he still served the late Emperor Sheev Palpatine even after Rax had given himself the title of Emperor. The attacks demoralized the New Republic but failed to turn the tide of the war against the Empire, which lost Kashyyyk following an [uprising](/wiki/Liberation_of_Kashyyyk "Liberation of Kashyyyk") led by Han Solo and Chewbacca.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

#### The Contingency[]

:   "*If the vast and powerful forces I had gathered could not perform their sworn duty and protect their own Emperor, they did not deserve to lay claim to this galaxy in my absence. For their failures, I would see them burn. And the galaxy along with them.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[171]](#cite_note-SotS-171)

Claiming that Sloane had been captured during the attack on Chandrila, Gallius Rax seized power as the self-styled [Counselor to the Empire](/wiki/Counselor_to_the_Empire "Counselor to the Empire"). When Borrum asked why they were traveling to the barren world of Jakku, Rax responded that he wanted to "test" the mettle of his new armada above the planet.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) In secret, Rax planned to eliminate the other Council members with the exception of Brendol Hux as part of the Emperor's posthumous [Contingency](/wiki/Contingency "Contingency").[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) Unbeknownst to the Empire, its destruction had been planned by the Emperor who did not believe that the Empire should continue after his demise. He also deemed the Empire's downfall as a necessary outcome for the creation of a new order that would rise in its place.[[171]](#cite_note-SotS-171) Determined to see his plans realized, Sidious entrusted Rax with the task of executing the Contingency and ensuring its success.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

Meanwhile, Sloane joined forces with the former rebel [Brentin Lore Wexley](/wiki/Brentin_Lore_Wexley "Brentin Lore Wexley") to hunt down and kill Rax. While Sloane had received information from the bounty hunter [Mercurial Swift](/wiki/Mercurial_Swift "Mercurial Swift") that he had discovered that Rax had come from Jakku, the two traveled to the desert planet. After landing, Brentin and Rae visited a bar owned by [Corwin Ballast](/wiki/Corwin_Ballast "Corwin Ballast") in an attempt to find information about Rax. Ballast yielded no information, but the pair soon got their answer when they witnessed Rax's Super Star Destroyer *Ravager* exiting hyperspace with his massive Imperial armada. The Emperor had returned home.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

#### Build-up to Jakku[]

##### Assorted formations and forces arrive[]

:   "*Soon, the remnants of my armada were united in one last battle above the planet Jakku, unaware that they were being sacrificed as penance for their negligence. With the Empire erased from existence, something new could rise in its place. And from beyond the grave, I would control its every move…*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[171]](#cite_note-SotS-171)

 [![The Imperial-class Star Destroyer Inflictor crashes onto the surface of Jakku.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/af/Battle_of_Jakku.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250622052515) [![The Imperial-class Star Destroyer Inflictor crashes onto the surface of Jakku.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/af/Battle_of_Jakku.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250622052515)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/af/Battle_of_Jakku.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250622052515) 

The *Imperial*-class Star Destroyer *Inflictor* crashes onto the surface of Jakku.

 

With the support of the Shadow Council, which included Grand Moff [Randd](/wiki/Randd "Randd"), General [Hodnar Borrum](/wiki/Hodnar_Borrum "Hodnar Borrum"), the [propagandist](/wiki/Propaganda "Propaganda") [Ferric Obdur](/wiki/Ferric_Obdur "Ferric Obdur"), and the former Commandant Brendol Hux, Counselor Gallius Rax led the Imperial[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) loyalist[[173]](#cite_note-Victory's_Price-173) forces to his homeworld of [Jakku](/wiki/Jakku "Jakku"). These forces consisted of a fleet of Imperial Star Destroyers as well as Rax's flagship, the *Ravager*, purportedly the last remaining Super Star Destroyer in the Imperial Navy.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) Admiral [Garrick Versio](/wiki/Garrick_Versio "Garrick Versio") also joined the Imperial loyalists on Jakku, adding his Star Destroyer, the *[Eviscerator](/wiki/Eviscerator "Eviscerator")*, to Rax's fleet.[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167) The fleet also possessed [Interdictor](/wiki/Interdictor "Interdictor") vessels, [Immobilizer 418 cruisers](/wiki/Immobilizer_418_cruiser "Immobilizer 418 cruiser"),[[174]](#cite_note-On_the_Front_Lines-174) *Lambda*-class shuttles,[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167) TIE line starfighters,[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) TIE bombers[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) and interceptors,[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167) [TIE strikers](/wiki/TIE/sk_x1_experimental_air_superiority_fighter "TIE/sk x1 experimental air superiority fighter"),[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) [Twenty-gun raiders](/wiki/Twenty-gun_raider "Twenty-gun raider"),[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) and a [TIE Defender](/wiki/TIE/d_%22Defender%22_Multi-Role_Starfighter "TIE/d \"Defender\" Multi-Role Starfighter").[[175]](#cite_note-Destiny_card-Jakku-175) Other loyalist units included the [204th Imperial Fighter Wing](/wiki/204th_Imperial_Fighter_Wing "204th Imperial Fighter Wing"), which was not actually based on Jakku to instead carry out a second Operation Cinder against rogue Imperials,[[173]](#cite_note-Victory's_Price-173) the [Hellhound attack force](/wiki/Hellhound_attack_force "Hellhound attack force"),[[174]](#cite_note-On_the_Front_Lines-174) and [Omega Flight Group](/wiki/Omega_Flight_Group "Omega Flight Group").[[176]](#cite_note-Battlefront-176) Though united in a final stand against the New Republic, the remnants of the Imperial forces were unaware that they were to be sacrificed as "penance for their negligence," as the Emperor believed that they had failed in their duty to protect him.[[171]](#cite_note-SotS-171)

The infantry comprised standard stormtroopers along with the requisite specialist troops such as [Demolition Troopers](/wiki/Rocket_stormtrooper "Rocket stormtrooper"), [Heavy Weapons Stormtroopers](/wiki/Heavy_Weapons_Stormtrooper "Heavy Weapons Stormtrooper"),[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167) Imperial officers,[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) [jumptroopers](/wiki/Jumptrooper "Jumptrooper"), [riot control stormtroopers](/wiki/Riot_control_stormtrooper "Riot control stormtrooper"), scout troopers,[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167) [Imperial shock troopers](/wiki/Imperial_shock_trooper "Imperial shock trooper"),[[176]](#cite_note-Battlefront-176) [sandtroopers](/wiki/Desert_stormtrooper "Desert stormtrooper"),[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) and at least one member of the Emperor's Royal Guard.[[177]](#cite_note-Bloodline-177) These ground forces were supported by several types of military vehicles including [All Terrain Armored Transports](/wiki/All_Terrain_Armored_Transport_(Galactic_Civil_War) "All Terrain Armored Transport (Galactic Civil War)"),[[174]](#cite_note-On_the_Front_Lines-174) All Terrain Scout Transports,[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) and a [K79-S80 Imperial Troop Transport](/wiki/K79-S80_Imperial_Troop_Transport "K79-S80 Imperial Troop Transport").[[178]](#cite_note-Blade_Squadron:_Jakku-178) Imperial forces, including the stormtrooper [TK-603](/wiki/Terex "Terex"), stationed at the [Rothana Imperial Shipyards](/wiki/Rothana_Imperial_Shipyards "Rothana Imperial Shipyards") abandoned the station to head to Jakku, leaving with every operational ship in the base. Any ship not ready for battle, including Tarkin's old flagship the *Carrion Spike*, was left behind under the guard of the auto-security and droids.[[179]](#cite_note-Poe_Dameron_9-179)

Rax established the [main Imperial base](/wiki/Main_Imperial_base "Main Imperial base") beyond the [Goazon Badlands](/wiki/Goazon_Badlands "Goazon Badlands") and the [Sinking Fields](/wiki/Sinking_Fields "Sinking Fields"); the base housed a stormtrooper garrison and a large number of walkers.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) Other known Imperial facilities included an [Imperial research base](/wiki/Imperial_research_base "Imperial research base"),[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167) the Jakku Observatory, and a remote [Kesium gas](/wiki/Kesium_gas "Kesium gas") rig. Unknown to the Shadow Council, the Jakku Observatory was central to the late Emperor Palpatine's Contingency plan to destroy the Empire in the event of his death. The Observatory contained computer-generated maps of the Unknown Regions and was built on top of a borehole that led to the planet's core. Rax planned to detonate the core in order to destroy Jakku along with much of the Empire and the [New Republic Defense Fleet](/wiki/New_Republic_Defense_Fleet "New Republic Defense Fleet"). Then he intended to lead a select group of Imperials whom he deemed worthy of joining him in the Unknown Regions to rebuild the Empire. Rax's forces included a contingent of [child soldiers](/wiki/Gallius_Rax%27s_child_soldiers "Gallius Rax's child soldiers") who were recruited from local orphans.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

##### Mental toll of Jakku[]

In public, Counselor Rax claimed that he had brought the Empire to Jakku in order to toughen and harden them for their final showdown against the New Republic. Rax instituted a brutal training regime which encouraged savagery and violence among the Empire's soldiers and officers. In training sessions, officers egged their men to maul each other. Dissenters like [RK-242](/wiki/RK-242 "RK-242") who questioned what the Empire was doing on Jakku were brutalized by their comrades for questioning Rax's agenda. The stormtroopers stationed on Jakku degenerated into armed thugs who developed an unkempt appearance due to the harsh, arid climate.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

 [![The Galactic Empire made its final stand against the New Republic on Jakku, the homeworld of Gallius Rax.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/51/Rebellion_Arrives_at_Jakku.png/revision/latest?cb=20171214072500) [![The Galactic Empire made its final stand against the New Republic on Jakku, the homeworld of Gallius Rax.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/51/Rebellion_Arrives_at_Jakku.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20171214072500)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/51/Rebellion_Arrives_at_Jakku.png/revision/latest?cb=20171214072500) 

The Galactic Empire made its final stand against the New Republic on Jakku, the homeworld of Gallius Rax.

 

For months, the Empire's loyalist forces waited for the New Republic to launch its attack. The prolonged state of alert began to take a toll on the Imperial forces based on Jakku. While General Borrum expressed concerned that the long wait was beginning to affect the sanity of his men, Grand Moff Randd supported Counselor Rax's harsh regime as a purification process. During that time, Rax also struck a deal with the [Hutt](/wiki/Hutt "Hutt") crime lady [Niima](/wiki/Niima "Niima"), who was the leader of a cult. In return for supplying weapons, Niima guarded the path to the Valley of the Eremite and kidnapped local orphans. These orphans were trained by Commandant Hux into Rax's personal guard of child soldiers, which he hoped would become the template of his new Empire in the Unknown Regions. Prior to the New Republic's arrival at Jakku, Rax gave command of the children to [Armitage Hux](/wiki/Armitage_Hux "Armitage Hux"), the Commandant's illegitimate son.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

#### Imperial civil war[]

:   "*We haven't received word on the status of Fedovoi End, but we can only assume Shadow Wing has come and gone. At last count, Fedovoi End housed half a million troops and their families. It was primarily a military outpost, it's true—but we haven't seen slaughter of this sort since Operation Cinder.*"  
    "*The Empire is eating its own.*"  
    "*Yes. The loyalists have gone to war with the breakaway factions—civilians caught in the cross fire be damned.*"
:   ―Hera Syndulla and [New Republic pilot](/wiki/New_Republic_pilot "New Republic pilot") [Chass na Chadic](/wiki/Chass_na_Chadic "Chass na Chadic")[[173]](#cite_note-Victory's_Price-173)

 [![Colonel Soran Keize, who pursued non-loyalist Imperials for treason](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Keize_Shadow_Fall.png/revision/latest?cb=20230916090702) [![Colonel Soran Keize, who pursued non-loyalist Imperials for treason](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Keize_Shadow_Fall.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230916090702)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Keize_Shadow_Fall.png/revision/latest?cb=20230916090702) 

Colonel Soran Keize, who pursued non-loyalist Imperials for treason

 

Meanwhile, New Republic forces launched mopping-up operations against Imperial holdouts on Kashyyyk and Cloud City.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) The mass withdrawal of loyalist fleets to Jakku also ceded a great deal of territory to the New Republic, which continued to do battle with the opportunists and warlords who stayed behind. As noted by Admiral Ackbar, while the campaign to root out such holdouts would take time, they were isolated without the core strength of the Empire's loyalists. Few of those holdouts posed any kind of major threat to the New Republic, which also moved to crush whatever transport and fleet-building abilities those holdouts had left. Elsewhere in the galaxy, amid the conflict with the New Republic, loyalist Imperial forces turned their guns against the rogue factions in a second Operation: Cinder, effectively creating a whole new war of its own in the opinion of General Syndulla. The loyalist 204th Imperial Fighter Wing carried out punishments operations, such as the [attack on Kortatka](/wiki/Attack_on_Kortatka "Attack on Kortatka") and [Attack on Dybbron III](/wiki/Attack_on_Dybbron_III "Attack on Dybbron III"), during the campaign.[[173]](#cite_note-Victory's_Price-173)

Following the [attack on the *Diamond Tor*](/wiki/Attack_on_the_Diamond_Tor "Attack on the Diamond Tor"), the loyalist 204th Imperial Fighter Wing was deployed against the [Yomo Council](/wiki/Yomo_Council "Yomo Council") of the planet [Fedovoi End](/wiki/Fedovoi_End "Fedovoi End"), where half a million rogue troops and their families resided. The "treasonous actions"—as they were called by the loyalist [Colonel](/wiki/Colonel "Colonel") [Soran Keize](/wiki/Soran_Keize "Soran Keize"), at least—of the Yomo Council included refusing to obey Sloane when she ordered they direct assets into the [D'Aelgoth sector](/wiki/D%27Aelgoth_sector "D'Aelgoth sector"), not recognizing Amedda's regency over Coruscant, and an alliance with the [Shiortuun Syndicate](/wiki/Shiortuun_Syndicate "Shiortuun Syndicate"). In response to such actions and after Keize granted those disloyal to the Yomo Council a chance to escape, the 204th Imperial Fighter Wing was [dispatched](/wiki/Destruction_of_Fedovoi_End "Destruction of Fedovoi End") to Fedovoi End, where TIE fighters bombarded the planetary ice caps until released gases poisoned the entire world, wiping out numerous civilians and soldiers alike. Imperials who took Keize's offer—such as Major [Njock](/wiki/Njock "Njock"), who claimed to have always opposed the Yomo Council's treason—would join the 204th or be dispatched to Jakku.[[173]](#cite_note-Victory's_Price-173)

#### The New Republic discovers Jakku[]

 [![The Imperial Military marshals on Jakku ahead of the final battle of the Galactic Civil War.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/Stormtroopersprepare-BattleOfJakkuLastStand3.png/revision/latest?cb=20251110230659) [![The Imperial Military marshals on Jakku ahead of the final battle of the Galactic Civil War.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/Stormtroopersprepare-BattleOfJakkuLastStand3.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20251110230659)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/Stormtroopersprepare-BattleOfJakkuLastStand3.png/revision/latest?cb=20251110230659) 

The Imperial Military marshals on Jakku ahead of the final battle of the Galactic Civil War.

 

[Norra Wexley](/wiki/Norra_Wexley "Norra Wexley") and [her team](/wiki/Norra_Wexley%27s_team "Norra Wexley's team") discovered the Imperial presence on Jakku[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) after the New Republic's countless probe droids had failed to.[[173]](#cite_note-Victory's_Price-173) Her son [Temmin Wexley](/wiki/Temmin_Wexley "Temmin Wexley") and the former Imperial [loyalty officer](/wiki/Loyalty_officer "Loyalty officer") [Sinjir Rath Velus](/wiki/Sinjir_Rath_Velus "Sinjir Rath Velus") reported Norra's findings to the New Republic government on Chandrila. In response, Admiral Ackbar dispatched the scouting ship *[Oculus](/wiki/Oculus "Oculus")* and several probe droids into the [Jakku system](/wiki/Jakku_system "Jakku system") to corroborate Temmin and Sinjir's information. The scouting party found that much of the Imperial fleet had indeed retreated to Jakku and were consolidating in a defensive arrangement. Despite some [political obstruction](/wiki/Mission_to_Nakadia "Mission to Nakadia") in the [Galactic Senate](/wiki/New_Republic_Senate "New Republic Senate"), [Chancellor](/wiki/Chancellor_(New_Republic) "Chancellor (New Republic)") Mon Mothma passed a resolution dispatching the New Republic Starfleet to Jakku.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

Rax captured his rival Sloane and the former rebel operative [Brentin Lore Wexley](/wiki/Brentin_Lore_Wexley "Brentin Lore Wexley"), who had teamed up with Sloane to stop Rax. After capturing them, Rax gave a test demonstration of his child soldiers. As a symbolic act of his plan to tear down the Empire and start a new regime, Rax ordered his child soldiers to execute a contingent of stormtroopers. Following the demonstration, Rax imprisoned Sloane and Brentin. With the New Republic fleet entering the Jakku, Rax delivered a [rousing speech](/wiki/Gallius_Rax%27s_speech "Gallius Rax's speech") claiming that the coming battle would be the Empire's final stand against the New Republic.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

#### Battle of Jakku[]

##### Zero Hour[]

:   "*This is our zero hour, and I call you now to do your duty by the light of the glorious Galactic Empire. The battle to come is not a fight for Jakku or even a fight for the Empire. It is a fight for all the galaxy.*"
:   ―Gallius Rax[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

 [![The battle of Jakku was intended to destroy both Imperial Forces and New Republic forces alike](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/db/Battle_of_Jakku_OFL.png/revision/latest?cb=20181228070022) [![The battle of Jakku was intended to destroy both Imperial Forces and New Republic forces alike](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/db/Battle_of_Jakku_OFL.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20181228070022)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/db/Battle_of_Jakku_OFL.png/revision/latest?cb=20181228070022) 

The battle of Jakku was intended to destroy both Imperial Forces and New Republic forces alike

 

The [Battle of Jakku](/wiki/Battle_of_Jakku "Battle of Jakku") commenced a year and four days after the Battle of Endor. With the Empire controlling most of the galaxy's major shipyards, the Republic sought to expand their fleet by capturing Imperial vessels, along with destroying a secret Imperial weapons facility on the planet.[[176]](#cite_note-Battlefront-176)[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17) However, Rax secretly plotted for both New Republic and Imperial forces to destroy each other during the battle, and intentional brought enough firepower to allow both forces to wipe each other off the map and restart the game. Simultaneously Grand Moff Ubrik Adelhard assembled his [coaltion](/wiki/Adelhard_coalition "Adelhard coalition") prepared his final revenge against the Empire and New Republic for treating him like a pawn.[[180]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_3-180)

As New Republic forces arrived to Jakku, the Imperial Fleet in orbit around Jakku, under the command of Grand Moff Randdid, strategically positioned the fleet's Executor-class Star Dreadnought *[Ravager](/wiki/Ravager "Ravager")* behind a defensive perimeter of Star Destroyers which would periodically open formation to allow the *Ravager* to bombard the New Republic fleet with [turbolasers](/wiki/Turbolaser "Turbolaser") and missiles while forcing the opposing fleet, under the command of Admiral Ackbar, to break the perimeter to reach the dreadnought and the ground. Meanwhile on the surface of Jakku, Imperial ground forces under the command of General Borrum defended Imperial ground facilities from assault by New Republic forces under the command of General Tyben and Lieutenant General Brockway.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

 [![The fall of the Ravager, considered the symbolic end of the Imperial Era](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b5/RavagerFalls-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest?cb=20251218120540) [![The fall of the Ravager, considered the symbolic end of the Imperial Era](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b5/RavagerFalls-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20251218120540)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b5/RavagerFalls-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest?cb=20251218120540) 

The fall of the *Ravager*, considered the symbolic end of the Imperial Era

 

As the battle progressed, Imperial forces in space managed to hold the line against the New Republic fleet despite it's [Mark One Starhawks](/wiki/Starhawk-class_Battleship_Mark_I "Starhawk-class Battleship Mark I"), until a blunder by Captain Groff of the Star Destroyer *[Punishment](/wiki/Punishment "Punishment")* panicked and rammed his starship into the Starhawk *[Amity](/wiki/Amity "Amity")*, blubndering the Imperial strategy by creating a hole in the Imperial defenses.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) As the starhawks began to break through the Imperial wall and entered a delicate situation for both parties, Adelhard arrived to the battle aboard his flagship *[Scepter](/wiki/Scepter_(Imperial-class) "Scepter (Imperial-class)")* and announced that he had arrived to destroy both sides to both factions as his ship were supposed to open fire. However, Adelhard was betrayed by the [Spice Runners of Kijimi](/wiki/Spice_Runners_of_Kijimi "Spice Runners of Kijimi") in his moment of victory, allowing the fighting between New Republic and Imperial forces to continue as his flagship was destroyed.[[180]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_3-180) With the Imperial space formation now in chaos, at the urging of Admiral Ackbar, the severely damaged Starhawk *[Concord](/wiki/Concord "Concord")* took advantage of the Imperial opening to attack the *Ravager* directly. Charging at the *Ravager* , the *Concord* utilized it's powerful [tractor beam projector](/wiki/Tractor_beam_projector "Tractor beam projector") to drag the *Ravager* down into Jakku's atmosphere as Ackbar then dispatched several New Republic ships and fighters to knock out the Super Star Destroyer's engines, turning the tide of battle in the favor of the New Republic.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) A a result, as the *Ravager* crashed into the sands of Jakku, so rose the New Republic, ushering in the the symbolic end of the Galactic Civil War, the end of the Imperial Era, and the dawn of the [New Republic Era](/wiki/New_Republic_Era "New Republic Era").[[181]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_4-181)

 [![While skirmishes continued on Jakku, the Galactic Civil War was all but over](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/TerexCorlacJakku-PoeDameron8.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190104015053) [![While skirmishes continued on Jakku, the Galactic Civil War was all but over](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/TerexCorlacJakku-PoeDameron8.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190104015053)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/TerexCorlacJakku-PoeDameron8.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190104015053) 

While skirmishes continued on Jakku, the Galactic Civil War was all but over

 

With the Imperial command ship destroyed, New Republic forces were able to outflank the Imperial forces on all fronts. With the battle turning against the Empire, the surviving Imperial forces began pulling ships onto the planet's surface utilizing their tractor beams, killing most of the occupants in an instant.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) While skirmishes continued on Jakku for several more [months](/wiki/Standard_month "Standard month") after the *Ravager* fell, the war was all but over in all meaningful ways; final spasms of a beheaded monster.[[181]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_4-181)

The surface of Jakku would remain littered with wreckage from the battle for decades to come[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17) as wrecked Imperial ships and vehicles on Jakku were plundered by local scavengers for spare parts and equipment.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) Decades later, contradicting stories continued to fly around Jakku's settlements about what exactly took place in the battle. A mysterious faction known as the [dead-enders](/wiki/Dead-enders "Dead-enders") hung around Carbon Ridge, rumored to be protecting a secret [Imperial research base](/wiki/Imperial_research_base "Imperial research base").[[182]](#cite_note-Rey's_Survival_Guide-182)

##### Starting the game over[]

:   "*Listen to me...there's a ship...Imperialis...Hux is there...use the map--in a data spike in the computer. Set course for the unexplored...*"  
    "*The Eclipse...Palpatine's flagship...*"  
    "*Yes, go to it--Leave this place Sloane. Find a new demesne. Start the game over...*"
:   ―[Gallius Rax](/wiki/Gallius_Rax "Gallius Rax")'s gives information to [Rae Sloane](/wiki/Rae_Sloane "Rae Sloane") as the former dies[[181]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_4-181)

 [![Yape Tashu, Gallius Rax, Brendol Hux, and his son Armitage, retreated to the Jakku Observatory](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f3/JakkuObservatoryGang-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20251203220821) [![Yape Tashu, Gallius Rax, Brendol Hux, and his son Armitage, retreated to the Jakku Observatory](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f3/JakkuObservatoryGang-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20251203220821)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f3/JakkuObservatoryGang-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20251203220821) 

Yape Tashu, Gallius Rax, Brendol Hux, and his son Armitage, retreated to the Jakku Observatory

 

As the Empire lost the Battle of Jakku, Rax traveled to the Jakku Observatory along with Commandant Hux, Armitage Hux, the Imperial Adviser [Yupe Tashu](/wiki/Yupe_Tashu "Yupe Tashu"), and the child soldiers. While the Huxes and the soldiers waited aboard a [replica](/wiki/Imperialis_(Jakku) "Imperialis (Jakku)") of the Emperor's yacht *Imperialis*, Rax and Tashu entered the Observatory to activate the mining bore that would destabilize the planet's core. Rax planned to detonate Jakku's core, destroying the Imperial forces and the New Republic fleet. He then intended to escape to the Unknown Regions, taking the Huxes and the child soldiers with him to build a new Empire. As part of the ceremony, Rax threw the unwitting Tashu, who was carrying several Sith artifacts, to his death down the borehole, initiating the self-destruct mechanism.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

 [![With his final words, Rax told Sloane to carry out the final stage of the Contingency](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/GalliusRaxDeath-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest?cb=20250122165522) [![With his final words, Rax told Sloane to carry out the final stage of the Contingency](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/GalliusRaxDeath-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20250122165522)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/GalliusRaxDeath-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest?cb=20250122165522) 

With his final words, Rax told Sloane to carry out the final stage of the Contingency

 

Rax's plan was ultimately foiled by Sloane, Brentin, and Norra. Following a fight, Sloane killed Rax, then sealed the borehole shaft, stopping the planet's core from destabilizing further. This effectively sabotaged Palpatine's Contingency plan to destroy the remnants of his Empire. Heeding Rax's last words, Sloane assumed responsibility for carrying out the final stage of the Contingency. She accompanied the Huxes and the child soldiers into the Unknown Regions. After several months of travel, they rendezvoused with the Super Star Destroyer [*Eclipse*](/wiki/Eclipse_(Executor-class) "Eclipse (Executor-class)"),[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) formerly the Emperor's personal Star Destroyer,[[181]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_4-181) which had been sent in advance after the Observatory's computers had plotted a safe route through the Unknown Regions.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

#### Instruments of Surrender[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Galactic Concordance](/wiki/Galactic_Concordance "Galactic Concordance") and [Imperial Instruments of Surrender](/wiki/Imperial_Instruments_of_Surrender "Imperial Instruments of Surrender")

:   "*In the month since the Battle of Jakku, the Empire has attempted no further large-scale offensives. Sources report all Imperial vessels within the Core and Inner Rim staying within the boundaries defined by the treaty. A few prominent members of the Provisional Senate have speculated that the New Republic's war with the remnants of the Empire has finally come to an end and that a final surrender may be imminent. However, in her address today, the chancellor warned that all planets should remain on high alert, and that the New Republic Starfleet should be kept on a war footing for the foreseeable future.*"
:   ―A news holo a month following the Battle of Jakku[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87)

With the death of Rax, the disappearance of Sloane, and the failure of the Imperial counteroffensive which ended with the loyalists' catastrophic defeat in the Battle of Jakku,[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) the Empire forever changed as it was pushed back to a handful of sectors on the fringe of the Outer Rim, containing only a small fraction of the galaxy's population and industrial base. These sectors were a heavily fortified final redoubt, and the New Republic deemed that they posed too minor a threat to justify the high cost in life that liberating them would require.[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17)

 [![Mas Amedda agreed to the Galactic Concordance (pictured) and the Imperial Instruments of Surrender, formally surrendering the Galactic Empire to the New Republic](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/GalacticConcordance-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest?cb=20250122143852) [![Mas Amedda agreed to the Galactic Concordance (pictured) and the Imperial Instruments of Surrender, formally surrendering the Galactic Empire to the New Republic](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/GalacticConcordance-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20250122143852)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/GalacticConcordance-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest?cb=20250122143852) 

Mas Amedda agreed to the Galactic Concordance (pictured) and the Imperial Instruments of Surrender, formally surrendering the Galactic Empire to the New Republic

 

The New Republic forced Grand Vizier Amedda to capitulate the Empire and settle for the [Galactic Concordance](/wiki/Galactic_Concordance "Galactic Concordance") and on Chandrila, a humiliating armistice agreement which imposed strict disarmament plans and punishing reparations on the Empire. Treaty stipulations included outlawing the recruitment and mobilization of the [Stormtrooper Corps](/wiki/Stormtrooper_Corps "Stormtrooper Corps"), paying heavy war reparations, adhering to strict disarmament treaties,[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17) abandoning the numerous Imperial Academies scattered across the Empire, banning [torture](/wiki/Torture "Torture"), and ceding its capital of Coruscant to the Republic.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

Chancellor Mothma issued another declaration designating all surviving Imperial military officers war criminals, though she granted conditional pardons to all civilian functionaries including Amedda, provided they complied with the Concordance.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) While some former Imperial governors were invited to the New Republic, many that accepted the offer bore the weight of crushing reparations, making the decision unattractive.[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5) While regulating what remained of the Empire's once-mighty military-industrial complex, thus limiting its ability to wage war, the treaty did permit elements of the Imperial Navy to remain in pre-determined boundaries in the Core Worlds, Colonies, and the Inner Rim as the [formal successor](/wiki/Inner_systems%27_Imperial_remnant "Inner systems' Imperial remnant") to the Empire.[[22]](#cite_note-Battles_that_Changed_the_Galaxy-22) At the command of the Republic, they were recalled to the Core; however, some did not obey.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

### Final Remains[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Imperial remnant](/wiki/Imperial_remnant "Imperial remnant")

#### Fleeing the New Republic[]

:   "*It is good to restore the natural order of things after a period of such disarray, don't you agree?*"
:   ―"The Client," to Din Djarin[[183]](#cite_note-Chapter_1-183)

 [![Mercenary stormtroopers remained active under surviving Imperial warlords in the years after the Galactic Civil War.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0f/The_Client_and_stormtroopers.png/revision/latest?cb=20220221055356) [![Mercenary stormtroopers remained active under surviving Imperial warlords in the years after the Galactic Civil War.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0f/The_Client_and_stormtroopers.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20220221055356)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0f/The_Client_and_stormtroopers.png/revision/latest?cb=20220221055356) 

Mercenary stormtroopers remained active under surviving Imperial warlords in the years after the Galactic Civil War.

 

The Republic announced the signing of the Concordance to the remaining Imperial sectors,[[177]](#cite_note-Bloodline-177) such as in the [Velcar sector](/wiki/Velcar_sector "Velcar sector"), where Governor [Ecressys](/wiki/Ecressys "Ecressys") had already fled into the [Western Reaches](/wiki/Western_Reaches "Western Reaches").[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5) A [provisional government](/wiki/Coruscant%27s_provisional_government "Coruscant's provisional government") on Coruscant was permitted;[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170) this ultimately led to the Republic annexing the former Imperial capital,[[177]](#cite_note-Bloodline-177) while Amedda was also allowed to resume his rule on Coruscant. However, Republic officials oversaw his administration to ensure that the Vizier remained little more than a powerless figurehead.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

As factionalism fell over the fallen Empire,[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) its legacy endured in [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenary "Mercenary") and [warlords](/wiki/Warlord "Warlord")[[184]](#cite_note-Chapter_3-184) who were able to establish footholds on distant worlds, clinging to what little power they had left[[185]](#cite_note-Stormtroopers_DB-185) in the Outer Rim Territories where the New Republic would not interfere.[[186]](#cite_note-Guide_to_Season_One-186) Yet their survival did not alter the reality of the [era](/wiki/New_Republic_Era "New Republic Era") they lived in; for individuals, the Empire was gone.[[184]](#cite_note-Chapter_3-184)

#### One last push[]

:   "*Grand Admiral Thrawn's return will herald in the reemergence of our military, and provide Commandant Hux enough time to deliver on Project Necromancer.*"
:   ―Captain Pellaeon and Moff Gideon[[25]](#cite_note-Mando_Chapter_23-25)

 [![Imperial warlords communicated through a new shadow council formed for the Imperial Remnant](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/MandoShadowCouncil.png/revision/latest?cb=20230417033030) [![Imperial warlords communicated through a new shadow council formed for the Imperial Remnant](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/MandoShadowCouncil.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230417033030)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/MandoShadowCouncil.png/revision/latest?cb=20230417033030) 

Imperial warlords communicated through a new shadow council formed for the Imperial Remnant

 

By [9 ABY](/wiki/9_ABY "9 ABY"),[[187]](#cite_note-Date-187) remaining Imperial warlords including Moff Gideon, Commandant Brendol Hux, and Captain Gilad Pellaeon once again convened under a [new Shadow Council](/wiki/Shadow_Council_(Imperial_Remnants) "Shadow Council (Imperial Remnants)"),[[25]](#cite_note-Mando_Chapter_23-25) uniting under the banner of the [Imperial remnant](/wiki/Imperial_remnant "Imperial remnant").[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54)[[188]](#cite_note-InqdatabaseDatabank-188) While Brendol Hux worked to deliver on [Project Necromancer](/wiki/Project_Necromancer "Project Necromancer"), Captain Pellaeon worked to prepare the remnant for the long awaited return of Grand Admiral Thrawn[[25]](#cite_note-Mando_Chapter_23-25) from the [Far galaxy](/wiki/Far_galaxy "Far galaxy"), which Morgan Elsbeth eventually accomplished.[[189]](#cite_note-Part_8-189) Upon Thrawn's return, the Grand Admiral waged a [campaign against the New Republic](/wiki/Campaign_against_Thrawn%27s_forces "Campaign against Thrawn's forces"), but was eventually defeated. The New Republic kept the campaign and its details about its defense effort classified well until the [Hosnian Cataclysm](/wiki/Hosnian_Cataclysm "Hosnian Cataclysm"). [Chalm Plesk](/wiki/Chalm_Plesk "Chalm Plesk"), a [University of Coruscant](/wiki/University_of_Coruscant "University of Coruscant") [historian](/wiki/Historian "Historian"), tried to argue his case before the [New Republic Senate](/wiki/New_Republic_Senate "New Republic Senate"), having been blocked from publishing his work, *[The Last War Against the Galactic Empire: On Deployment with the New Republic Fleet](/wiki/The_Last_War_Against_the_Galactic_Empire:_On_Deployment_with_the_New_Republic_Fleet "The Last War Against the Galactic Empire: On Deployment with the New Republic Fleet")*, by various military figures for [years](/wiki/Standard_year "Standard year").[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54)

### Legacy[]

#### A generation after the Empire[]

:   "*It is the task of the First Order to remove the disorder from our own existence, so that civilization may be returned to the stability that promotes progress. A stability that existed under the Empire, was reduced to anarchy by the Rebellion, was inherited in turn by the so-called Republic, and will be restored by us. Future historians will look upon this as the time when a strong hand brought the rule of law back to civilization.*"
:   ―[Kylo Ren](/wiki/Ben_Solo "Ben Solo")[[190]](#cite_note-Star_Wars:_The_Force_Awakens_(novelization)-190)

 [![The tyranny of the Galactic Empire was remembered during the New Republic Era](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/Stormtrooper_helmet_pikes.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200305134734) [![The tyranny of the Galactic Empire was remembered during the New Republic Era](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/Stormtrooper_helmet_pikes.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200305134734)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/Stormtrooper_helmet_pikes.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200305134734) 

The tyranny of the Galactic Empire was remembered during the New Republic Era

 

While the Empire, the heroes of the Rebellion, and the tragedy of Alderaan would be remembered by the generation conceived after the destruction of the second Death Star, these "[victory kids](/wiki/Victory_kid "Victory kid")" would learn of the battles of the past in textbooks, with the struggles of the Galactic Civil War soon becoming nothing more than a distant memory.[[177]](#cite_note-Bloodline-177) Many of the Old Empire's orbital shipyards were destroyed,[[191]](#cite_note-Cross-191) and the New Republic passed the [Military Disarmament Act](/wiki/Military_Disarmament_Act "Military Disarmament Act"), among others, in an effort to avoid repeating the mistakes of the Galactic Republic, and rotated its capital among member worlds rather than using the former Imperial Center.[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17) Imperial collectors of stormtrooper helmets, banners, flags and other regalia of the Imperial armed forces often gave themselves outlandish titles—such as the [Avenger of Jakku](/wiki/Avenger_of_Jakku "Avenger of Jakku"), [Emperor's Wrath](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Wrath_(collector) "Emperor's Wrath (collector)"), and [Interceptor Fire](/wiki/Interceptor_Fire "Interceptor Fire")—in a quasi-homage to the late Empire. Others admired the fallen regime for its efficiency, vision, and massive military machine.[[177]](#cite_note-Bloodline-177)

#### The First Order[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order")

 [![The First Order rose to power as the successor of the Galactic Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4b/Legitimate_Power.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20211205050001) [![The First Order rose to power as the successor of the Galactic Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4b/Legitimate_Power.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/245?cb=20211205050001)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4b/Legitimate_Power.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20211205050001) 

The First Order rose to power as the successor of the Galactic Empire.

 

With the Empire's collapse, many of the Emperor's servants including many former members of the political, military, and scientific Imperial establishment, fled into the Unknown Regions with some of the regime's greatest secrets. The [Attendants](/wiki/Attendants "Attendants"), a retinue of mute [alien](/wiki/Alien "Alien") [navigators](/wiki/Navigator "Navigator") commanded by [Snoke](/wiki/Snoke "Snoke"), assisted these former Imperial officers, nobles, technologists[[21]](#cite_note-FO_Databank-21) and warlords[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17) in crossing the ancient hyperspace trails.[[192]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-192) There, for nearly three decades after Endor, the former Empire would recoalesce itself as the mysterious [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order").[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17) By [21 ABY](/wiki/21_ABY "21 ABY"),[[193]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith_date-193) the tattered remnants of the Empire had fled into the farthest reaches of galactic space,[[194]](#cite_note-211_Launchpad-194) but an obscure command structure had started to emerge within the Unknown Regions.
