Although the Imperial holdouts based in the Unknown Regions were still scattered during that time, one [Imperial remnant](/wiki/First_Order "First Order") that followed the growing chain of command remained active in the main space of the galaxy and established an alliance with the [Corporate Sector Authority](/wiki/Corporate_Sector_Authority "Corporate Sector Authority").[[195]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-195) In time, the remnant situated in the Unknown Regions transformed[[196]](#cite_note-SW_Books-196) from once scattered holdouts[[195]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-195) into the First Order,[[22]](#cite_note-Battles_that_Changed_the_Galaxy-22) specifically forming into what would be the [First Order military](/wiki/First_Order_military "First Order military").[[196]](#cite_note-SW_Books-196)

Situated in the galaxy's vast frontier, the growing First Order rapidly expanded and colonized newly discovered star systems, while new bases, shipyards, and weapons labs began churning out a technologically advanced military in a bid to conquer the galaxy.[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17) Furthermore, a number of surviving Imperial Remnants, which were festering by that time, were brought into the First Order apparatus and helped it bloom.[[197]](#cite_note-231History-197) Armitage Hux became a general in the First Order, and inherited his father's ambition to [train](/wiki/Project_Resurrection "Project Resurrection") a [new army of stormtroopers](/wiki/First_Order_stormtrooper "First Order stormtrooper") that was superior to the Imperial generation. Inspired by the memory of the Galactic Empire and composed of various military leaders of the former regime, the First Order [fought for control of the galaxy](/wiki/First_Order-Resistance_War "First Order-Resistance War") against the [Resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance"), a private military force led by General Leia Organa and funded by like-minded senators in the New Republic who believed the Order posed a greater threat than many believed.[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17)

#### The Final Order[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Final Order](/wiki/Final_Order "Final Order") and [Sith Eternal](/wiki/Sith_Eternal "Sith Eternal")

 [![Palpatine cheated death and slowly prepared for his eventual return to rule the Galaxy once again with the power of the Final Order](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/Final-Order-Fleet.png/revision/latest?cb=20210201031950) [![Palpatine cheated death and slowly prepared for his eventual return to rule the Galaxy once again with the power of the Final Order](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/Final-Order-Fleet.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20210201031950)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/Final-Order-Fleet.png/revision/latest?cb=20210201031950) 

Palpatine cheated death and slowly prepared for his eventual return to rule the Galaxy once again with the power of the Final Order

 

As the First Order took shape during the chaos of the [New Republic Era](/wiki/New_Republic_Era "New Republic Era") reigned, the sith cult known as the [Sith Eternal](/wiki/Sith_Eternal "Sith Eternal"), using technology highly advanced science, specifically [bioengineering](/wiki/Bioengineering "Bioengineering"), [cloning](/wiki/Cloning "Cloning"), and [behavioral programming](/wiki/Flash-training "Flash-training"), in turn, all specifically of [Kaminoan](/wiki/Kaminoan "Kaminoan") origin, allowed Emperor Palpatine not only return to life, but also achieve [eternal life](/wiki/Immortality "Immortality"), doing so on the Unknown Regions world of [Exegol](/wiki/Exegol "Exegol"). As this happened, the Sith Eternal continued work on preparing the return of the Galactic Empire for Palpatine in the form of the [Final Order](/wiki/Final_Order "Final Order"),[[198]](#cite_note-TROS_EE-198) of which it's military contained thousands of [*Xyston-class* Star Destroyers](/wiki/Xyston-class_Star_Destroyer "Xyston-class Star Destroyer"), star destroyers each armed with [superlasers](/wiki/Superlaser "Superlaser") able to destroy entire planets.[[199]](#cite_note-TROS-199) To ensure that his return would be unchallenged by remaining Imperial forces, Sidious dispatched [Snoke](/wiki/Snoke "Snoke"), an artificial [strandcast](/wiki/Strandcast "Strandcast"), to control the First Order and ensure it's loyalty to the Final Order.[[196]](#cite_note-SW_Books-196)

## Organization[]

### Central Government[]

### Government[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Galactic Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic Emperor"), [Imperial Senate](/wiki/Imperial_Senate "Imperial Senate"), [Imperial Ruling Council](/wiki/Imperial_Ruling_Council "Imperial Ruling Council"), [Imperial Court](/wiki/Imperial_Court "Imperial Court"), [Fascism](/wiki/Fascism "Fascism") and [Stratocracy](/wiki/Stratocracy "Stratocracy")

 [![The Galactic Empire was ruled by Darth Sidious, who declared himself Emperor after the Clone Wars.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bb/SidEmp.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008110258) [![The Galactic Empire was ruled by Darth Sidious, who declared himself Emperor after the Clone Wars.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bb/SidEmp.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20201008110258)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bb/SidEmp.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008110258) 

The Galactic Empire was ruled by Darth Sidious, who declared himself Emperor after the Clone Wars.

 

The First Galactic Empire was a [fascist](/wiki/Fascism "Fascism")[[1]](#cite_note-Highlights_Nobody's_Listening-1) [dictatorship](/wiki/Dictatorship "Dictatorship") led by a [Galactic Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic Emperor")[[201]](#cite_note-Yoda_Encyclopedia-201) and enforced by a vast [Imperial Military](/wiki/Imperial_Military "Imperial Military").[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) The Emperor acted as the sovereign ruler and ultimate authority in all [political](/wiki/Politics "Politics") and military matters of state.[[202]](#cite_note-Empire_Databank-202) Aiding the Emperor was a [Grand Vizier](/wiki/Grand_Vizier "Grand Vizier"), who was the head of the [Imperial Ruling Council](/wiki/Imperial_Ruling_Council "Imperial Ruling Council"), which in turn consisted of [advisors](/wiki/Advisor "Advisor") who wielded considerable powers over all aspects of the Empire's political and military apparatus.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) While supposedly bound by the [Imperial Charter](/wiki/Imperial_Charter "Imperial Charter"), Imperial rulers were largely above the law.[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5)

The legislature consisted of the former [Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic") [Galactic Senate](/wiki/Galactic_Senate "Galactic Senate"), renamed the [Imperial Senate](/wiki/Imperial_Senate "Imperial Senate"). As an autocracy, the democratic and forward-thinking policies of the former Republic became obsolete within the new corridors of power. The Imperial Senate lost the prestige it once held as the forum for galactic debate[[203]](#cite_note-PoP-203) as Palpatine took away whatever authority it had in his march towards total control over the galaxy.[[78]](#cite_note-Nobody's_Listening!-78) The Senate became a rubber-stamp needed for passing legislation, which could be overruled by the Emperor for any reason,[[204]](#cite_note-SP-204) before it was dissolved entirely by the Emperor[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2) in [1 BBY](/wiki/1_BBY "1 BBY"),[[13]](#cite_note-Imperial_Senate_date-13) effectively wiping away the last remnants of the Old Republic. Legislative authority over the various [star systems](/wiki/Star_system "Star system") and [sectors](/wiki/Sector "Sector") passed directly to regional [governors](/wiki/Governor "Governor")[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)—effectively transforming the Empire into a [stratocracy](/wiki/Stratocracy "Stratocracy").[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5)

 [![Through the Empire, the Sith secretly controlled the galaxy for a generation.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/33/DarthVader2020-5-Sprouse-textless.png/revision/latest?cb=20210523171450) [![Through the Empire, the Sith secretly controlled the galaxy for a generation.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/33/DarthVader2020-5-Sprouse-textless.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210523171450)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/33/DarthVader2020-5-Sprouse-textless.png/revision/latest?cb=20210523171450) 

Through the Empire, the Sith secretly controlled the galaxy for a generation.

 

Amongst high-ranking military personnel, a mere reference to Emperor Palpatine was enough to instill fear,[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135) similar to the reputation of his [lieutenant](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Fist "Emperor's Fist"), Darth Vader,[[205]](#cite_note-Will_See_You-205) who was frequently styled as a "[Lord](/wiki/Lord "Lord")"[[206]](#cite_note-Aphra_(2016)_35-206) and treated with a similar fearful deference.[[205]](#cite_note-Will_See_You-205) Many considered Vader to be Palpatine's right-hand man—a living weapon—and viewed him as the natural successor to the Emperor's legacy.[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16) In reality, the Emperor planned to live forever by uncovering the secrets to immortality via dark-side research into Sith alchemy,[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) as epitomized by [Project Blackwing](/wiki/Project_Blackwing "Project Blackwing").[[207]](#cite_note-SWC_Sickness-207) Indeed, the Empire lacked a clear chain of succession following both Palpatine and Vader's deaths.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) Also in a high position was Wilhuff Tarkin, a ruthless officer whom Palpatine had groomed for a leadership role for years. Palpatine, Vader, and Tarkin formed the dark triumvirate in control of the Empire.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) Following the loss of leadership at the Battle of Endor, with Tarkin having died years prior at Yavin, Imperial head of government, Grand Vizier [Mas Amedda](/wiki/Mas_Amedda "Mas Amedda") attempted to keep the Empire together, while new pretenders to the Imperial throne announced their ascension to power on a near daily basis.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87)

Owing to a lack of communication, Imperial messages surrounding Palpatine's death were contradictory. Some such as [Grand Moff](/wiki/Grand_Moff "Grand Moff") [Lozen Tolruck](/wiki/Lozen_Tolruck "Lozen Tolruck") of [Imperial territory G5-623](/wiki/Imperial_territory_G5-623 "Imperial territory G5-623") suggested that the Emperor had escaped the [Death Star II](/wiki/DS-2_Death_Star_II_Mobile_Battle_Station "DS-2 Death Star II Mobile Battle Station") through miraculous means. Others claimed the even wilder notion that the Emperor was still leading the Empire from beyond the grave.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) Some simply refused to acknowledge the Emperor's death for months.[[5]](#cite_note-Propaganda-5)[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) In order to counter the reports of the Emperor's demise, a proxy actor was installed in his place. Eventually, the truth of the Emperor's fate became known to the general citizenry. Declarations of a new Emperor were announced almost every day, but none were able to consolidate any substantial power. Splinter [fleets](/wiki/Fleet "Fleet") and other Imperial officials fought each other to support the various claimants to the throne;[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) the Empire was thus shattered into numerous warring factions, instead of standing as a single united bloc.[[30]](#cite_note-Squadrons-30)

In the months following the [Battle of Endor](/wiki/Battle_of_Endor "Battle of Endor"), [Grand Admiral](/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral") [Rae Sloane](/wiki/Rae_Sloane "Rae Sloane") became publicly recognized as the *de facto* head of the Galactic Empire and [Imperial Navy](/wiki/Imperial_Navy "Imperial Navy"). In reality, power was held by [Fleet Admiral](/wiki/Fleet_Admiral "Fleet Admiral") [Gallius Rax](/wiki/Gallius_Rax "Gallius Rax") and his [Shadow Council](/wiki/Shadow_Council "Shadow Council"). On Coruscant, Amedda, the *de jure* ruler of the Empire and proxy Emperor, was held under house arrest by Gallius Rax. [Mon Mothma](/wiki/Mon_Mothma "Mon Mothma") refused to accept his surrender unless he could find a way to surrender the entire Empire.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) During the covert Imperial-backed [Liberation Day](/wiki/Liberation_Day_(New_Republic) "Liberation Day (New Republic)") [terror](/wiki/Terrorist "Terrorist") [attack](/wiki/Attack_on_Chandrila "Attack on Chandrila") on [Chandrila](/wiki/Chandrila "Chandrila"), Sloane's aide [Adea Rite](/wiki/Adea_Rite "Adea Rite") executed a failed [assassination](/wiki/Assassin "Assassin") attempt on the Grand Admiral per secret orders of Rax after Sloane refused to join his forces. Rax publicly claimed shock at the assumed death of Sloane. Instead of taking the mantle of Emperor, Rax chose the title [Counselor to the Empire](/wiki/Counselor_to_the_Empire "Counselor to the Empire"), vowing to act as an interstitial leader until the Grand Admiral's return. He was ultimately killed during the [Battle of Jakku](/wiki/Battle_of_Jakku "Battle of Jakku") when his [remnant forces](/wiki/Jakku_Imperial_remnant "Jakku Imperial remnant") battled the New Republic.[[170]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-170)

 [![The Imperial Ruling Council consisted of advisors who governed the Empire on behalf of their ruler.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/GreejatusAndFriends-ROTJ.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120113180412) [![The Imperial Ruling Council consisted of advisors who governed the Empire on behalf of their ruler.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/GreejatusAndFriends-ROTJ.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20120113180412)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/GreejatusAndFriends-ROTJ.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120113180412) 

The Imperial Ruling Council consisted of advisors who governed the Empire on behalf of their ruler.

 

While Emperor Palpatine held sole and supreme power within the Empire, he typically eschewed the day-to-day affairs of his government to others. In doing so, he was free to conduct extensive research into the dark side of the Force[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) and enjoy his rule over the galaxy without needing to worry about boring bureaucracy.[[208]](#cite_note-Rewind_of_the_Jedi-208) As such, the mundane decision-making of the Empire's executive branch was conducted by the Imperial Ruling Council. The council was led by Grand Vizier Mas Amedda and the Emperor's closest advisors: [Sate Pestage](/wiki/Sate_Pestage "Sate Pestage"), [Janus Greejatus](/wiki/Janus_Greejatus "Janus Greejatus"), [Ars Dangor](/wiki/Ars_Dangor "Ars Dangor"), [Kren Blista-Vanee](/wiki/Kren_Blista-Vanee "Kren Blista-Vanee") and [Prelate](/wiki/Prelate "Prelate") [Verge](/wiki/Verge "Verge"). These individuals constituted the uppermost tier of the Imperial hegemony and wielded considerable powers over officers within the military.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) Greejatus and [Sim Aloo](/wiki/Sim_Aloo "Sim Aloo"), another advisor involved in day-to-day governing, were also busy in hunting down Sith artifacts for Sidious.[[208]](#cite_note-Rewind_of_the_Jedi-208) Moffs, generals and admirals all were answerable to the Imperial cadre, but even the councilors were not always privy to the doings of [Imperial Intelligence](/wiki/Imperial_Intelligence "Imperial Intelligence"). After the Emperor largely retired from public life, Vizier Amedda and the rest of the Ruling Council took to dispatching processions of Imperial skylimos to maintain an illusion that the Emperor still moved about in public.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

As the Emperor's [apprentice](/wiki/Sith_apprentice "Sith apprentice") and second in command, Lord Vader acted as the informal Commander-in-Chief of the [Imperial Military](/wiki/Imperial_Military "Imperial Military").[[10]](#cite_note-Bust_Collection-10) Following the Cylo Hijacking, Palpatine elevated Vader to an official position, that of [supreme commander of the Imperial fleet](/wiki/Supreme_commander_of_the_Imperial_fleet "Supreme commander of the Imperial fleet").[[11]](#cite_note-Rise_Fall-11) The Emperor's Fist,[[209]](#cite_note-Vader-209) as he was referred to by many, was also apparently granted nearly carte blanche to execute subordinates who displeased him.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) Even in his new role, Vader had little involvement in administrative matters, which he let the Joint Chiefs handle from behind the scenes,[[11]](#cite_note-Rise_Fall-11) and adopted a more frontline command style.[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41) Like his master, the [Dark Lord](/wiki/Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith "Dark Lord of the Sith") considered the Empire to be a mere tool for them to use in their quest for greater power in, and understanding of, the dark side.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

With the Ruling Council's inability to run the Empire following the deaths of Emperor Palpatine and Lord Vader[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) in [4 ABY](/wiki/4_ABY "4 ABY"),[[35]](#cite_note-Galactic_Atlas-35) Fleet Admiral Gallius Rax proposed a new executive branch called the Shadow Council that would be a more covert and militaristic body than the Ruling Council it sought to replace. The Shadow Council would consist of various advisors, [admirals](/wiki/Admiral "Admiral") and [generals](/wiki/General "General") with Grand Admiral Rae Sloane as the group's *de facto* leader until her supposed "disappearance."[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

 [![The Imperial Senate served as the Empire nominal legislative organ until it was disbanded by the Emperor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/68/Imperial_Senate-Andor.png/revision/latest?cb=20220802053016) [![The Imperial Senate served as the Empire nominal legislative organ until it was disbanded by the Emperor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/68/Imperial_Senate-Andor.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220802053016)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/68/Imperial_Senate-Andor.png/revision/latest?cb=20220802053016) 

The Imperial Senate served as the Empire nominal legislative organ until it was disbanded by the Emperor.

 

Seeing whatever power it had left stripped away by acts like the Public Order Resentencing Directive,[[78]](#cite_note-Nobody's_Listening!-78) the Imperial Senate was reduced to the lower tier of government and gradually lost the prestige it once held as the forum for galactic debate.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)[[78]](#cite_note-Nobody's_Listening!-78) An increasing number of senators became entangled in the web of corruption,[[203]](#cite_note-PoP-203) as had begun earlier in the Republic Era; in the days of the Galactic Republic, Sidious had encouraged and exploited those engaged in the pursuit of power and greed as part of his rise to emperorship.[[210]](#cite_note-Birth_of_Empire-210) Many senators also became used to simply signing off on the Emperor's demands.[[211]](#cite_note-Rogue_One_1-211) The Senate became a servile institute that applauded Palpatine's decrees and agreed to his demands[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) without much thought.[[211]](#cite_note-Rogue_One_1-211) That the Senate continued to exist provided the illusion that the Emperor was following "the will of the people"[[177]](#cite_note-Bloodline-177) when, in reality, he acted out of his own interests.[[212]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_(2017)_13-212)

With the once-powerful Senate firmly in Palpatine's hands, passing legislation became a mere formality for the New Order as it agreed to the Emperor's every declaration,[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) even if Senators[[204]](#cite_note-SP-204) and galactic citizens were made to believe that they had a voice in galactic politics.[[177]](#cite_note-Bloodline-177) In reality, Palpatine held unlimited executive power and was the only one who could formally pass legislation. While most feared to speak out against the Emperor, a few, such as Bail and Leia Organa of Alderaan, actively questioned the accountability of the Empire and its actions, much to the ire of Imperial authorities. Suspicions eventually arose that Leia Organa was using her diplomatic immunity to help the Rebel Alliance. The Empire also lied to the Senate about the [destruction](/wiki/Destruction_of_Jedha_City "Destruction of Jedha City") of [Jedha City](/wiki/Jedha_City "Jedha City"), claiming that it was a mining accident.[[132]](#cite_note-RO-132) The Emperor used Leia's capture aboard the *Tantive IV*, which was known to be carrying technical readouts for the Death Star, as an excuse for disbanding the Imperial Senate shortly before the Battle of Yavin. With the dissolution of the Senate, the last remnants of the Old Republic had been swept away, and the legislative authority over the various systems and sectors passed directly to the regional governors—effectively transitioning governance into military jurisdiction, who answered directly to the Emperor.[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)

 [![Wilhuff Tarkin was a Grand Moff.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Tarkin-SWG4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100621233918) [![Wilhuff Tarkin was a Grand Moff.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Tarkin-SWG4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20100621233918)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Tarkin-SWG4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100621233918) 

Wilhuff Tarkin was a Grand Moff.

 

Territories from the Core Worlds to the Outer Rim Territories were overseen by regional sector governors, or Moffs, who as part of the Imperial Military wielded much of the power over each sector[[114]](#cite_note-Steps_Into_Shadow-114) and who enforced the Galactic Emperor's rule across each sector.[[213]](#cite_note-Lando_2-213) This stemmed from the [Sector Governance Decree](/wiki/Sector_Governance_Decree "Sector Governance Decree") that Palpatine passed during the later stages of the Clone Wars, when he was Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic.[[214]](#cite_note-Rebel_Files-214) With only twenty Moffs at one time, they were answerable to the Ruling Council, and all positions were dominated by [humans](/wiki/Human "Human"). They themselves were outranked by the position of Grand Moff, established in 14 BBY and first granted to Moff Wilhuff Tarkin, who were governors of [oversectors](/wiki/Oversector "Oversector"), areas of space that contained several planetary sectors and were used to keep the Moffs or sector governors in control.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) After the Imperial Senate was disbanded, all legislative power went to regional governors just before the Battle of Yavin.[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)

After Emperor Sheev Palpatine's [death](/wiki/Death "Death") during the Battle of Endor, Imperial territories fell into total unrest, with some military leaders such as [Valco Pandion](/wiki/Valco_Pandion "Valco Pandion") appointing themselves Grand Moffs, while corrupt sector governors began accepting payments for the New Republic's allocation of Imperial ships or suing for peace.[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16) Other governors, such as Grand Moff Lozen Tolruck of Imperial territory G5-623 and Governor of the [Anoat sector](/wiki/Anoat_sector "Anoat sector") [Ubrik Adelhard](/wiki/Ubrik_Adelhard "Ubrik Adelhard"), broke off from the Empire, forming Imperial remnants.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)[[64]](#cite_note-Uprising-64)

### Administration and bureaucracy[]

:   "*With the next quarter's detention estimates expected to increase across the Ryloth sector, any further erosion in local authority may require and increase in our blackline budget.*"
:   ―[Grandi](/wiki/Grandi "Grandi")[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70)

 [![COMPNOR recruitment poster  by ](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/COMPNOR_Recruitment-SW_Propaganda.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170306025241) [![COMPNOR recruitment poster  by ](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/COMPNOR_Recruitment-SW_Propaganda.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20170306025241)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/COMPNOR_Recruitment-SW_Propaganda.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170306025241) 

COMPNOR recruitment poster *[COMPNOR Recruitment](/wiki/COMPNOR_Recruitment "COMPNOR Recruitment")* by [Dasita Lyros](/wiki/Dasita_Lyros "Dasita Lyros")

 

While the Emperor maintained a galactic armada and commanded the undisputed military, scientific, and economic hegemony in the entire galaxy, the ever-present fear of surviving Jedi haunted Palpatine throughout his reign. In direct response to this feared threat, the Empire employed numerous dark side adepts, [Force-sensitive](/wiki/Force-sensitive "Force-sensitive") individuals of the [Inquisitorius](/wiki/Inquisitorius "Inquisitorius") trained to track down and eliminate any surviving Jedi. Due to the nature of their mission, [Inquisitors](/wiki/Inquisitor "Inquisitor") could commandeer local Imperial forces and possessed authority over other officers in the Imperial Military.[[52]](#cite_note-Rebels_Visual_Guide-52)[[215]](#cite_note-AbEverything-215) The Inquisitorius was governed by Lord Vader,[[47]](#cite_note-Fallen_Order-47) the Emperor's handpicked second in command,[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41) who oversaw the Empire's [hunting](/wiki/Jedi_hunter "Jedi hunter") of the [Jedi Knights](/wiki/Jedi_Knight "Jedi Knight") in the [Great Jedi Purge](/wiki/Great_Jedi_Purge "Great Jedi Purge").[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)

While dark-side leanings and occult goals may have fascinated the Empire's ruler, the banal commonalities of ruling a galaxy-wide Empire never failed to impress upon the Imperial leadership. With the rise of the New Order, many previous governmental agencies were renamed and repurposed, while many official buildings saw themselves remodeled to fit a darker and more angular aesthetic. One such agency was the Republic-era COMPOR, newly dubbed COMPNOR, the [Commission for the Preservation of the New Order](/wiki/Commission_for_the_Preservation_of_the_New_Order "Commission for the Preservation of the New Order").[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) COMPOR and the ISB operated under the secretive [Select Committee](/wiki/Select_Committee "Select Committee").[[216]](#cite_note-Dawn_of_Rebellion-216)

COMPNOR served as the Empire's chief umbrella agency dedicated to ensuring order and stability for the countless worlds under the Emperor's rule while supporting the new regime through both [propaganda](/wiki/Propaganda "Propaganda") and intelligence services. Organizations such as the [Imperial Security Bureau](/wiki/Imperial_Security_Bureau "Imperial Security Bureau") worked under its oversight, with the ISB helping to stamp out potential dissident actions.[[98]](#cite_note-Spark-98) Also working under the auspices of COMPNOR was the [Ministry of Information](/wiki/Ministry_of_Information "Ministry of Information"), designated under the [Coalition for Progress](/wiki/Coalition_for_Progress "Coalition for Progress"). The Ministry was primarily tasked with muzzling the HoloNet News Agency of anti-Imperial messaging and ensuring the necessary infrastructure for the vast communications systems within the Empire. It also worked to monitor the [Imperial Press Corps](/wiki/Imperial_Press_Corps "Imperial Press Corps") at the grand [COMPNOR arcology](/wiki/COMPNOR_arcology "COMPNOR arcology"), located in the [Federal District](/wiki/Federal_District "Federal District") of Coruscant, [Level 5127](/wiki/Level_5127 "Level 5127").[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)[[217]](#cite_note-HoloNet_News_Special_Report:_Journalists_Across_Galaxy_Join_Press_Corps-217)

The Empire also maintained the [Imperial Information Office](/wiki/Imperial_Information_Office "Imperial Information Office"), which employed civilians to help the Empire and its massive data operations in the galaxy, allowing employees the option to cybernetically enhance their performance with [AJ^6 cyborg constructs](/wiki/AJ%5E6_cyborg_construct "AJ^6 cyborg construct").[[18]](#cite_note-Empire_Day_ep-18) The [Ministry of Agriculture](/wiki/Ministry_of_Agriculture "Ministry of Agriculture") and [Imperial Agricultural Collective](/wiki/Imperial_Agricultural_Collective "Imperial Agricultural Collective") oversaw the horticultural aspect of Imperial dominion, with officials on many worlds across the galaxy, including Lothal.[[218]](#cite_note-Edge_of_the_Galaxy-218) The Economics Ministry, [Education Ministry](/wiki/Education_Ministry "Education Ministry"), [Weather Ministry](/wiki/Weather_Ministry "Weather Ministry"), [Transportation Ministry](/wiki/Transportation_Ministry "Transportation Ministry") and [Imperial Survey Corps](/wiki/Imperial_Survey_Corps "Imperial Survey Corps") also employed numerous citizens across the Empire.[[219]](#cite_note-Justice-219)[[160]](#cite_note-Moving_Target-160)

In addition to ruling through fear, the Empire ensured the Outer Rim was faced with hunger while it was expanding into the region, using the tactic on such a large scale it made former Padawan Ahsoka Tano uncomfortable.[[51]](#cite_note-Ahsoka-51) Following the Battle of Endor, COMPNOR was reorganized into the [Office of Imperial Promotion, Galactic Truth, and Fact Correction](/wiki/Office_of_Imperial_Promotion,_Galactic_Truth,_and_Fact_Correction "Office of Imperial Promotion, Galactic Truth, and Fact Correction").[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

### Military[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Imperial Military](/wiki/Imperial_Military "Imperial Military"), [Imperial Army](/wiki/Imperial_Army "Imperial Army"), [Imperial Navy](/wiki/Imperial_Navy "Imperial Navy") and [Stormtrooper Corps](/wiki/Stormtrooper_Corps "Stormtrooper Corps")

:   "*Look on our new military not as trespassers or interlopers, but as gatekeepers, here to shore up the Emperor's vision of a pacified and prosperous galaxy.*"
:   ―Wilhuff Tarkin[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

 [![Stormtroopers could be both the elite shock troops and main infantry of the Galactic Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Doctor_Aphra_3_Star_Wars_40th.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190119030333) [![Stormtroopers could be both the elite shock troops and main infantry of the Galactic Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Doctor_Aphra_3_Star_Wars_40th.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190119030333)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Doctor_Aphra_3_Star_Wars_40th.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190119030333) 

Stormtroopers could be both the elite shock troops and main infantry of the Galactic Empire.

 

As the direct successor to the [Republic Military](/wiki/Republic_Military "Republic Military"), the [Imperial Military](/wiki/Imperial_Military "Imperial Military") comprised vast numbers of [warships](/wiki/Warship "Warship") and countless [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier"). One of the most recognizable warships was the [*Imperial*-class Star Destroyer](/wiki/Imperial-class_Star_Destroyer "Imperial-class Star Destroyer"), and the mere sight of one usually was enough to bring a troublesome system in line. Rule through fear of force rather than force itself was the driving philosophy throughout the Imperial Military, epitomized by the [Tarkin Doctrine](/wiki/Tarkin_Doctrine "Tarkin Doctrine"). Bolstered by the near limitless resources at the Empire's disposal and loyalist companies, such as [Taim & Bak](/wiki/Taim_%26_Bak "Taim & Bak"), [Borstel](/wiki/Borstel_Galactic_Defense "Borstel Galactic Defense"), and *[Phylon Transport](/wiki/Phylon_Transport "Phylon Transport")*, corporations, such as [Kuat Drive Yards](/wiki/Kuat_Drive_Yards "Kuat Drive Yards") and its subsidiary [Kuat Systems Engineering](/wiki/Kuat_Systems_Engineering "Kuat Systems Engineering") produced many of the New Order's Star Destroyers, as well as the formidable All Terrain Armored Transport, which was frequently deployed at hot spots throughout the galaxy.[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41)[[52]](#cite_note-Rebels_Visual_Guide-52) If it meant securing victory in a battle, the Empire was often fine with civilian casualties.[[167]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-167)

The [All Terrain Armored Transport](/wiki/All_Terrain_Armored_Transport "All Terrain Armored Transport") [walker](/wiki/Walker "Walker") became to be feared for its formidable chin-mounted heavy laser cannons, while lighter walkers such as the [All Terrain Defense Pod](/wiki/All_Terrain_Defense_Pod "All Terrain Defense Pod") featured a single [laser cannon](/wiki/Laser_cannon "Laser cannon") able to be rotated independent of the walkers front-facing direction, and were deployed primarily to protect Imperial Military interests on backwater worlds. [BlasTech Industries](/wiki/BlasTech_Industries "BlasTech Industries") was the primary weapons producer for the widely used [E-11 medium blaster rifle](/wiki/E-11_medium_blaster_rifle "E-11 medium blaster rifle").[[52]](#cite_note-Rebels_Visual_Guide-52) The [Aratech Repulsor Company](/wiki/Aratech_Repulsor_Company "Aratech Repulsor Company") manufactured the [614-AvA speeder bike](/wiki/614-AvA_speeder_bike "614-AvA speeder bike"), commonly referred to as the Imperial speeder bike, which would eventually be replaced by the [74-Z](/wiki/74-Z_speeder_bike "74-Z speeder bike").[[220]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_Rebels:_Head_to_Head-220) Sienar Fleet Systems produced many of the Empire's Imperial TIE fighters and variants, such as the [TIE/ad v1](/wiki/TIE/ad_v1 "TIE/ad v1"), which was originally unveiled on Empire Day and featured dual chin-mounted laser cannons and the ability to launch warheads such as the [XX-23 S-thread tracker](/wiki/XX-23_S-thread_tracker "XX-23 S-thread tracker").[[18]](#cite_note-Empire_Day_ep-18) The [TIE Advanced x1](/wiki/TIE_Advanced_x1 "TIE Advanced x1") naturally became the next evolution of the deadly v1, as well as the preferred craft of Lord Vader. In addition, the Empire inherited the military assets of the defunct Separatist movement—the most notable of which was the Death Star.[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3)

 [![Imperial Army soldiers were the standard infantry of the galaxy-spanning empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Solo-db-han-beckett-mimban-gallery_1bb27b64.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20181017162901) [![Imperial Army soldiers were the standard infantry of the galaxy-spanning empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Solo-db-han-beckett-mimban-gallery_1bb27b64.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20181017162901)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Solo-db-han-beckett-mimban-gallery_1bb27b64.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20181017162901) 

Imperial Army soldiers were the standard infantry of the galaxy-spanning empire.

 

Although only promoted to supreme commander of the Imperial fleet late in the Empire's reign,[[11]](#cite_note-Rise_Fall-11) Lord Vader was seen by many as the *de facto* [Commander-in-Chief](/wiki/Commander-in-Chief "Commander-in-Chief").[[221]](#cite_note-Bust_Collection2-221) Nonetheless, the Imperial Military had an overall [Supreme Commander](/wiki/Supreme_Commander_(Galactic_Empire) "Supreme Commander (Galactic Empire)"), who formulated the strategy to fit the Emperor's agenda and held control over the entirety of the Empire's war machine. Leading the armed forces under their supervision were highly trained admirals, generals and Moffs who were instructed at the numerous [Imperial Academy](/wiki/Imperial_Academy "Imperial Academy") complexes throughout the galaxy. Several veteran [officers](/wiki/Officer "Officer") also formerly served in the Galactic Republic, with decorated members such as Wullf Yularen. During the sixth year of the Emperor's reign, twenty Moffs answered directly to the Imperial Ruling Council. The title of Grand Moff was specifically created for Wilhuff Tarkin, while other Moffs, such as [Tiaan Jerjerrod](/wiki/Tiaan_Jerjerrod "Tiaan Jerjerrod") and [Therbon](/wiki/Therbon "Therbon") sought to increase their reputation with Palpatine.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

Some ambitious [Imperial officers](/wiki/Imperial_officer "Imperial officer") even supported insurgent activities with later plans to betray and destroy them in hopes of a promotion. It was not uncommon for high-ranking officials to maintain private investments, with [Hiram Zataire](/wiki/Hiram_Zataire "Hiram Zataire") owning large plantations and a vineyard on Naboo, and Cassio Tagge being a member of the [House of Tagge](/wiki/House_of_Tagge "House of Tagge"), which held ownership of [TaggeCo](/wiki/Tagge_Corporation "Tagge Corporation") and its mining facility at Lucazec.[[222]](#cite_note-The_Rebellion_Begins-222)[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) One high ranking[[223]](#cite_note-Thrawn-223) Imperial officer[[224]](#cite_note-Visions_4-224) would serve as the [Minister of War](/wiki/Minister_of_War_(Galactic_Empire) "Minister of War (Galactic Empire)").[[223]](#cite_note-Thrawn-223)

 [![The Imperial Navy was tasked with maintaining order across the Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f9/ExecutorEscort-BTMF27.png/revision/latest?cb=20240908214123) [![The Imperial Navy was tasked with maintaining order across the Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f9/ExecutorEscort-BTMF27.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240908214123)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f9/ExecutorEscort-BTMF27.png/revision/latest?cb=20240908214123) 

The Imperial Navy was tasked with maintaining order across the Empire.

 

The Imperial Army and Navy were responsible for carrying out the Empire's military operations across the galaxy. Ostensibly dedicated to maintaining law and order,[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) Imperial Military forces came to be feared and fled from.[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41)[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135) Perhaps the most ubiquitously visible element were the Imperial [stormtroopers](/wiki/Stormtrooper "Stormtrooper"). These faceless soldiers were the enforcers of Imperial order, often exercising a "shoot-first" policy.[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2)[[41]](#cite_note-Episode_V-41)[[135]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-135) Having sworn their unquestioning loyalty to the Emperor above all, stormtroopers carried out many of the regime's worst crimes.[[225]](#cite_note-Rebels_Vs_Empire-225) Following the Battle of Endor, the Galactic Empire's martial forces began to suffer both resource and personnel shortages, ultimately forcing untrained and untested recruits to fill the front lines in the Imperial war effort, while the once-mighty Imperial Navy of thirteen [Super Star Destroyers](/wiki/Super_Star_Destroyer "Super Star Destroyer") was reduced to one, the *[Ravager](/wiki/Ravager "Ravager")*, which was ultimately destroyed during the Battle of Jakku.[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16) After the end of the [Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War") with the signing of the [Galactic Concordance](/wiki/Galactic_Concordance "Galactic Concordance"), the mobilization and training of stormtroopers was prohibited.[[17]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-17)

Tarkin noted an "institutionalized suspicion" within the Imperial Military, which he believed was used as a tool by Emperor Palpatine to control the various members of the Empire and its numerous organizations. There also existed an intense fear of the Emperor and Lord Vader, mainly due to harsh punishments, such as death or torture, if a task was not completed in time or resulted in failure. [Imperial patrol transports](/wiki/LAAT/le_patrol_gunship "LAAT/le patrol gunship") and stormtroopers were often utilized as the local police force for numerous worlds, while off-duty personnel could frequent local venues and neighborhoods after signing out of their local garrison. The euphemism "off-base, recreation," was used in the Imperial Military when referring to the visiting of various mistresses or [cantinas](/wiki/Cantina "Cantina") by personnel, while out of consideration it was common for duty officers to ask no questions about such escapades.[[69]](#cite_note-Lords_of_the_Sith-69) Members within the Imperial Army believed that those stationed farthest from the Imperial Center were deemed less important to the New Order, causing many to resent deployments on remote worlds such as [Belderone](/wiki/Belderone "Belderone").[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

 [![The Empire sterilized the Geonosian population, bringing the species to the brink of extinction.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9a/AphraGeonosis-2015DarthVader4.png/revision/latest?cb=20161204212914) [![The Empire sterilized the Geonosian population, bringing the species to the brink of extinction.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9a/AphraGeonosis-2015DarthVader4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161204212914)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9a/AphraGeonosis-2015DarthVader4.png/revision/latest?cb=20161204212914) 

The Empire sterilized the Geonosian population, bringing the species to the brink of extinction.

 

The Empire frequently ignored the [Galactic Accord of Systems](/wiki/Galactic_Accord_of_Systems "Galactic Accord of Systems"), effectively obliberating the rules it laid out[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) on how to wage war.[[6]](#cite_note-Timelines-6) The Empire conducted numerous atrocities, often resulting in genocide owing to the Empire's humanocentric tendencies. On Geonosis, the Empire sterilized the planet's native Geonosian population with heavy bombing.[[90]](#cite_note-A_New_Dawn-90)[[226]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_4-226) The Lasat homeworld of Lasan was ecologically destroyed by the later banned [T-7 ion disruptor rifles](/wiki/T-7_ion_disruptor_rifle "T-7 ion disruptor rifle"),[[227]](#cite_note-Droids_in_Distress-227) and the entire species was almost wiped out. Furthermore, to make advances in bio-warfare, Vice Admiral [Perwin Gedde](/wiki/Perwin_Gedde "Perwin Gedde") tested ancient diseases on captive worlds, raining sickness from sub-orbital battleships.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

A vast distribution network existed within the Empire, with numerous warehouses on various worlds holding thousands of biological agents. Biological testing was conducted on planets such as [Coyerti](/wiki/Coyerti "Coyerti") or against primitive indigenous populations and [Wookiee](/wiki/Wookiee "Wookiee") slaves.[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49) While most research and development went unhindered, a few initiatives went out of control. On [Dandoran](/wiki/Dandoran "Dandoran"), the accidental release of a highly contagious virus under the code name Project Blackwing—a clandestine effort seeking to uncover the secrets to immortality—ultimately led to an [outbreak](/wiki/Undead_Troopers_invasion "Undead Troopers invasion") across the planet.[[228]](#cite_note-Commander-228)

### Ideology[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [New Order](/wiki/New_Order "New Order"), [Commission for the Preservation of the New Order](/wiki/Commission_for_the_Preservation_of_the_New_Order "Commission for the Preservation of the New Order") and [Office of Imperial Promotion, Galactic Truth, and Fact Correction](/wiki/Office_of_Imperial_Promotion,_Galactic_Truth,_and_Fact_Correction "Office of Imperial Promotion, Galactic Truth, and Fact Correction")

:   "*There is no restraint or principle at the center of the New Order. And that is why people admire it. The Empire does all the things that people secretly believe should be done with power.*"
:   ―[Canonhaus](/wiki/Canonhaus "Canonhaus") thoughts on the New Order and the Galactic Empire[[229]](#cite_note-Final_Order-229)

 [![A propaganda poster featuring the Grand Inquisitor, leader of the Inquisitorius](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/Lead_the_Way_poster.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160314212517) [![A propaganda poster featuring the Grand Inquisitor, leader of the Inquisitorius](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/Lead_the_Way_poster.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20160314212517)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/Lead_the_Way_poster.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160314212517) 

A propaganda poster featuring the Grand Inquisitor, leader of the Inquisitorius

 

The [New Order](/wiki/New_Order "New Order") referred to the [political religion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secular_religion#Political_religion "wikipedia:Secular religion") and nationalist ideology of the Empire and the values of which it stood by. Numerous organizations were folded under COMPNOR, the Commission for the Preservation of the New Order. These included the Imperial Security Bureau, Coalition for Progress, Imperial Intelligence, and [CompForce](/wiki/CompForce "CompForce"), along with science divisions and youth education initiatives.[[12]](#cite_note-Dawn-12)[[97]](#cite_note-Imperial_Registration_Program-97)[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49)[[139]](#cite_note-Heir-139) [Rothwell](/wiki/Rothwell "Rothwell") once remarked that the Empire, as an institution, was unable to be swayed from whatever narrative it convinced itself of, even if it was not true.[[230]](#cite_note-Battles_for_Arena-230)

The Galactic Empire wielded a vast and powerfully effective propaganda machine to shift the opinions and cultures of numerous worlds across the galaxy. Celebrating the end of the destructive Clone Wars and the [creation of the New Order](/wiki/Proclamation_of_the_New_Order "Proclamation of the New Order"), the Emperor founded Empire Day as the national holiday of the Empire. The song "Glory of the Empire" served as the national anthem. Due to physical alterations to Palpatine to make him look younger and more appealing in broadcasts, many citizens did not know of the Emperor's scarred appearance,[[18]](#cite_note-Empire_Day_ep-18) nor did they comprehend that the galaxy was under the command of a Sith Lord.[[231]](#cite_note-Ultimate_SW-231)

 [![Stormtroopers were seen as brutal enforcers of Imperial suppression to the citizens of the outlier regions of the galaxy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/ImperialSuppression-SWLNewUniversalUpgrades.png/revision/latest?cb=20250718015013) [![Stormtroopers were seen as brutal enforcers of Imperial suppression to the citizens of the outlier regions of the galaxy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/ImperialSuppression-SWLNewUniversalUpgrades.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250718015013)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/ImperialSuppression-SWLNewUniversalUpgrades.png/revision/latest?cb=20250718015013) 

Stormtroopers were seen as brutal enforcers of Imperial suppression to the citizens of the outlier regions of the galaxy.

 

To enhance its legitimacy in the eyes of the people, the Empire used the [duel in Palpatine's office](/wiki/Duel_in_Palpatine%27s_office "Duel in Palpatine's office") to officially support the idea of a "Jedi Rebellion" occurring, and that the [Jedi Order](/wiki/Jedi_Order "Jedi Order") had attempted to stage a coup intent on taking control of the Republic, thus necessitating [Order 66](/wiki/Order_66 "Order 66"). In the years after the proclamation of the New Order, all remaining recordings of the [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") were removed, with many eventually believing and supporting the Emperor's version of events. However, individuals such as [Zaluna Myder](/wiki/Zaluna_Myder "Zaluna Myder") and even Luke Skywalker questioned the Empire's account of the events leading up to their destruction, while those who knew the Jedi in person could not bring themselves to believe in a Jedi-led coup.[[90]](#cite_note-A_New_Dawn-90)[[139]](#cite_note-Heir-139) Those who attempted to distribute independent publications could be punished with imprisonment without term.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87)

Nonetheless, with the end of the Clone Wars and the dismantling of the Separatist Droid Army, a renewed sense of peace and prosperity returned to the Core.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) This peace was aided by the efforts of the Coalition for Progress division of COMPNOR, who took note when artistic media appeared to undermine the Empire, using its authority in one instance to dismantle a statue of [Janyor](/wiki/Janyor "Janyor") of [Bith](/wiki/Bith "Bith") on the Outer Rim world of Garel,[[97]](#cite_note-Imperial_Registration_Program-97) or by banning subversive operas such as the [Song of Lojuun](/wiki/Song_of_Lojuun "Song of Lojuun")[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49) and sending members of the band [Hakko Drazlip and the Tootle Froots](/wiki/Hakko_Drazlip_and_the_Tootle_Froots "Hakko Drazlip and the Tootle Froots") to work in the mines of Kessel after a song with political undertones mocked Lord Vader, with the song being declared contraband as a result.[[139]](#cite_note-Heir-139)

As a regime, the Empire emboldened those who wanted to be cruel[[52]](#cite_note-Rebels_Visual_Guide-52)[[98]](#cite_note-Spark-98)[[232]](#cite_note-Ion_Control-232)[[233]](#cite_note-The_Witness-233) and excise power over others.[[98]](#cite_note-Spark-98)[[234]](#cite_note-Highlights-234) Many stormtroopers would take advantage of the Empire for their own personal gain, including using their station to take advantage of the helpless and those weaker than them.[[52]](#cite_note-Rebels_Visual_Guide-52) The regime was also one of imperialism, with the aim to become a universal superpower.[[235]](#cite_note-Cut_and_Run-235) The Sith drew power from the dark side[[3]](#cite_note-Episode_III-3) and fear in the population,[[2]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-2) as the Sith believed that fear was an important tool.[[31]](#cite_note-Episode_I-31) Even though Palpatine himself did not display bigotry to aliens, many of his citizens were. Their prejudice for alien groups turned alien groups into scapegoats for past troubles.[[223]](#cite_note-Thrawn-223)

### Security[]

#### Law Enforcement[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Imperial Security Bureau](/wiki/Imperial_Security_Bureau "Imperial Security Bureau"), [Imperial Intelligence](/wiki/Imperial_Intelligence "Imperial Intelligence"), [Imperial Office of Criminal Investigations](/wiki/Imperial_Office_of_Criminal_Investigations "Imperial Office of Criminal Investigations") and [Imperial Anti-Terrorism Watchline](/wiki/Imperial_Anti-Terrorism_Watchline "Imperial Anti-Terrorism Watchline")

:   "[…] *That is verbatim from the ISB mission statement, and wrong. Security is an illusion. You want security? Call the Navy. Launch a regiment of troopers. We are healthcare providers. We treat sickness. We identify symptoms. We locate germs whether they arise from within or have come from the outside. The longer we wait to identify a disorder, the harder it is to treat the disease.*"
:   ―[Partagaz](/wiki/Lio_Partagaz "Lio Partagaz"), to [Dedra Meero](/wiki/Dedra_Meero "Dedra Meero")[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70)

 [![A Coruscant Security Force police officer during the Imperial Era](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/UnderworldCop_Empire.png/revision/latest?cb=20140723231331) [![A Coruscant Security Force police officer during the Imperial Era](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/UnderworldCop_Empire.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20140723231331)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/UnderworldCop_Empire.png/revision/latest?cb=20140723231331) 

A Coruscant Security Force police officer during the Imperial Era

 

The [Imperial Security Bureau](/wiki/Imperial_Security_Bureau "Imperial Security Bureau") (Shortened to ISB) oversaw internal state security and ensuring the loyalty of citizens to the Empire,[[236]](#cite_note-RVG-236) with the task of maintaining stability throughout Imperial territories.[[215]](#cite_note-AbEverything-215) [Imperial Intelligence](/wiki/Imperial_Intelligence "Imperial Intelligence") provided services on their own accord,[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) and dealt primary with military matters,[[237]](#cite_note-CaM-237) such as threat reports, analysis, managing assets who were gathered information, and providing briefings to the [Joint Chiefs](/wiki/Joint_Chiefs_of_the_Imperial_Military "Joint Chiefs of the Imperial Military") and the [Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic Emperor").[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) It fell under the leadership of [Ubiqtorate](/wiki/Ubiqtorate "Ubiqtorate"), which was the leadership of [Imperial Intelligence](/wiki/Imperial_Intelligence "Imperial Intelligence").[[12]](#cite_note-Dawn-12) Some of the local planetary security forces also had some responsibility in regards to law enforcement.[[136]](#cite_note-One_Thousand_Levels_Down-136)[[168]](#cite_note-SE2-168)

Mining stations, deep-space outposts, or jails far from the cosmopolitan core often used [Imperial Navy Troopers](/wiki/Imperial_Navy_Trooper "Imperial Navy Trooper") as security personnel, who, while still imposing, commanded less respect than their stormtrooper brethren.[[49]](#cite_note-Twilight_Company-49) Vast trading posts, such as the [Ring of Kafrene](/wiki/Ring_of_Kafrene "Ring of Kafrene") in the [Thand sector](/wiki/Thand_sector "Thand sector"), used mainly stormtroopers to enforce law and order on its streets.[[132]](#cite_note-RO-132)

Private contracts were occasionally given to the [Bounty Hunters' Guild](/wiki/Bounty_Hunters%27_Guild "Bounty Hunters' Guild") and freelance [bounty hunters](/wiki/Bounty_hunter "Bounty hunter") to track down elusive elements within the Empire,[[96]](#cite_note-Vader_1-96) although this practice was largely frowned upon.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7) In order to support law enforcement communications, the Empire maintained the [Imperial Office of Criminal Investigations](/wiki/Imperial_Office_of_Criminal_Investigations "Imperial Office of Criminal Investigations"). The Office was responsible for the [Imperial Enforcement DataCore](/wiki/Imperial_Enforcement_DataCore "Imperial Enforcement DataCore"), which could only be accessed by authorized Imperial personnel or [licensed](/wiki/Imperial_Peace-Keeping_Certificate "Imperial Peace-Keeping Certificate") bounty hunters.[[238]](#cite_note-Ezra's_Gamble-238)[[50]](#cite_note-Rebel_Journal-50)

The [Ministry of Ingress](/wiki/Coruscant_Ministry_of_Ingress "Coruscant Ministry of Ingress") on Coruscant was the organization responsible for processing immigrants arriving on capital.[[239]](#cite_note-SWCL-239) The Empire also maintained an [Anti-Terrorism Watchline](/wiki/Imperial_Anti-Terrorism_Watchline "Imperial Anti-Terrorism Watchline") for civilian tips about "terrorist" sightings, such as if a civilian discovered a Rebel Alliance operation.[[240]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_2-240)

#### Legal system[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Imperial Penal Code](/wiki/Imperial_Penal_Code "Imperial Penal Code"), [Judicial Department](/wiki/Judicial_Department "Judicial Department") and [Department of Imperial Justice](/wiki/Department_of_Imperial_Justice "Department of Imperial Justice")

 [![An Imperial Judge on Niamos](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d0/Niamos_courthouse.png/revision/latest?cb=20221027132815) [![An Imperial Judge on Niamos](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d0/Niamos_courthouse.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20221027132815)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d0/Niamos_courthouse.png/revision/latest?cb=20221027132815) 

An Imperial Judge on Niamos

 

Shortly after the beginning of the Imperial Era, the Galactic Empire standardized and revised The galactic legal system[[241]](#cite_note-Scum_and_Villainy-241) by creating the [Imperial Penal Code](/wiki/Imperial_Penal_Code "Imperial Penal Code"), which introduced a tiered infraction system with [Class Five infractions](/wiki/Class_Five_infraction "Class Five infraction") being the least serious while [Class One Offenses](/wiki/Class_One_Offense "Class One Offense") were the most serious crimes. The penal code overrode local legislation and customs to ensure that Imperial interests were always primary, though the duty to try and incarcerate criminals often fell local [judges](/wiki/Judge "Judge") unless a crime had been actively been committed directly against the Galactic Empire.[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54) Despite a defense being allowed civil cases,[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) in trials against the Empire, defenses were actively disallowed.[[87]](#cite_note-Lost_Stars-87) In lesser criminal cases, defendants were sometimes given a brief opportunity to defend themselves after their charges were read out, though judges largely ignored these defenses and gave a guilty verdict without a second thought.[[77]](#cite_note-Announcement-77) No matter if criminals were tried via local or Imperial judges, those found guilty would regardless find themselves brought into the Imperial [prison](/wiki/Prison "Prison") system.[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54)

#### Prison system[]

 [![Inmates at their workstations in an Imperial factory facility](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Narkina_5_workroom_hq.png/revision/latest?cb=20230108164247) [![Inmates at their workstations in an Imperial factory facility](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Narkina_5_workroom_hq.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230108164247)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Narkina_5_workroom_hq.png/revision/latest?cb=20230108164247) 

Inmates at their workstations in an Imperial factory facility

 

Following the rise of the Galactic Empire, the new state inherited the various types of prisons from the Galactic Republic's vast and large [prison](/wiki/Prison "Prison") system. Yet even still, the Galactic Empire began constructing more bespoke and larger supermax prison facilities known as [Imperial factory facilities](/wiki/Imperial_factory_facility "Imperial factory facility") where inmates were used as laborers to fuel the Imperial war machine such as on Julibar, where inmates made the "toes" of [All Terrain Armored Transports](/wiki/All_Terrain_Armored_Transport "All Terrain Armored Transport"). While inmates who had committed serious offenses were either kept in isolation or simply executed, prisoners who had committed mid-level infractions, once assessed as labor worthy, were put to work in Imperial factory facilities as their sentences were long enough to learn specific tasks, but they still had the hope of one day being released. In reality however, release from the prison system was a façade, as one an inmate served their sentence, they would simply be transferred to another prison to continue their labor.[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54)

 [![A labor camp on Wobani](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/Wobani_Labor_Camp.png/revision/latest?cb=20180130034957) [![A labor camp on Wobani](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/Wobani_Labor_Camp.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180130034957)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/Wobani_Labor_Camp.png/revision/latest?cb=20180130034957) 

A labor camp on Wobani

 

Outside of Imperial factory facilities, the Empire also utilized traditional [Labor camps](/wiki/Labor_camp "Labor camp"), such as [one](/wiki/Imperial_Detention_Center_%26_Labor_Camp_LEG-817 "Imperial Detention Center & Labor Camp LEG-817") located on [Wobani](/wiki/Wobani "Wobani"). At these labor camps, the Empire could force prisoners to undertake any type of work, as prisoners believed they were working their way to freedom. The Empire often centralized the locations of prisons, keeping them near each other on so-called "prison worlds" such as the planet [Garen IV](/wiki/Garen_IV "Garen IV"). Despite many inmates simply being transferred to other prisons after their first sentence, some inmates were released.[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54) At labor camps, Stormtroopers were often used as guards,[[242]](#cite_note-Rogue_One-242) though at Imperial factory facilities, [guards](/wiki/Imperial_factory_facility_prison_guard "Imperial factory facility prison guard") and wardens wore black boiler suits with imperial insignia on the right upper arm and white markings along the left shoulder, arm, torso, and leg. The guards were additionally equipped with [zap rods](/wiki/Zap_rod "Zap rod") and [DH-17 blaster pistols](/wiki/DH-17_blaster_pistol "DH-17 blaster pistol"), though Imperial factory prisons were often understaffed. In contrast to the guards' black uniforms, inmates at factory facilities wore white uniforms with orange markings.[[243]](#cite_note-Narkina_5-243) Prisoners were brought to prisons via a modified variant of the [Imperial Troop Transport](/wiki/Imperial_Troop_Transport "Imperial Troop Transport") known as an [Imperial Prison Transport](/wiki/Imperial_Prison_Transport "Imperial Prison Transport")[[76]](#cite_note-SW_DORVG-76)

### Outside relations[]

#### With other governments[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Imperial Diplomatic Corps](/wiki/Imperial_Diplomatic_Corps "Imperial Diplomatic Corps")

:   "*It all boils down to one simple question, King Lee-Char. A question that only you, as leader of this planet, have the power to answer. Does Mon Cala wish to remain a part of the great Galactic Empire?*"
:   ―Ambassador Telvar, during negotiations with King Lee-Char[[212]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_(2017)_13-212)

 [![An Ambassador of the Galactic Empire](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/Telvar-2017DarthVader13.png/revision/latest?cb=20180315035903) [![An Ambassador of the Galactic Empire](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/Telvar-2017DarthVader13.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20180315035903)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/Telvar-2017DarthVader13.png/revision/latest?cb=20180315035903) 

An Ambassador of the Galactic Empire

 

The [Diplomatic Service](/wiki/Imperial_Diplomatic_Corps "Imperial Diplomatic Corps") of the Galactic Empire maintained outside relations with several independent affiliates and corporate entities. [Diplomats](/wiki/Diplomat "Diplomat") moved throughout the galaxy for negotiations and talks.[[12]](#cite_note-Dawn-12) However, the Empire was more than willing to assert its will[[212]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_(2017)_13-212) or take what it wanted by force if negotiations did not go its way.[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158) One of its affiliates was the Preox-Morlana, a corporate authority that [politically](/wiki/Politics "Politics") administered the [Free Trade sector](/wiki/Free_Trade_sector "Free Trade sector") and was left operated independently by the Empire. However, high-ranking officials of the Preox-Morlana would attend meetings with the Empire, while Imperial censuses would cover Preox-Morlana worlds.[[79]](#cite_note-Kassa-79) Imperial officials grew eager for a reason to directly take control of the sector.[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70) In 5 BBY,[[72]](#cite_note-Aldhani_Occupation_Date-72) that excuse came with the Preox-Morlana's failure to capture Cassian Andor on Ferrix, which exploded into a public enough failure that the Empire could annex its territory.[[70]](#cite_note-Aldhani-70)

The Galactic Empire also had diplomatic relations with the [Chiss Ascendancy](/wiki/Chiss_Ascendancy "Chiss Ascendancy") in the [Unknown Regions](/wiki/Unknown_Regions "Unknown Regions") of sorts through their mutual servant, Grand Admiral Thrawn.[[223]](#cite_note-Thrawn-223) Unknown to the [Chiss](/wiki/Chiss "Chiss"), however, the Emperor came to seek complete control over the Chiss Ascendancy.[[244]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Treason-244) The people of the ice moon Madurs were occupied by the Empire despite Prime Minister Dreand Yens thinking he could represent his people through diplomatic talks, during which he had declined the Empire's low offer for the moon's carnium supply. Only realizing how the Empire had set the stage for its operation, while he'd been distracted with lies about a new art expo and negotiations, after the fact, Yens later remarked that his people were wrapped up in chains while he was busy with "polite conversation."[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158)

#### With the criminal underworld[]

:   "*None of you think of yourselves as* servants*. You are* proud*. You have carved out dominions for yourselves in the* dark*, won battles of fire and blood. You have territory, wealth, followers dedicated to fulfilling your every whim! But this is* my *empire. Everything you have is due to my* indulgence*. You* do *serve.*"
:   ―Emperor Sheev Palpatine, to the heads of galactic criminal families[[62]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-62)

The Empire remained invested in and had a relationship with the criminal underworld. The criminal faction [Crimson Dawn](/wiki/Crimson_Dawn "Crimson Dawn"), while secretly under the control of Maul, maintained a working relationship with the Empire. According to [Enfys Nest](/wiki/Enfys_Nest "Enfys Nest") of the Cloud-Riders, the Dawn used its profits to terrorize countless systems alongside the Imperials. The Empire also was invested in the affairs of the Pyke Syndicate: when a slave revolt opened up on Kessel, an Imperial blockade was quickly dispatched to settle the uprising. Despite its investment in the criminal underworld,[[60]](#cite_note-Solo-60) the Empire would need to combat parts of it, which would distract from other campaigns like the war with the Rebel Alliance.[[59]](#cite_note-Aphra_(2016)_13-59)

Above all other syndicates, the Empire had a special relationship with the Hutt Clan, which was allowed to operate outside of Imperial law in return for certain valuable services. The relationship also saw the Empire protect the Hutt Clan's claim over [Hutt Space](/wiki/Hutt_Space "Hutt Space").[[61]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_1-61) While the Empire could be very demanding with the Hutts,[[140]](#cite_note-SW1-140) clan leader Jabba respected Emperor Palpatine and saw the importance of their work together.[[245]](#cite_note-WOTBH_5-245) Various other criminal groups desired the relationship with the Empire held by the Hutts, with a chance seeming to open up after the Hutt [attack on the *Executor*](/wiki/Attack_on_the_Executor "Attack on the Executor") manipulated into being by Crimson Dawn.[[61]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_1-61) Months later, Palpatine personally put an end to the [Syndicate War](/wiki/Syndicate_War "Syndicate War") by contacting the heads of various warring families, reminding them that they were all servants to his will: while they each had their own dominions, the galaxy overall was his to control, thus placing each crime lord under his rule as well. While he did promise any faction that could find Dawn leader Q'ira would rise in his estimation, his talk made it clear that each crime lord needed to think of themself as a servant to his will.[[62]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-62)

## Economy[]

### Overview[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main articles: [Credit](/wiki/Credit "Credit"), [Imperial Office of Customs](/wiki/Imperial_Office_of_Customs "Imperial Office of Customs") and [Kleptocracy](/wiki/Kleptocracy "Kleptocracy")

:   "*—we mustn't forget that we have the credits. The credits to spend how we see fit.*"
:   ―Arsin Crassus, financier, who thought that money was the solution to the Empire's problems[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16)

The Galactic Empire adopted a planned economy, whereby production and distribution of goods were centralized and directed in the immediate aftermath of the Clone Wars.[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) This policy of nationalization was called [imperialization](/wiki/Imperialization "Imperialization").[[4]](#cite_note-R1VD-4) Despite this, numerous third-party corporations were allowed to remain, with major loyalist companies Kuat Drive Yards and Sienar Fleet Systems producing the majority of the Empire's land and space-based craft. Companies aligned with the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars, such as the [Techno Union](/wiki/Techno_Union "Techno Union") and Trade Federation, were absorbed by the newly formed Empire, and all Federation accounts plundered by Imperial financier Arsin Crassus.[[64]](#cite_note-Uprising-64)[[16]](#cite_note-Aftermath-16) By 1 BBY, both [Incom Corporation](/wiki/Incom_Corporation "Incom Corporation") and the [Corellian Engineering Corporation](/wiki/Corellian_Engineering_Corporation "Corellian Engineering Corporation") had been nationalized.[[4]](#cite_note-R1VD-4)

Senator Mon Mothma stated that the Empire made use of [kleptocractic economics](/wiki/Kleptocracy "Kleptocracy"),[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46) which entailed those in power claiming riches for themselves like [thieves](/wiki/Thief "Thief"),[[246]](#cite_note-Pickpocket-246) all while the population was controlled via populist messaging, such as scaremongering[[46]](#cite_note-MaskFear-46) and propaganda.[[247]](#cite_note-Jedi:_Survivor-247) In truth, the average worker was able to be exploited,[[47]](#cite_note-Fallen_Order-47) particularly in the Outer Rim, so as to support the state and the wealthy. Among the population, it was the wealthy, particularly those in the Core Worlds,[[54]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-54) who the Empire was actually kind to.[[55]](#cite_note-SW_2020_46-55) In addition to the [Imperial Mining Institute](/wiki/Imperial_Mining_Institute "Imperial Mining Institute"), the Empire held a close association with Mining Guild.[[248]](#cite_note-DB_MG_Fighter-248)[[249]](#cite_note-DB_MG-249) Towards the end of the Galactic Civil War, Fleet Admiral Gallius Rax began to nationalize all aspects of the Imperial production chain in the months following Endor, but the attempt proved unable to save the dying Empire. The continued funding of the Imperial Military was hotly disputed. While briefly considered, it was decided that plundering the InterGalactic Banking Clan and other monetary bodies would plunge the galaxy into an economic depression.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

In 19 BBY, the Republic [credit](/wiki/Galactic_Credit_Standard "Galactic Credit Standard") was replaced by the Imperial credit, which became the standard [currency](/wiki/Currency "Currency") in circulation throughout the Empire. With the advent of the New Order, credits from the time of the Galactic Republic became worthless as they were phased out.[[250]](#cite_note-Crimson-250) Raising enough money for day-to-day life proved to be difficult for many Imperial citizens, yet the Empire's propaganda made the regime seem more prosperous than it actually was. In one recorded speech, Senator [Daho Sejan](/wiki/Daho_Sejan "Daho Sejan") blamed economic and security issues on "terrorists" who hid among everyday citizens.[[247]](#cite_note-Jedi:_Survivor-247) As of 9 BBY,[[251]](#cite_note-KenbiDate-251) the Empire's taxation of the Outer Rim had become oppressive.[[252]](#cite_note-Part_I-252) Since the Imperial credit was a fiat currency, credits from the Empire gradually lost their value following the formation of the New Republic.[[7]](#cite_note-Aftermath_LD-7)

### Infrastructure[]

:   "*The Empire sat at the center of the galaxy like an enormous black hole—forever sucking wealth and resources inward. Coruscant glittered while those at the edges suffered. Worlds who had nothing left to give were abandoned to their fate and allowed to go dark. This is how Palpatine and his many advisors viewed the natural hierarchy of their New Order.*"
:   ―Beaumont Kin, *The Rise and Fall of the Galactic Empire[[11]](#cite_note-Rise_Fall-11)*

A vast transportation network to connect Palpatine's vast Empire served as the primary means of both civilian and military transport. Interstellar commerce and warfare primarily occurred along one of several major [hyperspace lanes](/wiki/Hyperspace_route "Hyperspace route")—considered trans-galactic highways—with their knowledge and existence dating back to well before the former Galactic Republic. With the major trade routes considered safe for hyperspace travel, their control was vital for maintaining an effective means of defense and galactic dominance. In smaller systems, hyperspace beacons could transmit their coordinates, allowing starships to make quick jumps to and from the system. As a result, destroying them could hinder enemy mobility and response times. Serving this vast system were spaceports, facilities where starships would dock and refuel, restock and rearm. Spaceships serving as fuel stations also existed in the vastness of the galaxy, along with major shipping ports such as [Horizon Base](/wiki/Horizon_Base "Horizon Base").[[215]](#cite_note-AbEverything-215)[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9)

 [![An Imperial cargo ship docked at a space port](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/ff/Imperial_cargo_ship_docked.png/revision/latest?cb=20160317204453) [![An Imperial cargo ship docked at a space port](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/ff/Imperial_cargo_ship_docked.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20160317204453)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/ff/Imperial_cargo_ship_docked.png/revision/latest?cb=20160317204453) 

An Imperial cargo ship docked at a space port

 

Owing to the immense size of the Empire, a vast, complex logistical network was maintained by the Imperial hierarchy, and as a result was both immensely interconnected and extremely fragile. Locales such as [Mardona III](/wiki/Mardona_III "Mardona III") served as "warehouse worlds": planets turned storehouses for millions of metric tons of goods to fuel the Empire. [Imperial cargo ships](/wiki/Class_four_container_transport "Class four container transport") often transported these resources across the galaxy; slovenly and low-quality personnel, or fresh recruits just out of the Academy, often crewed these vessels, owing to their rather menial task.[[253]](#cite_note-The_Forgotten_Droid-253) The [T-44 landspeeder](/wiki/T-44_landspeeder "T-44 landspeeder") saw use by members of the Imperial Military for transport. Despite Imperial propaganda painting the picture of a government interested in uplifting life for all who fell under the Imperial flag,[[9]](#cite_note-Tarkin-9) the Imperial system, its taxation program, and general expansion were built around uplifting life in the Core Worlds, extracting the wealth of the outer regions and funneling it inward.[[11]](#cite_note-Rise_Fall-11)

As once noted by Lando Calrissian, the entire galaxy ran on Tibanna gas as a vital fuel source. As such, the Imperial annexation of Cloud City[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158) and Bespin overall was an advantage to the Empire.[[159]](#cite_note-Bounty_Hunters_3-159) After the Battle of Endor, the lockdown of the Anoat sector—where Tibanna gas was found in large quantities, such as on Bespin—proved to be a danger to the young New Republic, which suddenly was cut off from a major source of fuel in its earliest days. According to Calrissian's fears, the Empire would effectively keep itself in control of the galaxy by maintaining control over the galactic fuel supply, such as through its continued rule over Bespin. Mon Mothma and Leia Organa further suspected the Empire would attempt to take over vital resources—whether they be food, fuel, or building materials—in order to keep itself in control of the galaxy.[[158]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-158)

### Communications and media[]

#### Overview[]

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Imperial Holovision](/wiki/Imperial_Holovision "Imperial Holovision")

:   "*Citizen reporting has been a key tool in maintaining peace and order across the Empire.*"
:   ―[Alton Kastle](/wiki/Alton_Kastle "Alton Kastle")[[254]](#cite_note-HoloNet_News_Report_Press_Corps-254)
